They are all very happy with this opportunity to borrow money in Afghanistan. With this loan, they can collectively expand their businesses and make a better future for themselves and for their families.

loans.use: To purchase materials to expand their businesses.

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.en:
K. Muhabbat has only been a client of MicroInvest since 2009 but she describes herself as a serious and reliable client. Muhabbat is engaged in commercial service so she trades in material used for making the national dress. She works with direct suppliers from China and Iran. 

Muhabbat also is engaged in the livestock business.  The material selling business brings in her general income. Muhabbat has 6 years of experience in the material business. She is applying to Kiva for a business development loan of 1600 TJS for 6 months, to be used for importing new wares.

loans.use: Importing new dressmaking material

loans.name: Bonaventure

texts.en:
Greetings from Bonaventure N. from Nyarugenge! Bonaventure is requesting his first loan from Vision Finance Company so that he may buy another motorcycle taxi. He started this work in 1999. He works every day from 7:00am to 8:00pm and earns a monthly profit of approximately US $220. He is hoping that this loan will enable him to increase his profit so that he may build a house and more easily pay school fees for his dependent child.

Bonaventure is 33 years old, single, and takes care of an orphaned 8-year-old child. He is requesting a loan of 500,000 Rwandan Francs to be paid back over 8 months.

loans.use: To buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia Z. is a 58-year-old mother of five. Her husband is a carpenter, earning Php 200 a day. Lydia sells food for snacks to support the needs of the family. Her five sons are only secondary school graduates as she was not able to send them to college because the family income is not enough to support their tuition. She dreamt of sending them even to a vocational course but credit was not available in their place before.

Just this time she got an opportunity to get capital from ASHI (Ahon Sa Hitrap, Inc.) which has opened in their village. She is applying for her first loan to be used in buying ice cubes, refined sugar, a water jug, plastic glasses and spoons, pineapple liquid, sticks, and condensed milk. She wants to grab this summertime to earn an income. She hopes that in the future, she can sell different food snacks to have a regular income.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for ice scrumble (a crushed-ice drink)

loans.name: Shuhratjon

texts.en:
Shuhratjon A. first applied to MicroInvest in 2004. He described himself as a serious and reliable client who trusts the MicroInvest loan procedure and hopes for long-term co-operation. Thanks to the previous loans he was able to improve significantly the livestock business terms.

Shuhratjon has been engaged in the livestock business for 5 years and he has the appropriate skills to increase the existing flock. Shuhratjon also works as a security guard in a factory but the love of raising animals brings him to the livestock business. Shuhratjon is applying to Kiva for a business support loan of 4000 Tajikistan Somonis for 5 months to be used for the purchase of a pedigreed bull.

loans.use: Purchase of a pedigreed bull

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Greetings from Josephine N. from Nyarugenge! Josephine is requesting her first loan from Vision Finance Company so that she may expand her business of selling clothes.

She started this kind of business in 2004. She works 6 days a week from 7:30 am to 6:00 pm and earns a monthly profit of approximately US $330. She is hoping that this loan will enable her to increase her profit so that she may pay school fees for her children. Josephine is 37 years old; she is married with 2 children. Josephine is requesting a loan of 500,000 Rawandan Francs to be paid back over 8 months.

loans.use: Expand the business

loans.name: Abdugappar

texts.en:
K. Abdugappar lives in the B.Gafurov region of Tajikistan and he is married and has 3 children. Abdugappar works as a tractor driver but his livestock business brings in the general family income. He has a milk cow and five rams. Abdugappar has been engaged in livestock for 12 years and he is skilled enough in the livestock business to have a big flock.

Abdugappar applies to Kiva for a business support loan of 4000 STJ for 5 months to build a new summer cow barn. He thanks Kiva for its support and invites you to Tajikistan.

loans.use: To build a new summer cow barn

loans.name: Mohammad Hamad Group

texts.en:
M. hamad is the group leader of the M. hamad group. There are four members in this group. They all live in District 15 of Kabul, Afghanistan. The total amount that the group members want to loan is 20,000 AFN. Each member wants to take the loan to improve his or her business.

M. hamad and Bibi Satara want to take a loan for their fruit-cart business.They want to buy necessary materials for their business.

Bibi Afghan and Syweta want to take a loan for their tailoring business. They want to buy three new machines for their business.

They all want to say that, with the loan, they will be able to get on well and also improve their businesses.

loans.use: To expand and improve their businesses

loans.name: Nodirakhon

texts.en:
D. Nodirakhon is a hard-working entrepreneur from Isfara, a city in North Tajikistan. She and her husband, have three children.

She runs a business where she sells women’s galoshes and the national women’s top-boot called “Massi”. Nodirakhon started her business 15 years ago and has run it with both extreme care and seriousness. It is an important source of income for her family of five.

Nodirakhon has requested a loan of $800 so that she can purchase additional goods and continue to develop her business. Thanks to this loan, she will be able to grow her business further and help feed her family.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and for it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after Tajikistan’s independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new goods to increase her stock

loans.name: Abdumutalim

texts.en:
G. Abdumutalim has worked as a cable man for two years. He is married and the father of two children and he started his business in order to support his wife and children.

Abdumutalim provides the service of installing dish antennas. His plans are to increase his business and invest in tools so he can provide better service to his customers. So Abdumutalim began working with IMON International three years ago and has received a total of three loans that he has used to increase his business and to purchase tools.

His most urgent need is to purchase tools as they are extremely expensive and he doesn't have enough money to buy them.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and for it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after Tajikistan’s independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase the necessary tools to install antenna dishes

loans.name: Abduvahob

texts.en:
K. Abduvahob is 42 years old and lives with his wife and two children. He owns a minibus which generates the income necessary to support his family.

Abduvahob needs this loan to buy spare parts to keep the vehicle in good working condition, as this is how he makes his living. This will allow him to perform his work better, so as to save more money in order to provide for his family.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts in order to repair his minibus

loans.name: Hamdam

texts.en:
N. Hamdam has a minivan and provides transportation services. Being involved in this business for three years he has gained much experience. Initially he rented a car, but in time, after making certain savings, he bought his own minivan. The business is stable and generates the main income for Hamdam’s family allowing improvement in their living conditions.

Currently, his minivan needs some repairs. That’s why he needs a loan of $1000 to purchase spare parts. Hamdam thanks everyone supporting him and promises to repay the loan in nine months with promptness. The well-being of this family is in your hands.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts in order to repair his minivan

loans.name: Abdulaziz

texts.en:
P. Abdulaziz has always been a hard-working man who has made sure, from a young age, that his family never goes without their daily bread. He is married with two children.

Abdulaziz has a grocery store where he sells different kinds of foodstuffs. He began this enterprise eight years ago with a starting capital of $600, thanks to his perseverance and dedication. Over time he expanded his business and today this business has become domestic and his son (pictured) helps him with the business.

Today he needs to buy additional foodstuffs for increasing the range of his goods. For this purpose, Abdulaziz is requesting a loan of $1100 for the term of 12 months. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once in awhile to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to increase the range of goods

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi: Chị Lê Thị Lợi năm nay 44 tuổi. Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2003Vòng vốn đầu tiên chị vay 2.000.000đ để đầu tư buôn bán hàng tạp hoá . Đến nay sau 5 vòng vốn sử dụng hiệu quả gia đình chị đã có thêm điều kiện để đầu tư làm thêm nghề say sát gạo. Với thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng  từ kinh doanh, làm nghề say sát gạo gia đình chị Lợi đang ngày càng có thêm điều kiện để cải thiện cuộc sống.Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 17.000.000đ để đầu tư  vốn cho công việc buôn bán  và đầu tư mua thêm một số dụng cụ phục vụ cho công việc say sát gạo của gia đình
texts.en:
Mrs Le Thi L. is 44 years old. She has joined TYM Fund since 2003. She used her first loan of 2,000,000 VND (115 USD) to buy inventories for her sundry goods store. After efficient uses of five loans, Mrs. L. and her family have been able to start another job: to husk rice. With the monthly income of 3,000,000 VND (or 172 USD) from these two jobs combined, Mrs. L.'s family's life has been much improved. This time she would like to borrow 17,000,000 VND (or 975 USD) to have more funds investing in her store and buy a few more tools to husk rice.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bussiness

loans.name: Ozodakhon

texts.en:
Ozodakhon T. lives in the town of Isfara in the Sugd region of Tajikistan. Her husband works far away from home, currently in Russia. Together they have two school-aged children. Ozodakhon has to spend a lot of money on their education because her husband doesn’t earn enough. She cares for two cows, and would now like to borrow $1200 USD to buy more calves. In this way she hopes to earn more and cover all her dear children's expenses.

More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. loans.use: To purchase calves

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị M. 45 tuổi. Gia đình chị có 3 con trong đó có 2 con đã trưởng thành và 1 con đang đi học. Năm 2006 chị thma gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn. Hiện tại đây vẫn là công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị với thu nhập 2.000.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để tiếp tục đầu tư cho công việc chăn nuôi lợn của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs Nguyen Thi M. is 45 years old. She has 3 children, 2 of them are grown-ups and the youngest one is still going to school. In 2006, she joined TYM Fund (Kiva Partner in Vietnam) and borrowed money to invest in raising pigs. Currently this is the main source of income for her family, which is about 2,000,000 VND per month (or 117 USD per month). Mrs. M. would like to borrow 9,000,000 VND (or 600 USD) to continue to invest in raising pigs.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Thương  40  tuổi. Gia đình chị có 3 con trong đó có 1 con đang đi học. Năm 2006 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi b ò. Hiện tại đây vẫn là công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị với thu nhập 2.000.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để tiếp tục đầu tư mua th êm b ò v ề nu ôi.
texts.en:
Mrs Nguyen Thi T. is 40 years old. She has 3 children, one of them is still going to school. In 2006, she joined TYM Fund (Kiva Partner in Vietnam) to have funds investing in raising cows. Currently this is the main source of income for her family, which is about 2,000,000 VND per month (or 117 USD per month). This time she wants to borrow 9,000,000 VND (or 525 USD) to buy more cows for her farm.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising

loans.name: Abdulahad

texts.en:
Since he was very young, Abdulahad S. has felt connected to the countryside. His family dedicated themselves to cultivating fruits and vegetables, and from childhood he imagined he would be in the business of selling produce. Fortunately, he realized this dream, and at the age of 20, he began to sell vegetables in small markets. Meanwhile, little by little, he was saving money so he could set up his own shop. Thanks to his efforts and the love he has for this work, Abdulahad’s business has been growing gradually. Now Abdulahad believes it is time to inject more capital into the business so that he can buy at wholesale and obtain better prices. As a result, he is requesting a loan of $1950 USD. With your help, Abdulahad will be able to move his business forward and offer his wife and two children a better future.    

More about Tajikistan

It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: To increase his range of vegetables

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is a widow with two children. She owns a kiosk at one of the markets in the city of Zaporozhye, from which she sells women's shoes. Tatyana has been in this business for ten years, and the main key to her success is offering a good assortment of shoes. Flexible discount policy also helps Tatyana to retain repeat customers. This business is the only source of income for her family.

Tatyana would like to borrow 10 900 UAH to purchase a spring collection of shoes. Additional income would help her to raise her two children and better provide for their needs.

loans.use: To increase the variety of shoes she sells

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Ch ị Nguy ễn Thị M. năm nay 29 tuổi, chị đang sống cùng chồng và hai con nhỏ t ại huy ện Nghi Lộc tỉnh Nghệ An. Chị  M. tham gia Quỹ Tình thương từ năm 2006. V ò ng vốn đầu chị M. vay 2.000.000 đ để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn. Đến nay nhờ có th êm nguồn vốn vay qua c ác vòng vốn gia đình chị đã đầu tư nuôi thêm v ịt. Hi ện t ại v ới thu nh ập 2.500.000 đ/ th áng cuộc sống gia đình chị M. đang ngày càng ổn định hơn.
V òng v ốn t ới ch ị mong muốn được vay 8.000.000 đ để đầu  tư  mua thêm vịt và thức ăn phục vụ cho chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị M., 29 years old, lives with her husband and two young children in Nghi Lộc district, Nghệ An province. Mrs. M. has participated in the TYM Fund since 2006. She used her first loan of 2,000,000 VND (119 USD) to invest in raising pigs. Since then, in later lending cycles she and her family were able to use loans to invest in raising ducks. Currently, with an income of 2,500,000 VND (148 USD) per month, their lives are gradually becoming more secure. In the next round of lending, she hopes to borrow 8,000,000 VND (475 USD) to buy more ducks and animal feed.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising ducks

loans.name: Ehson

texts.ru: Эхсон - молодой мужчина 29 лет. Женат и имеет 3-х детей. Эхсон занимается продажей разного вида масла на рынке Панчшанбе. Его жена домохозяйка. Эхсон единственный человек в семье, который зарабатывает деньги, чтобы прокормить свою семью. Он закупает товар у оптовиков в этом-же рынке и целый день продает товар в розницу. Этим он зарабатывает на жизнь, чтобы прокормить своих детей и дать им образование. За эти 2 года он расширил свой бизнес, и за каждый займ благодарит организацию за помощь.
texts.en:
Ehson is a young man of 29. He is married and has three children. Ehson sells various kinds of cooking oil at the Panchshanbe market. His wife is a housewife. Ehson is the only person in the family to earn money to feed the family. He buys goods wholesale and all day long sells them retail. Doing so, he is able to earn a living in order to feed his children and give them an education. In the past two years he has expanded his business and is grateful to the organization for the assistance provided with each loan.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Retail sale of cooking oil

loans.name: Mahmadrasul

texts.en:
B. Mahmadrasul is 45 years old. He is married with four children. He has his own grocery store where he sells different kinds of foodstuffs like macaroni, cookies, soft drinks, juices, tea, detergents and many others. He started this business 14 years ago with a small inventory of foodstuffs and, over time, he expanded his business and now his business has become very successful.

Today, Mahmadrasul is requesting a loan of $2600 to increase his stock. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. One of his dreams is that his children progress by means of their studies, for which he is doing the best he can. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs to increase the range of his goods

loans.name: Muzaffar

texts.ru: Музаффар Собиров 1973 года рождения, женат имеет 3 детей. Образование среднее. Опыт работы в торговле 9 лет.  Музаффар сотрудничает  с 2006 года. Он получил кредит для расширения бизнеса. Торгует напитками  в магазине. Также есть холодильник , где держит мороженое. Зимой торговля идет не так хорошо, но сейчас напитки и вскоре будет сезон и покроет те расходы которые он совершил зимой. В начале он продавал мелочами, теперь за счет кредит расширил магазин, за это он благодарен Микроинвест и за поддержку КИВА.
texts.en:
Muzaffar S. was born in 1973. He is married and has three children. He completed secondary school and has nine years of experience in sales. Muzaffar has collaborated with MicroInvest since 2006, when he received a loan to expand his business. He sells alcoholic beverages and soft drinks in a store. There is also a freezer where ice cream is kept. Over the winter sales were not good, but soon it will be the time of year when the sale of beverages will pick up and cover the expenditures he made over the winter. He started out selling small items, but with access to credit was able to expand the store. He is grateful to MicroInvest for the loans and to Kiva for the support.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expansion

loans.name: Mislima

texts.en:
A. Mislima is 45 years old. She is married with two children of school age. Mislima sells the fabrics for sewing the national dresses. She has been in this business for almost 10 years.

Mislima has a very good taste and she is ready to advise her clients which textiles to choose for this or that occasion. That is why she has her repeat customers. Moreover Mislima’s prices for fabrics are attractive for various levels of the population as she has a wide range of goods for any taste and any wallet. The income that she derives allows her to educate her children. She hopes that she can continue to provide for them so they will be able to receive an adequate education.

Now Mislima needs $1300 for purchasing new fabrics in order to increase the range of her goods. She promises to pay the loan without any violation and expresses her gratitude to everyone supporting her.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit:  www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new fabrics in order to increase the range of her goods

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya is married with two children. She sells children's clothing at one of the markets in Zaporozhye city. She has invested 20,000 UAH in her inventory and her profit is 2,000 UAH per month.

Natalya has been in this business for ten years. She is a very open, sincere and responsible person. She says that business loans help her to purchase inventory in bulk and increase the assortment. This brings more customers to her kiosk and increases the sales.

Natalya would like to borrow 7,200 UAH to purchase more inventory. She is going to spend the additional profit to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy assorted children's clothes for retail

loans.name: Todjiddin

texts.en:
Todjiddin M., 25 and single, comes from a very large family, so  to support his parents, he has been running his own business for four years selling perfume for women,  cologne for men, air fresheners, tooth pastes and brushes. Todjiddin has been a client of IMON since June of 2007 and has always met his repayments on time. Today Todjiddin is requesting $1300 to expand his business and increase his working capital.  He would like to thank all supporting him and promises to repay the loan in nine months.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes:  its role as a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous, and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment, forcing hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To increase the range of goods he carries.

loans.name: Toshtemir

texts.ru: Тоштемир Байниязов - мужчина 48 лет. Вдовец. Отец 5-х детей. Тоштемир воспитывает их в одиночку а также занимается откормом и продажей скота. Его жена умерла несколько лет назад, о чем он не хотел вспоминать, так как ему грустно. Тоштемир единственный человек в семье, который зарабатывает деньги, чтобы выдать замуж двоих дочерей. Он закупает скот на рынке и откармливая 2-3 месяца продает на том же рынке. Этим он зарабатывает на жизнь, чтобы прокормить своих детей. Он очень рад, что есть такие организации, поддерживающие низшее общества.
texts.en:
Toshtemir B. is a 48 year old man. He is a widower and the father of 5 children. Toshtemir raises them on his own and also raises and sells livestock. His wife passed away several years ago, something he does not like to think about because it makes him sad. Toshtemir is the only person in his family who earns money in order to marry off his two daughters. He purchases livestock at the market and fattens them for 2-3 months after which he sells them at the same market. This way he earns a living and feeds his children. He is very happy that there are organizations such as this that support the lower class.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raise livestock

loans.name: Sobira

texts.en:
Sobira B. is 44 years old. She is divorced and has two children. Sobira has been running a grocery store for the past eleven years. She sells sweets, preserved food, juices, soft drinks, and many other items in her grocery. The inventory she has for sale is of very good quality and selection. Sobira is respectful and patient with all of her customers and this attracts people and brings them back to her vending facility to buy groceries again. 

Sobira is seeking to keep her business sustainable and has requested a loan of $1325 to increase the inventory she has for sale. We believe this current loan will enhance the potential of her business and help Sobira reach all of her aspirations.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and for its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi, and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History

Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase an increased range of goods for resale.

loans.name: Abdukayum

texts.ru: Абдукаюм Мамидов 1965 года рождения, женат имеет 5 детей. Образование среднее. Абдукаюм выращивает с детства скот. Из скотов у него козы и овцы, они выдерживают зиму, чем коровы. Весной он сажает в своем огороде овощи и корневые продукты. Для продажи и для себя. В их селе почти все обеспечены , овощами, молоком и мясом. Потому что у всех есть и огород так и скот. Также он работает фермером в одном из колхозе. Кредит получает на покупку скота. О кредите узнал у соседей.
texts.en:
Abdukayum M. was born in 1965, he is married and has 5 children. He has a high school education. Abdukayum has been raising livestock since childhood. He has goats and sheep, they handle winters better than cows. In the summer he plants vegetables and root vegetables in his garden – for himself and for sale. In his village almost everyone has enough vegetables, milk and meat, because everyone has a garden and livestock. In addition, he works as a farmer at one of the collective farms. He is taking out a loan to purchase livestock. He found out about the loan from neighbors.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of livestock

loans.name: Khairullo

texts.en:
Khairullo M. is 40 years old. He is married with three children. His wife is a housekeeper. For more than three years, he has been running a small café in which he cooks national dishes. The business generates a stable income to support his family and improve their living conditions.

Today, Khairullo is requesting $800 for a term of twelve months. He is planning to purchase inventory like dishes, tables, and chairs in order to expand his business and improve the conditions of his small café for his clients. Khairullo would like to thank everyone for their support.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and for its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi, and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase new dishes, chairs, and tables to expand his café.

loans.name: Ranodjon

texts.en:
Ranodjon P. is a widowed mother of two children. She sells kids' clothing in the central market of Dushanbe. She sells a wide variety of merchandise at reasonable prices. Ranodjon has been in this trade for nine years. She is trying to do everything she can to provide for her family and give her children a decent education. That is why she wants to continue expanding her business and grow her trade by increasing the number of her vending locations.

Ranodjon is requesting a loan of $650 to sustain her business and help ensure that it continues to provide enough income on which her family can live.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and for its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi, and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase new goods to increase her stock.

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru: Замира – женщина 40 лет. Замужем и мать 2-х детей. Занимается продажей детской одежды на рынке Фаровон г. Гафурова. Её муж работает подсобником мастера отделки и ремонта квартир. В зимнее время такого вида работы очень мало. Но летом он будет зарабатывать лучше. Замира тоже старается вложить свою долю в бюджет семьи и повысить уровень жизни своей семьи. Замира закупает товар на оптовом рынке города Истаравшан. Цель ее займа является расширение ассортимента ее товара. Она очень надеется что кредитование поможет для достижения ее цели.
texts.en:
Zamira is a 40 year old woman. She is married and is the mother of 2 children. Zamira sells children’s clothing at the Farovon market in Gafurov. Her husband works as an assistant to a contractor who finishes and repairs apartments. In the winter there are very few jobs like this, but in the summer he will have better earnings. Zamira also tries to contribute her share to the family budget and to increase the quality of life for her family. She purchases products at the wholesale market in Istarashvan. The goal of her loan is to increase her product assortment. She has high hopes that the loan will help her to reach her goal.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase product assortment

loans.name: Hotam

texts.ru: Клиент Махрамов Хотам в возросте 70 лет, проживает в районе Руми. Женат имеет троих детей, имеет среднее образования.Клиент занимается животноводством уже более 13 лет.В данный момент клиент имеет нескольео крупных бычков. На полученные деньги, клиент хочет купить нескольеъко молодых телят,откормить и перепродать.От этого вида деятельности клиент имеет доход, этот доход позволяет содержать  семью.
texts.en:
Client Hotam M. is 70 years old, he lives in the J. Rumy region. He is married and has 3 children; he has a high school education. The client has been raising animals for more than 13 years. Right now he has several large bulls. He would like to use the received money to purchase several young calves, fatten them and resell them. The client earns an income from this business. This income allows him to support his family.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase calves

loans.name: Marhamat

texts.ru: Мархамат – женщина 39 лет. Замужем и мать 3-х детей. Имеет среднее образование. Занимается выпечкой и продажей кондитерских изделий на рынке Панчшанбе города Худжанда. Её муж работает в конторе, где небольшая зар.плата. Мархамат у себя дома печет разные виды сладостей (печенья, вафли, пряники) и продает их на рынке. Мархамат хотела, бы кроме своей выпечки еще перепродавать импортные конфеты и сладости. Для этого она предпочла взять займ для расширения своего ассортимента.
texts.en:
Marhamat is a 39 year old woman. She is married and is the mother of 3 children. She has a high school education. Marhamat bakes and sells baked goods at the Panchshabe market in Khujand. Her husband works in an office where the salary is low. Marhamat bakes a variety of baked goods at her home (cookies, wafers, gingerbread) and sells them at the market. Marhamat would like to sell imported candy and sweets in addition to her baked goods. She decided to take out a loan in order to increase her product assortment.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase candy and sweets for resale

loans.name: Raihonoi

texts.ru: Райхоной – молодая женщина 27 лет, замужем и мать одного ребенка. Её муж занимается купле -продажей скота на скотном рынке. А она откармливает крупнорогатый скот дома. У нее есть дойная корова, которая дает молоко для их семьи и ребенка. Она помогает мужу в развитии его бизнеса, так как молодая семья нуждается в большей прибыли. За счет займа они хотят увеличить количество скота и  получить больше прибыли.
texts.en:
Raihonoi is a young, 27 year old woman, she is married and has one child. Her husband purchases and sells livestock at the livestock market and she fattens large livestock at home. Raihonoi has a dairy cow who provides milk for their family and child. She helps her husband in growing his business, since a large family needs a lot of income. They would like to use their loan to increase their livestock headcount and increase their income.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase livestock

loans.name: Joriev

texts.ru: Джориев Носир проживает в районе Джаллоллидини Руми. Возраст 38 лет, женат и имеет четверых детей. Образования не имеет . Но уже всю свою жизнь занимается животноводством. Разводит породистых животных для реализациии на мясо. Имеет хозяйство. Кредит планирует получить для того, чтобы купить породистого быка производителя. Это поможет ему получать качественное потомство.Таким образом его бизнес будет развиваться в лучшую сторону,а для населения он сможет  производить качественное мясо.
texts.en:
Joriev Nosir lives in the J. Rumy region. He is 38 years old, is married and has four children. He does not have an education, but he has raised livestock for his entire life. He raises thoroughbred animals for meat. He has a farm. He plans to take out a loan in order to purchase a thoroughbred breeding bull. This will help him to get quality descendants. This way his business will develop positively and he will be able to produce quality meat for the surrounding population.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a breeding bull

loans.name: Ahmadjon

texts.ru: Султонов Ахмаджон проживает в районе Джалоллидини Руми. Возраст 30 лет , женат , но детей не имеет.Образования не имеет. Занимается земледелием. Имеет участок земли , который засеивает пшеницей и другими злаковыми культурами. Занимается этим видом дела уже 10 лет. Получаемый урожай продает на рынке , но частично оставляет для себя и своей семьи. Для того, чтобы закупить семена пшеницы и удобрения решил обратиться за кредитом к нам. Это поможет ему своевременно купить качественные семена и удобрения, что даст возможность получить качественный урожай и обеспечить рынки качественной пшеницей.
texts.en:
Ahmadjon S. lives in the J. Rumy region. He is 30 years old, is married, but does not have children. He is a farmer. He has a plot of land where he plants wheat and other cereal crops. He has been in this business for 10 years now. He sells his harvest at the market, but keeps part of it for himself and his family. In order to purchase wheat seeds and fertilizer he decided to turn to us for credit. This will help him to purchase quality seeds and fertilizer when it is time and to collect a quality harvest and provide markets with quality wheat.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Qudratullo

texts.ru: Давлатшоев Кудратулло житель Кумсангирского района . Женат и имеет двоих детей. Возраст 33 года.Занимается земледелием и семью обеспечивает благодоря этому бизнесу. Он сеет злаки , которые потом реализует на рынке. Этим бизнесом он заниается уже 9 лет. Кредит планирует получить для того,чтобы закупить семена и удобрения для посева.
texts.en:
Qudratullo D. is a resident of the Qumsangir region. He is married and has two children. He is 33 years old. Qudratullo is a farmer and provides for his family thanks to this business. He plants cereals which he then sells at the market. He has been in this business for 9 years now. He plans to get a loan in order to purchase seeds and fertilizer for planting.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds and feritilizer

loans.name: Valeriu

texts.en:
Valeriu is a farmer. He has been working in agriculture since 1990. Valeriu's grandfather was also a farmer and he learned many things from him.

Valeriu has three children, who are still students and they all want to achieve higher education. For this their father is ready to do everything. He decided to start up a business growing plums all year. For this business, Valeriu needs money to build greenhouses at his home to launch this business. He would like to borrow from Microinvest to buy wood and film.

loans.use: To buy wood and film.

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru: Зарипова Мавлюда проживает в районе Джалоллидини Руми.Замужем и имеет двоих детей. У них семейный бизнес с мужем. Они вместе работают в сфере животноводство. Она занимается откормкой и уходом за бычками, а он режет скотину и продает ее на рынке. в данный момент она обратилась к нам за кредитом для того, чтобы купить молодого бычка. Это поможет им увеличить товарооборот.Кроме того они смогут больше обеспечить рынки свежим мясом.
texts.en:
Mavluda Z. lives in the J. Rumy region. She is married and has two children. She together with her husband has a family business. They work together raising livestock. She fattens and takes care of bulls and he butchers livestock and sells it at the market. At this moment she has turned to us for credit in order to purchase a young bull. This will help them to increase their turnover. In addition, they will be able to provide markets with fresh meat.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a bull

loans.name: Hojikurbon

texts.ru: Одинаев Ходжикурбон проживает в районе Хуросон. Возраст 52 года, женат. Имеет шестерых детей.Старшие сыновья работают , занимаються частным предпринимательством. Младшие дети помогают по хозяйству. Сам клиентк работает в сельском хозяйстве. имеет собственный участок земли , который засеевает овощами . Кредит планирует получить и использовать его для того, чтобы закупить рассаду , удобрения и горюче-смазочный материал.Это даст возможность не приостанавливать свою деятельность в связи с нехваткой финансов.
texts.en:
Hojikurbon O. lives in a Hurson region. He is 52 years old, married, and has 6 children. His elder sons have their own business. Meanwhile, his younger children help the family with maintenance of their household. Hojikurban himself is involved in agriculture. He owns a piece of land, which he uses to plant vegetables. He plans to use the loan to purchase seedlings, fertilizer, and lubricants. This gives him an opportunity not to interrupt his business because of shortage of funding.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Valentin

texts.en: Mr. D. currently owns five hectares of arable land. On the arable land, Valentin grows plums that he sells on the agricultural market. He sells the harvest of plums to exporters of table plums. He also brings some of the plums home to produce jam. He then sells the jam during difficult financial periods. He has run this business for three years already. Business is profitable, but Valentin wants to increase his profitability with new seedlings.

loans.use: To increase profitability through new seedlings.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
La señora Martha vive en casa propia con su esposo e hijos en la calle Mario Mercado de la zona de Llojeta de la ciudad de La Paz; dentro de la casa tienen un taller de cerrajería donde trabaja ella con su esposo elaborando jaladores y mesas centrales de fierro, que una vez terminadas, la esposa acomoda en diferentes ferreterías y mueblerías de la ciudad.

El crédito que solicitan es para compra de materia prima ( fierro) para seguir con esta actividad que es su principal fuente de ingresos.


Martha es clienta antiguo de Impro y por la actividad califica para obtener un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Martha lives in her own home with her husband and children on Mario Mercado Street in the Llojeta zone in the city of La Paz. They have a metal shop in their home. She works with her husband making door handles and iron tables. Once they have finished making these items, her husband takes them to various hardware and furniture stores in the city. The loan is to buy raw material (iron) to continue this work which is their principal source of income. Martha is a long time customer of Impro, and her business activity qualifies her to receive a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy iron for her business of making door handles and iron tables.

loans.name: Sulema

texts.es:
Sulema  vive en la calle “ Felipe López ”  de la zona Franz Tamayo en la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Ella es soltera, vive junto a su madre y hermanos.
 
Trabaja como auxiliar en una pequeña oficina de venta de materiales de construcción, por las tardes  trabaja con una de sus tías en la venta, por comisión,  de productos dietéticos en el centro de la ciudad.
 
El crédito lo destinara en la adquisición de productos dietéticos y así incrementar sus ventas, por lo tanto sus comisiones
 
Es el primer   crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Sulema lives on “Felipe López” street in the Franz Tamayo zone of the city of El Alto. She is single, and she lives with her mother and siblings. She works as an assistant in a small office that sells construction materials. In the afternoons she works in the center of the city with one of her aunts selling dietary products on commission. The loan is to acquire dietary products and increase her sales which will then increase her commissions. This is her first loan with Impro. An evaluation shows that she qualifies for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more dietary products to sell and earn commissions.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria vive en la Avenida “ Civica” de  la zona Villa Tejada Rectangular. en la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Vive junto a sus hijas menores, ya que su esposo trabaja como chofer de transporte a larga distancia, lo cual le obliga a estar constantemente de viaje.

Trabaja en la confección de polleras para señoras,  las cuales vende a los intermediarios, en las distintas ferias de la cuidad. 

El crédito lo destinará  para compra de telas al por mayor y asi poder incrementar su producción.
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo
texts.en:
Victoria lives on “Civica” Avenue in the Villa Tejada Rectangular zone in the city of El Alto. She lives with her younger sisters as her husband works as a long distance transport driver, and he is always away. She makes skirts for women. She sells them to vendors at different fairs in the city. The loan is to buy wholesale fabric and be able to increase her production. This is her first loan with Impro, but the evaluation shows that she qualifies for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric for her business of making women's skirts.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria vive en la  calle “Bolivar” de la zona de Rio Seco en la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Ella, es soltera vive junto a su cuñada y sus sobrinos.

Posee una  pequeña tienda de abarrotes donde vende productos de consumo al por menor, ubicada en la puerta del mismo domicilio.

El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de mercaderías (pan, sodas, dulces, leche, etc.) para su negocio y así incrementar sus ventas
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo
texts.en:
Victoria lives on "Bolivar Street" in the Rio Seco area of the city El Alto. She is single, but lives with her brother-in-law and her nephews. Victoria owns a little grocery store, located in the doorway of her own house, from which she sells consumer goods at retail. She will invest the loan in the purchase of merchandise (bread, sodas, sweets, milk, etc.) for her business, and by doing so she will increase her sales. This is her first loan with Impro, whose evaluation of Victoria classifies her as fit to be granted a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de pan, sodas, dulces, leche, arroz, etc., para su tienda de abarrotes.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
Ricardo vive en la Avenida Versalles de  la zona Bautista Saavedra en la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Por circunstancias de la vida, su esposa lo abandonó,  dejándolo a cargo de sus cinco hijos con los cuales vive en  una habitación, la cual es en alquiler.

Trabaja en la elaboración de baúles de madera los cuales los distribuye a comerciantes de las ferias. 

El crédito lo destinará  para compra de madera y así incrementar su producción.
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el préstamo
texts.en:
Ricardo lives in the Versalles Avenue of the Bautista Saavedra Zone in El Alto city. For circumstances of life he was abandoned by his wife and was left in charge of his five children. They all live in a single rented bedroom. Ricardo manufactures wooden trunks for a living. He distributes these trunks to fair merchants. He will use this loan to purchase wood to increase his production. This is his first IMPRO credit and the evaluation performed by IMPRO qualifies him to receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wood to manufacture wooden trunks

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es:
Edwin, vive en la  calle “Tiquina”  de la zona de Villa Ingenio,  de la ciudad de el  Alto
 
Vive junto a su esposa y sus pequeños hijos de 6 y 3 años, en una habitación en alquiler.
 
Posee un pequeño taller de peluquería ubicado en la plaza de la zona, en el cual trabaja por más de cinco años. Su esposa le colabora con los gastos familiares con los ingresos semanales que obtiene como ayudante de microempresas encargadas de adoquinar las calles.

El crédito lo destinará en la compra de herramientas para su taller (necesita un par de tijeras nuevas, toallas, tintes, etc.).
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgar el crédito.
texts.en:
Edwin lives in the Tiquina street of the Villa Ingenio zone in El Alto city. He lives with his wife and his two little children who are 6 and 3 years old. They all live in a single rented bedroom. Edwin has a small beauty shop located at the zone's plaza. He's been working there for more than five years. His wife helps with the family expenses with the weekly wages that she earns as an assistant at a micro-enterprise in charge of paving streets. Edwin will use the loan to purchase tools for his shop (he needs a new pair of scissors, towels, dyes,etc.) This is Edwin's first IMPRO loan. However, the evaluation performed by IMPRO qualifies him to receive the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase scissors, towels and dyes for his beauty salon

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen Rosa, vive en la  avenida “Cuzco”  de la zona de Rio Seco,  de la ciudad de El  Alto.
 
Vive junto a su esposo y su pequeño hijo de 4 años, en la casa de sus padres.

Posee un pequeño negocio de venta ambulante de artículos electrónicos los cuales importa su esposo, a pequeña escala desde la frontera con Chile.

El crédito lo destinará en la compra de más mercadería para su posterior venta en las calles de la ciudad.
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgar el crédito.
texts.en:
Carmen Rosa lives in the Cuzco avenue, in the Rio Seco zone , El Alto city. She lives with her husband and little four year old child at her parents house. She has a small ambulatory business selling electrical goods that her husband imports at a small scale from the Chilean border. The loan will be destined to purchase more merchandise so that she can sell it on the city's streets. This is her first IMPRO credit. However, IMPRO's evaluation qualifies her to obtain the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more electrical goods to sell in El Alto, her home city

loans.name: Dao Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Đào Thị Thái năm nay 66 tuổi, chị là thành viên của Quỹ Tình thương đã được 7 năm. Hiện tại công việc đem lại nguồn thu chính cho gia đình chị là từ bán thuốc nam gia truyền với thu nhập 5.000.000đ/ tháng. 
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 20.000.000đ để đầu tư  vốn lấy thêm thuốc về bán.
texts.en:
Mrs. Đào Thị Thái, 66 years old, has been a member of the TYM Fund for seven years. Currently, the main source of income for her family is a business selling traditional herbal medicine, from which they earn 5,000,000 VND (288 USD) per month. In the next round of lending, she hopes to borrow 20,000,000 VND (1150 USD) to increase her inventory of medicines she can sell in her shop.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Traditional herbal medicine

loans.name: Duong Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Dương Thị T. năm nay 47 tuổi, gia đình chị có hai con đã trưởng thành. Chị là thành viên của Quỹ Tình thương từ năm 1992. Ban đầu chị vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn. Hiện tại công việc đem lại nguồn T. chính cho gia đình chị là từ kinh daonh INTERnet  với T. nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng. 
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 20.000.000đ để đầu tư  mua thêm máy tính phục vụ cho công việc kinh doanh của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dương Thị T., 47 years old, has two grown children. She has been a member of the TYM Fund since 1992. When she first joined the Fund, she used her loans to raise pigs. Currently, the main source of income for her family is an internet cafe, earning them 3,000,000 VND (172 USD) per month. In the next round of lending, she hopes to borrow 20,000,000 VND (1150 USD) to buy more computers for her family’s internet cafe.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Internet cafe

loans.name: Pacifico

texts.es:
Pacifico tiene un micro que trabaja en el sindicato Eduardo Avaroa. Tiene dos hijos que estudian en la universidad, y los ingresos de su vehiculo le ayudan para poder solventar los gastos de alimentación, estudios y otros gastos.
Vive en la zona de Gran Poder de la Ciudad de La Paz, en casa propia.
El crédito será destinado para capital de inversión ( compra de repuestos y mantenimiento de su vehiculo)
Es la tercera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, y la segunda que solicita el apoyo de Kiva. Su historial lo califica como cliente bueno en el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Pacifico has a vehicle that he works with in Eduardo Avaroa. He has two children that go to university and the income from the vehicle helps him to cover food, studies and other expenses. He lives in the Gran Poder area of La Paz city, in a house he owns. The loan will be used as working capital (to purchase repair parts and maintenance for his vehicle). This is the third time he requests a loan with Impro and the second one from Kiva. His credit history qualifies him as a good client for repayment.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy repair parts and maintenance for vehicle

loans.name: Mai Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Mai thị Quế năm nay 67 tuổi, gia đình chị có bốn con đã trưởng thành . Chị là thành viên của Quỹ Tình thương từ năm 1994. Hiện nay hai vợ chồng chị đang chăn nuôi và trồng trọt tại nhà. Hàng tháng ngoài thu nhập từ chăn nuôi gia đình chị còn có thêm nguồn thu ổn định từ lương hưu của chồng và sự hỗ trợ của các con  vơi thu nhập 5.000.000đ/ tháng.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 20.000.000đ để đầu tư  mua thêm lợn, gà và thức ăn phục vụ cho chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mai Thị Quế is 67 years old and has four grown children. She has been a member of the TYM Fund since 1994. Currently, she and her husband raise animals and grow crops on their own land. Each month, in addition to the income they earn from raising animals, her husband receives a steady retirement pension and their children provide some financial support. Their total income is 5,000,000 VND (288 USD) per month. In the next round of lending, Mrs. Quế hopes to borrow 20,000,000 VND (1150 USD) to buy pigs, chickens, and animal feed.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising pigs and chickens

loans.name: Trinh Thi

texts.vi: Chị Trịnh Thị T.  năm nay 40 tuổi, gia đình chị có bốn con đang tuổi đến trường . Năm 1996 chị T. tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn. Đến  nay ngoài chăn nuôi chị Thao còn đầu tư vốn để mua nguyên liệu để sản xuấ đậu và nấu rượu bán. Vơi thu nhập 4.500.000đ/ tháng  cuộc sống gia đình chị đang ngày càng ổn định và phát triển hơn. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 15.000.000đ để đầu tư  mua gạo và đỗ phục vụ cho công việc nấu rượu, làm đậu nhằm tăng thu nhập cho gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Trịnh Thị T., 40 years old, has four school-age children. In 1996, Mrs. T. became a member of the TYM Fund and used a loan to invest in raising pigs. Today, besides raising animals, she also uses loans from the Fund to buy raw materials for producing tofu and brewing wine to sell. With a total monthly income of 4,500,000 VND (255 USD), the lives of Mrs. T. and her family are steadily improving and becoming more secure. In the next round of lending, she hopes to borrow 15,000,000 VND (850 USD) to buy soybeans for making tofu and rice for making rice wine in order to increase her family’s earnings from these enterprises.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Making tofu and rice wine

loans.name: Ngo Thi

texts.vi: Chị Ngô Thị Nghĩa tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2006, gia đình chị  có 3 con  đều đã trưởng thành. Hiện nay hai vợ  chị cùng con trai lớn đang  làm công việc mua lợn thịt và cung cấp cho các lò mổ . bên cạnh đó gia điìn chị còn có thêm nghề kinh daonh dịch vụ điện nước nông nghiệp nên hàng tháng cho thu nhập ổn định 4.000.000đ/ tháng.  Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 20.000.000đ để đầu tư  thêm vốn cho công việc buôn bán thịt lợn của gia đình
texts.en:
Mrs. Ngô Thị Nghĩa has participated in the TYM Fund since 2006. She has three children, all now adults. Currently, she and her husband, along with their eldest son, operate a business buying pigs and supplying them to slaughterhouses. In addition, the family runs a business that provides agricultural water and electrical services, so that they now have a steady monthly income of 4,000,000 VND (230 USD). In the next round of lending, she hopes to borrow 20,000,000 VND to invest in her family’s business selling pigs.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pig selling business

loans.name: Ngo Thi

texts.vi: Chị Ngô Thị Thái tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1996,  chị đang sống cùng chồng và 1 con tại huyện Sóc Sơn  - Hà Nội Hiện tại chị Thái đang chăn nuôi lợn, bò tại nhà, chồng chị làm bảo vệ tại khu công nghiệp còn con làm nghề mộc. Với mức thu nhập 4.500.000đ/ tháng gia đình hcị Thái đang ngày càng có thêm điều kiện để cải thiện cuộc sống. .Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư mua 1 khối gỗ phục vụ cho công việc làm mộc của con traivà   mua 2 con bò về  nuôi
texts.en:
Mrs. Ngô Thị Thái has participated in the TYM Fund since 1996. She lives with her husband and one child in Sóc Sơn district, Hà Nội. Currently, Mrs. Thái raises pigs and cows on her property, her husband works as a security guard at an industrial park, and her son works as a carpenter. With their total income of 4,500,000 VND (259 USD), the standard of living of Mrs. Thái and her family is steadily improving. In the next round of lending, she hopes to borrow 10,000,000 VND (575 USD) to buy a supply of wood for her son’s carpentry business and also to buy two cows to raise.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Carpentry and raising cows

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mong muốn trong tương lai: ( Đối với hoạt động Quỹ) Quỹ tạo điều kiện tiếp tục cho vay vốn cao hơn để buôn bán.
Chị Nguyễn Thị Hương 47 tuổi, chị  tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2005.Chồng mất sớm, lại thiếu vốn để đầu tư vào làm ăn nên kinh tếgia đình chị trước đây rất khó khăn. Sau khi tham gia Quỹ Tình thương chị đã vay vốn để mở rộng chăn nuôi và đầu tư kinh doanh hàng tạp hoá . Hiện tại đây cũng là công việc đem lại nguồn thu  chính cho gia đình chị với thu nhập 2.500.000đ/ tháng. 
.Vòng vốn tới chị xin vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm các mặt hàng thực phẩm  về bán cho bà con địa phương
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi H., 47 years old, has participated in TYM Fund since 2005. Her husband died at young age, and she had not money to do business, therefore her family faced economic hardship previously. After joining TYM Fund, she borrowed money to raise livestock and set up a general store. Currently, these are the businesses that bring the major source of income for her family at VND2,500,000 per month.

In this loan cycle, she wishes to borrow VND10,000,000 to buy more foodstuff to resell to the local community. She also hopes that in the future the Fund continues to lend with a higher amount to invest in business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital for retail

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Thảo  32 tuổi, chị  tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1996.Thời gian đầu chị vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn, đến năm 2007 gia đình chị đã đầu tư vốn để mở cửa hàng  bán bia hơi, nước giải khát. Hiện tại kinh doanh cũnglà công việc đem lại nguồn thu chính cho gia đình chị với thu nhập 4.000.000đ/ tháng
.Vòng vốn tới chị xin vay 20.000.000đ để đầu tư mua sắm các loại mặt hàng nước giải khát , tủ bia, tủ lạnh phục vụ cho công việc kinh doanh của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi T., 32 years old, has participated in TYM Fund since 1996. Initially she borrowed money to raise pigs. In 2007, her family invested money to open a shop selling draught beer and soft drinks. Currently, this is the business that brings the major source of income for her family, at VND4,000,000 per month.

In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow VND 20,000,000 to buy additional soft drinks, beer storage, and refrigerator for her family's business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy additional soft drinks, beer storage, and refrigerator

loans.name: Truong Thi Viet

texts.vi:
Chị Trương Thị Việt N.  32 tuổi. Hai vợ chồng chị hiện đang là công nhân của công ty môi trường và đô thị . Năm 2006 chị N.  tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để mau thực phẩm cung cấp cho bếp ăn của công ty . Nhờ có  kinh nghiệm trong việc lựa chọn thực  phẩm với giá cả hợp lý nên việc cung cấp của gia đình chị ngày càng thuận lợi và có uy tín. Hiện  tại thu nhập bình quân từ công việc buôn bán thực phẩm của gia đình chị đạt 5.000.000đ/ tháng. 
.Vòng vốn tới chị xin vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư cốn cho công việc kinh doanh của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Truong Viet N. is 32 years old. She and her husband are workers at Environmental and Urban Company. In 2006, Mrs. N. joined the TYM Fund and borrowed money to buy foodstuff to supply to the Company's kitchen. Thanks to her experience in selecting and buying foodstuff at reasonable prices, the food supply business of her family is going well and receives good reputation. Currently, the average income from the food supply business of her family is VND5,000,000 per month.

In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow VND9,000,000 to invest more in the food supply business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to invest more in the food supply business.

loans.name: Vu Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Vũ Thị Phượng  29 tuổi. Gia đình chị có hai con nhỏ đang tuổi đến trường. Năm 1996 chị Phượng  tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư mở cửa hàng cắt tóc gội đầu. Chồng chị hiện đang làm lái xe chở hàng thuê. Với thu nhập 5.000000đ từ dịch vụ cắt tóc gội đầu  và lương lái xe của chồng gia đình chị đang ngày càng có điều kiện để cải thiện cuộc sống và đầu tư cho các con ăn học
.Vòng vốn tới chị xin vay 20.000.000đ để đầu tư thêm vốn mua ô tô tải phục vụ cho công việc vận chuyển hàng hoá của chồng.
texts.en:
Mrs. Vu Thi P. is 29 years old. She has two children who are going to school. In 1996, Mrs. P. joined TYM Fund and borrowed money to open a hairdresser's. Her husband is a truck driver. With an income of VND5,000,000 from the hairdressing business and from the wages of her husband, her family has financial resources to improve the living condition and pay for the children's tuition and board.

In this loan cycle, she wishes to borrow VND 20,000,000 to buy a truck for her husband's transportation business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a truck for transporation business

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị NguyễnThị Bẩy 66 tuổi, gia đình chị có 2 con đều đã trưởng thành. Chị Bẩy tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1999. Ban đầu chị vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi bò. Sau một thời gian tham gia Quỹ, với số vốn vay được tăng dần gia đình chị đã sử dụng để đấu thầu đồi rừng trồng cây ăn quả. Hiên tại bên cạnh nguồn thu từ công việc trồng trọt gia đình chị còn có thêm nguồn thu từ việc đi làm thuê của con trai với thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 12.000.000đ để đầu tư mua 2 con bò và mua phân bón phục vụcho công việc trồngtrọt của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi B. is 66 years old. She has two grown-up children. Mrs. B. has participated in TYM Fund since 1999. Initially she borrowed money to raise cows. After a period of participation in the Fund, with the increased amount of loan, her family invested the money to bid for forest land to plant fruit trees. Currently, apart from the income from the plantation business, her family also receives financial support from her son with a total income of VND 3,000,000 per month.

In this loan cycle, she wishes to borrow VND 12,000,000 to buy two cows and fertilizer for the plantation business of her family.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy two cows and fertilizer for the plantation business

loans.name: Cristo Campesino Group

texts.es:
Estos socios representan al banco comunal  “CRISTO CAMPESINO”; Ellos son un grupo conformado por 10 miembros, todos ellos son naturales D. la comunidad D. Huacaytaqui, en el distrito D. quispicanchis, ubicados a 2 horas D. la ciudad del Cusco.

La mayoría D. los socios alternan sus actividades domésticas y la agricultura con: el engorD. D. ganados, la tala D. bosques, la venta minorista D. comidas en los mercados centrales D. las comunidades aledañas y D. mayor confluencia, y a la venta D. ropa que son traídas D. las ferias D. la ciudad del Cusco; nuestros socios solicitan el préstamo para invertir en sus diferentes actividades y D. este modo seguir aportando económicamente en sus hogares.

Los socios quedan muy agradecidos por el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y así mismo se comprometen a cumplir con el pago total D. sus deudas.
texts.en:
These partners represent the “Cristo Campesino” cooperative bank. They are a group comprised of 10 members, all of whom are from the community of Huacaytaqui in the Quispicanchis district, located about 2 hours from the city of Cusco. The majority of the members alternate between their domestic chores and farming with: fattening livestock, clearing forest, and retail food sales in the neighboring and most frequented markets of the city of Cusco. Our members request a loan to invest into their various activities so they can continue to support their households financially. The members are very grateful for the support provided through this medium, and simultaneously commit to the payment of all their debts.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To implement their various businesses.

loans.name: Señor De Ccoyllority - Urcos Group

texts.es:
Estos son nuestros socios, el grupo comunal  “SEÑOR D. CCOYLLORITY – URCOS”; conformado por 14 miembros, este grupo está en su 4to ciclo D. creación, ellos son D. la comunidad D. Muñapata, que esta situado a 1 hora y 15 minutos D. la misma ciudad del Cusco.

La gente que vive en esta comunidad se dedica D. manera prioritaria a la agricultura, alternando las mujeres sus labores del hogar y los hombres con las diferentes actividades D. comercio: engorD. D. ganado mayores( toros, vacas, ovinos) y menores(aves D. corral, cuyes); al negocio D. venta D. ropa en las ferias D. fin D. semana en los pueblos más concurridos, venta D. comidas, venta D. artículos D. primera necesidad y limpieza, y muchos varones en las épocas en que los cultivos están bajos son obreros.

Nuestros socios valoran y agradecen el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago del mismo en el plazo determinado.
texts.en:
These are our associates, the cooperative bank “SEÑOR D. CCOYLLORITY – URCOS”; comprised of 14 members, this group is in its 4th cycle since inception. They are from the Muñapata community, located 1 hour and 15 minutes from the city of Cusco. The people that resiD. in this community dedicate themselves primarily to farming; women alternate their agricultural tasks with the household chores, and the men with various commercial activities: fattening of large (bulls, cows, sheep) and small (poulty, guinea pigs) livestock. Other activities incluD. clothing sales during weekends at the busiest markets, food sales, selling basic needs items and cleaning supplies; many men work as laborers when harvests are scarce. Our members value and are grateful for the loan granted through this medium, and commit to making their payments during the term allotted.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To implement their various businesses.

loans.name: Juana María

texts.es:
La señora Juana María C. es madre soltera y tiene dos hijo bajo su responsabilidad uno de edad escolara y el mas pequeño de meses, desea lo mejor para sus hijos.
Tiene poco que le entregaron su casa por medio de un crédito gubernamental pero le esta haciendo faltas las protecciones en las puertas y ventanas para poder habitarla y así su hijos tendrán su patrimonio seguro.
texts.en:
Juana Maria C. is a single mother with two children under her responsibility, one of them is of school age and the youngest one only a few months old. She wishes the best for her children. It hasn’t been long since she got her house through a government loan. The house lacks of protection in doors and windows, these need to be fixed to make the house habitable and make sure that her children’s patrimony is protected.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Add protection to doors and windows of new house.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos tiene 50 años, vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos en su propia casa. Desde hace 40 años se dedica a las tareas agrícolas, esta larga trayectoria le han servido para sobreponerse ante las dificultades que existieron en cosechas anteriores por problemas climáticos y la devaluación de los productos de su cosecha. Actualmente trabaja tanto en el cuidado de sus animales, como en la inspección de sus tierras de cultivo, Carlos espera ansiosamente la cosecha para ver los frutos del arduo trabajo de él y de su familia pues todos colaboraron. Las expectativas de mejorar su cosecha tienen cada vez más claridad para Carlos, porque el clima no ha impedido este deseo. Para más adelante, se proyecta a dedicarse con mayor fuerza a las actividades ganaderas, sembrando el alimento para su ganado y esto le signifique menos gastos. Es la segunda vez que Carlos está solicitando un préstamo con MFP, y está muy satisfecho por formar parte de su banco comunal, con el que se compromete, una vez más, a seguir adelante con su esfuerzo. El dinero requerido en esta oportunidad es para comprar un torete e incrementar la cantidad de animales que posee. Además, con lo que pueda sobrar comprará un fumigador para evitar las plagas en sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Carlos is 50, lives with his wife and two children in a house they own. For 40 years he has worked in agriculture, this long path has allowed him to overcome difficulties in previous harvest seasons caused by weather problems and the decrease in value of his products. Currently he works taking care of livestock and supervising crop land, Carlos eagerly waits for harvest season to see the results of his family’s hard work, everyone helped out. The expectations for a good harvest are more clear for Carlos, because the weather doesn't seem to be against his wish. Later on, he wants to spend more time working with Livestock and growing his own food for the cattle, which will allow him to save on costs. This is the second time that Carlos requests a loan from MFP, and he is very happy for being part of the community bank, to which he is committed once more to keep getting ahead with hard work. The money requested will be used to buy a bull and increase the amount of livestock he owns. Also, with the remainder we will fumigate to avoid pests in his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a bull

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy vive en la Avenida “ Periferica” D.  la zona Villa Cooperativa. en la ciudad D. El Alto.
 
Por circunstancias familiares Ella se separó D. su esposo hace varios años atrás  quedándose junto a sus hijos D. 21, 18, 15 y 12 años D. edad,
quienes colaboran en el negocio D. su madre.
 
Posee un puesto D. venta D. comida ubicado en las afueras D. su domicilio. 

El crédito lo destinará  para compra D. insumos para aumentar sus ventas  y así sus ingresos.
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo
texts.en:
Nancy lives on Periferica Avenue in the neighbourhood of Villa Cooperative in El Alto. Because of the family's circumstances, she and her husband separated a number of years ago. Today, Nancy lives with her children who are 12, 15, 18, and 21 years old and who help her with her business. Nancy sells meals from a stall that is a little ways from her home. This loan will be used to buy ingredients for her meals so that she can increase her sales and thus, her income. This is her first loan from Impro but their evaluation has deemed her eligible to receive it.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients.

loans.name: Casimiro

texts.es: Casimiro tiene 60 años, vive al lado de su esposa. Desde niño se dedica a las tareas agrícolas, mientras espera la cosecha, cada día por las mañanas sale a pastear a sus  vacas junto a su esposa, a lugares lejanos de hasta 3 horas de caminata, durante todo el día. Casimiro cultiva los principales productos de su región, tales como; la papa, el maíz, entre otros, una vez que cosechan una parte la de sus productos la venden al por menor y otra parte, al mayor, a comerciantes específicos. Casimiro y su esposa desean seguir trabajando en esta actividad hasta donde sus fuerzas les alcancen, ambos están inmensamente agradecidos a la vida por estas actividades que les sirvieron para sostener a sus hijos que hoy son personas adultas.
