loans.name: Bashiran Abid Hussain Group

texts.en:
Bashiran baji is 34 years old and resides in a mid-size city named Vehari, Pakistan. She has been a part of this city for the past 20 years. She successfully repaid her four previous loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a fifth loan, for her husband’s fruit-selling business.

Her husband has 3 years of experience in this business. He goes to different areas of the community and sells his products by announcing them in a loud voice. Bashiran baji is a very hard-working lady. She shares the financial burden of her husband by sewing clothes.

Bashiran baji is the group leader of four other women from her locality. Siddiqan baji, Sakina bji, and N. baji each want a loan to buy groceries for their grocery shops. Tasleem baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruits to sell

loans.name: Maryam Haji Mekael Group

texts.en:
Maryam baji is a 34-year-old married lady who has been a citizen of a mid-size city named Vehari, Pakistan for the past 28 years. She is applying for a loan to repair her husband’s auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle), because the rickshaw’s engine needs to be repaired because it seized. Her husband is not a qualified person and he can’t do anything besides this profession.

She is the mother of three sons. Her elder son reads in 5th standard. The others are free and don’t do anything. Maryam baji works hard to admit her other kids into school. She prepares embroidered dresses on orders which she collects from her neighbors.

She is the group leader of four other women from her locality. Habiba baji wants a loan to buy utensils to sell. Khalida baji wants a loan to change the body of her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Farzana baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading. Mukhtaran baji wants a loan to buy mason tools.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To repair an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Lutfi

texts.ru: Лутфи женщина, которая кредитуется третий год.Она всё это время без проблем погашает свои займы.За три года у неё увеличился товарооборот.Она занимается шитьём европейской одежды.следующий займ хочет потратить для закупа новых материй.Её цех расположен в центре города Худжанда, поэтому наплыв клиентов очень большой.Она благодарна KIVA за финансирование и поддержку.
texts.en:
This is Lutfi’s third year as a borrower. She has been paying back her loans during all this time without a problem. In the three years her turnover has increased. Lutfi sews European clothing and would like to use her next loan to purchase new fabrics. Her shop is located in the center of Khujand and because of this she has a large flow of customers. Lutfi is grateful to KIVA for the financing and support.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabrics

loans.name: Najminiso

texts.ru: Начминисо – женщина 44 лет. Замужем, имеет 4-х детей. Занимается продажей сладостей и кондитерских изделий, которые ей поставляют домашние кондитеры. Конфеты она закупает у фирменных поставщиков, которые доставляют товар на место деятельности. Муж занимается частной деятельностью (разнорабочий). Начминисо старается расширить свой бизнес и открыть еще одну точку, чтобы ее муж тоже мог торговать сладостями. Этим их семейный доход увеличится. Начминисо очень надеется что полученный кредит поможет ей в достижении ее цели.
texts.en:
Najminiso is 44 years, married and has 4 children. She is involved in sales of candy and sweets, which are supplied by private confectioners. She buys candy from brand-name suppliers who deliver to her place of business. Najminiso’s husband is involved in private enterprise as a handyman. Najminiso is trying to expand her business and open an additional retail outlet, so that her husband can sell sweets too. This will allow for their family income to increase. Najminiso hopes that this loan will help her in achieving her goal.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sales of sweets and candy

loans.name: Abdunaim

texts.ru: Абдунаим мужчина 57 лет, живёт и продаёт в городе Гафурове.Он женат, имеет пятерых детей.На рынке торгует продуктами питания, по бизнесу ему помогает его жена.Завозит товар ему его сыновья.Они для облегчения работы родителей помогают им. Кроме этого Абдунаби занимается откормом и продажей скота. Абдунаим в кредит хочет увеличить свой скот.За уходом скота помогают Абдунаби его невестки, которые проживают с ним в одном доме.  При затруднениях погашения, ему помогут его сыновья , которые все работают на разных предприятиях.
texts.en:
Abdunaim is 57 years old, married has five children. He lives and works in the city of Gafurov. He sells food products at a local market, and his wife helps him with the business. His sons deliver the products to him. They help their parents and ease their work. Besides this business, Abdunaim is also involved in raising and selling livestock. Abdunaim wants to obtain this loan to increase his livestock headcount. Abdunaim’s daughters-in-law, who live in the same house, help him to look after the livestock. If he experiences any difficulty repaying this loan, his sons, all of whom hold different jobs, would help with the repayment.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing livestock headcount

loans.name: Husanboi

texts.ru: Хусанбой - мужчина 48 лет. Женат. Отец 2-х детей. Хусанбой занимается откормом и продажей крупнорогатого и мелко рогатого скота.  Он закупает скот на рынке и откармливая 2-3 месяца продает на том же рынке. Жена нигде не работает, а только помогает по хозяйству дома. Когда муж уходит на пастбище вместе со скотом, она смотрит за оставшимся скотом дома. Этим они зарабатывают на жизнь, чтобы прокормить своих детей.
texts.en:
Husanboi is 48 years old, married and has 2 children. He is involved in raising and selling cattle and small livestock. He buys the livestock at a market, raises it for about 2-3 months and then resells it at the same market. Husanboi’s wife is not employed and helps with household work. She also looks after the livestock at home whenever Husanboi takes other livestock to pasture. Husanboi’s family makes a living with this business and provides for their children.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising and selling livestock

loans.name: Davaasuren

texts.en:
Davaasuren J. is 45, married, and the mother of two. Both her sons are university students in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She lives with her husband in a "ger" (a nomadic Mongolian tent) district in Arhanghay, one of Mongolian central provinces. 

In 1999, together with her husband Nyamtseren, she started her clothing retail business at the local market. She works as a saleswoman and her husband goes to Ereen, a Chinese border city, to buy cheap apparel. Ereen is a city where many Mongolians go to buy cheap goods to resell in Mongolia. As a result of hard work, her working capital has increased from 400,000 tugrugs to 1,600,000 tugrugs ($1.00 USD=1450 MNT). From her profit, she pays for her sons' tuition. 

She requests a loan to buy men's and women's apparel to increase her business inventory. In the future, she is planning to expand her family business by selling raw clothing materials such as animal skins, wool, and cashmere.

loans.use: To buy men's and women's apparel

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.ru: Дилором- женщина сорока лет, замужем, имеет четверых детей.Работает Дилором в школе техничкой.Её заработная плата очень низкая, не хватает на проживание. Муж работает на ферме.Он хорошо разбирается в породистых скотах.У Дилором сейчас дома три коровы , которые дают молоко.Дилором сама доит их продаёт молоко соседям.Она в кредит хочет купить ещё пару коров.Для чего она решила обратится в Микроинвест.
texts.en:
Dilorom is 40 years old, married and has four children. She works at a school as a janitor. However, her salary is so low that it does not provide for a living. Her husband works at a farm. He is an expert in purebred livestock. Dilorom currently has three dairy cows that supply milk. She milks them herself and sells the milk to her neighbors. Dilorom wants to obtain a loan to purchase a couple more cows. This is why she decided to reach out to MicroInvest.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of dairy cows

loans.name: Sanavbar

texts.ru: Санавбар - женщина , которая кредитуется в Микроинвест уже третий год.Она использует свой займ для расширения своего бизнеса.Её точка реализации находится вблизи её дома.Её ассортимент товаров составляют хозяйственные принадлежности.Она каждый раз ездит за товаром в Истаравшан. У неё имеются свои постоянные клиенты, которые покупают у неё товар.Следующий займ она хочет использовать для мини ремонта своего лорька.
texts.en:
Sanavbar has been a client of MicroInvest for three years. She uses her credit to expand her business. Her retail outlet is located close to her home. Sanavbar sells household products and supplies. She travels to Istaravshan every time she needs to obtain her goods. She has loyal clients who purchase products from her. Sanavbar wants to use this loan to remodel her retail store.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Store remodeling

loans.name: Dulmaa

texts.en:
Dulmaa D. is 38, married and the mother of three. Dulmaa's family lives in a "ger" (a nomadic Mongolian housing tent) district in Arhanghay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Her youngest two sons attend elementary and high school.

Since 2002, together with her husband, Bat-Ochir, she has been running a clothing stall at the local market. She is a hard-working woman who tries her best to make a better life for her children. From her profit, she has bought electronic goods for her home and plans to buy a car soon. When she began her retail business, her working capital was 500,000 tugrugs and now as a result of hard work, it has increased to 2,000,000 tugrugs ($1.00 USD = 1,450 MNT).

She requests a loan to buy more men's and women's apparel to increase her business inventory.

loans.use: To buy men's and women's apparel

loans.name: Mohira

texts.ru: Мохира Каримова – молодая женщина 26 лет. Замужем и мать 1-го ребенка. Её муж уехал в Российскую Федерацию, чтобы там зарабатывать деньги, как и многие рабочие мигранты, которые не могут найти здесь нормальную работу. Мохира занимается продажей религиозных книг и аксессуаров, таких как четки и полотен для чтения намаза. Её торговая точка расположена около мечети и поэтому торговля у нее идет хорошо. Она хочет расширить свой бизнес и открыть еще одну точку продажи.
texts.en:
Mohira K. is a young 26-year-old woman. She is married and has one child. Her husband went to the Russian Federation to earn money, much like other migrant workers, who cannot find stable work at home, do. Mohira sells religious books and accessories, such as prayer beads and prayer mats for reading of the namaz (the obligatory prayer). Her business is doing well because her shop is situated near a mosque. Mohira wants to expand her business and open an additional shop.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Ganbold

texts.en:
Ganbold L. is 39, married, and the father of four. All his children are attending elementary school. In 2007, he started running a retail business with his spouse. Ganbold buys sheepskin from herders and treats the skin so that it can be used for clothing. His wife, Tsetsgee, sews deels with the sheepskin to be worn in the harsh winter, when temperatures regularly fall below -20 degrees Celsius. A Deel is a Mongolian traditional cloak that men, women and children wear. Tsetsgee also sews many other clothes and Mongolian traditional shoes.

Ganbold's family lives in Arhanghay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. They have many repeat local clients, including herders. During the last two years, Ganbold's family business capital has increased from 50,000 tugrugs to 300,000 tugrugs ($1.00 USD = 1,450 MNT). He requests a loan to buy more raw materials for his business.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials for his business

loans.name: Munavar

texts.ru: Мунавар - женщина ,которая является заёмщицей в Микроинвест с 2005 года.Она торгует на центральном рынкегорода Худжанда "панчшанбе".Она продаёт различные конфеты и печенья.В начале своей кредитной истории Мунавар привозила товар с Истаравшана, а на сегодня она завозит уже с Бишкека.Т.к. её позволяет её получаемая прибыль, которую она получает со своего бизнеса.Она благодарна кредитам,при помощи которых она смогла расширить свой бизнес.На следующий кредит она планирует съездить ещё за товаром в Бишкек.
texts.en:
Munavar is a woman who has been a client of MicroInvest since 2005. She sells on the central market of town of Khudjand "panchshabe." She sells different types of candy and cookies. In the beginning of her credit history Munavar was bringing the merchandise in from Istaravshan. Today she brings it from Bishkek as the profit which she makes from her business allows it. She is grateful to all the lenders with whose help she was able to expand her business. She plans to use her next loan to travel to Bishkek for more merchandise.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Продажа кондитерских товаров.

loans.name: Monad

texts.ru: Монад – женщина 49 лет. Замужем, имеет 5-х детей. Занимается продажей сладостей и кондитерских изделий, которые ей поставляют домашние кондитеры. Муж занимается частной деятельностью, пособничеством у мастеров. Монад старается расширить свой бизнес и закупать импортные конфеты и сладости, потому, что потребность на них очень большая. Этим она хочет увеличить свой семейный доход. Монад очень надеется что полученный кредит поможет ей в достижении ее цели.
texts.en:
Monad is a woman of 49 years of age. She is married and has five children. She sells sweets and confectioneries which are homemade by confectioners who supply them. Her husband works as an assistant for various repairmen. Monad tries to expand her business and buys imported candy and sweets because the demand for these goods is high. She wants to increase her input into family's budget. Monad is very hopeful that this loan will help her in achieving this goal.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Tilloboev

texts.ru: Алиев Тешабой проживает в районе Хуросон. Возраст 59 лет, имеет восьмерых  детей. Старшие дети уже взрослые и имеют свои семьи. Сам клиент уже 10 лет торгует бензином. Обратился к нам за кредитом, который планирует использовать для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот.Получив , кредит он сможет закупить крупную партию бензина и продавать его по доступным ценам , ведь его торговая точка находиться в одном из отдаленных кишлаков.
texts.en:
Teshaboy A. lives in the Hurson region. He is 59 yeas old and has 8 children. His older children are grown up and have their own families. Teshaboy has been in the business of selling gas for the past 10 years. He is asking for a loan so he could purchase a large amount of gas and sell it at affordable prices (his station is located at a distant location).

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Mutabali

texts.ru: Мутабали - мужчина 42 лет. Женат. Отец 4-х детей. Мутабали занимается откормом и продажей крупнорогатого и мелко рогатого скота.  Он закупает скот на рынке и откармливая 2-3 месяца продает на том же рынке. Жена занимается переработкой шерсти скота и продает ее на рынке, и еще помогает по хозяйству дома. Этим она помогает мужу, чтобы их семейный бюджет улучшился. Мутабали в свою очередь хочет увеличить количество своего скота.
texts.en:
Mutabali is a 42 year old man. He is married and is the father of 4 children. Mutabali fattens and sells large and small livestock. He purchases livestock at the market and after feeding them for 2-3 months sells them at the same market. His wife processes wool from the livestock and sells it at the market; she also helps at the farm at home. This way she helps her husband so that their family income improves. Mutalabi would like to increase his livestock headcount.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase livestock

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka has been an animal keeper and has owned a small shop in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar for five years. She belongs to the Salmina group loan. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $90. Every day she works at her business from 8 a.m. to 10 p.m.

She is requesting her third loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Tanzania so that she can add to her current stock for the improvement of her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Mwaka is 45 years old, married, and has five children: ages 22, 18, 16, 11 and 8.

loans.use: To add to her current stock

loans.name: Mahmadrajab

texts.ru: Бобиев Махмадраджаб Проживает в районе Абдурахмони Джоми. Женат и имеет четверых детей. Возраст 52 года. Имеет среднее образование . По профессии ветеринар. В сфере животноводства работает уже 30 лет. Хочет увеличить поголовье скота.Он покупает молодых бычков , откармливает и продает на рынке по более выгодной цене. Но для этого он планирует получить кредит .
texts.en:
Mahmadrajab B. lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi district. He is 52 years old, married and has four children. He has a secondary education. He is a veterinarian and has been working in the animal husbandry sphere for 30 years. Mahmadrajab wants to increase his livestock headcount. He buys young bulls, raises and resells them at a market at more profitable prices. He plans to obtain the loan for this purpose.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase livestock headcount

loans.name: Mehriniso

texts.ru: Мехринисо – женщина 41 лет, замужем и мать 6-х детей. Её муж занимается купле -продажей скота на скотном рынке. А она откармливает крупнорогатый скот дома. Она помогает мужу в развитии его бизнеса, потому что хочет иметь больше прибыли, чтобы женить своих сыновей.  За счет займа они хотят увеличить количество скота и  получить больше прибыли.
texts.en:
Mehriniso is a 41 year old woman; she is married and is the mother of 6 children. Her husband purchases and sells livestock at the livestock market. Mehriniso fattens the livestock at home. She helps her husband to develop his business, because she would like to increase their income to marry off her sons. They would like to use the loan to increase their livestock headcount and increase their income.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase livestock

loans.name: Nisolat

texts.ru: Нисолат - женщина 55 лет , замужем, имеет четверых детей.Нигде не работает, но занимается бизнесом продажи женской одежды.Товар завозит с Бишкека, ей помогает её дети.Она продаёт товар для молодёжи.Её ассортимент очень разнообразный,который пользуется большим спросом.Она очень энергичная женщина, которая каждый день выходит на продажу.Кредит хочет использовать для завоза нового товара.
texts.en:
Nisolat is a 55 year old woman; she is married and has four children. She does not have a job, but she sells women’s clothing. Nisolat brings her products from Bishkek; her children help her. She sells clothing for young people. Her product selection has a lot of variety and is in high demand. Nisolat is a very energetic woman and goes out to sell every day. She would like to use her loan to purchase new products to sell.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase women's clothing for sale

loans.name: Abdumalik

texts.ru: Абдумалик молодой человек, который каждый месяц получает кредит на один месяц.Он использует кредиты для пополнения ассортимента товаров.Его место деятельности рынок Костакоза.Во время его отсутствия его замещает его отец.На снимке Абдумалик в день выдачи.Следующий займ он хочет использовать для завоза летнего ассортимента товаров.
texts.en:
Abdumalik is a young man who takes out a one month loan every month. He uses the loan to increase his product assortment. His place of business is at the Kostakoz market. When Abdumalik is absent, his father substitutes for him. Pictured in the photo is Abdumalik on the day that he received his loan. He would like to use his next loan to purchases a summer selection of products

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products for sale

loans.name: Sharifboi

texts.ru: Шарифбой - мужчина 45 лет. Женат, имеет 6 детей. Занимается откормом и продажей крупно-рогатого и мелко рогатого скота. Жена домохозяйка. Шарифбой каждое утро гонит свой скот на пастбище, чтобы они питались горной травой. И потом гонит обратно домой. Только дойные коровы остаются дома. Жена помогает присматривать за оставшимся скотом. Этим она помогает мужу, чтобы их семейный бюджет улучшился. Шарифбой в свою очередь хочет увеличить количество своего скота.
texts.en:
Sharifboi is a 45 year old man. He is married and has 6 children. He fattens and sells large and small livestock. His wife is a homemaker. Sharifboi takes his livestock to the pasture every morning so that they can feed on mountain grasses and afterwards herds them back home. Only the dairy cows stay at home. His wife helps him to look after the leftover livestock. This way she helps her husband so that their family income improves. Sharifboi would like to increase his livestock headcount.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase livestock headcount

loans.name: Manzura

texts.ru: Манзура- женщина 49 лет , замужем, имеет четверых детей, занимается бизнесом продажи детской одежды.Её точка реализации на рынке Костакоза.Она завозит товар с Истаравшана.Решила получить кредит для увеличения оборотного капитала.Её муж работает мастером по евро ремонту квартир.Все её дети самостоятельно живут отдельно от родителей.Проведя мониторинг было выявлено, что Манзура действительно торгует и имеет хороший спрос на товар.
texts.en:
Manzura is a 49-year-old woman, married and has four children. She is in the business of selling children's clothing. Her sales outlet is at the Kostakoz market, and she brings goods in from Istaravshan. Manzura decided to take out a loan to increase her working capital. Her husband remodels apartments to European standards. All her children are grown and no longer live at home. When we visited it was evident that Manzura is quite a businesswoman and her goods are in demand.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of children's clothing

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma has owned a small food-items shop and has sold bites in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar for two years. She belongs to Takrima group loan. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $50. Every day she works at her business from 8 a.m. to 10 p.m.

She is requesting her first loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more food items for the expansion of her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Fatma is 28, married, and has two children: ages 8 and 5.

loans.use: To buy more food items for the expansion of her business

loans.name: Nasreen Abdul Majeed Group
loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Salmina Group

texts.en:
Mwanaid has been a firewood and handbags seller in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar for 3 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $70. Every day, she works at her business from 8:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more firewood and handbags for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Mwanaid is 40 years old, married, and has two children: ages 20 and 18. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Arafa, who also has her own small business dealing in tailoring and clothes selling in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more firewood and handbags for her business.

loans.name: Amgalan

texts.en:
Amgalan J. lives with her husband and two teenage children in Arhanghay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Her oldest son is a student in a local university and the youngest son is attending high school.

Amgalan has a small retail business that sells unprocessed animal products such as wool and cashmere. She buys unprocessed animal products from local herders and brings them to Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, to sell for a profit.

She started the business in 2000 with 450,000 MNT ($1 USD = 1,500 MNT) of capital, which has now increased to 4,500,000 MNT. She pays her oldest son's tuition from her profit. She is now planning how to afford her son's tuition for the next academic year. She requests a loan to purchase more unprocessed wool and cashmere from Arhanghay's local herders.

loans.use: To purchase unprocessed wool and cashmere

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
L. Nguyen is a 43 year-old female living in the town of Nghi Lộc.  She is married and has 3 school-aged children.  To earn a living, L. works in a family member's business venture operating a manufacturing business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from manufacturing & selling wood products to local businesses and community members.  L. has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3000000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2004, L. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  L. has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to invest in renovating the business.  L. is now requesting a new loan of 10000000 VND which will also be used to invest in renovating the business.  The loan will be the 5th loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund.  L. plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand the borrower's business.

loans.use: Bussiness

loans.name: Ariunaa

texts.en: Ariunaa T. lives with her husband and three sons in Arhanghay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Her two oldest sons are university students, and the youngest attends a local high school. Ariunaa has a small business selling clothes. She frequently travels to Ereen, a border town in China, where many goods can be purchased for resale, and buys cheap men's and women's clothes. She rents a stall in a local mall called "Tansag" and sells the imported clothes. She started her business in 2005 with $350 of working capital, which has now tripled. Her goal is to continue paying for her two sons' university education. She requests a loan to purchase more clothes in Ereen, China.

loans.use: To buy clothes from Ereen, China.

loans.name: Assadullo

texts.ru: Ибодов Ассадулло проживает в районе Хуросон. Возраст 46 лет , женат и имеет пятерых детей. Живет в одном из дальних кишлаков района. Старший сын находится в России на заработках. Сам клиент работает в сельском хозяйстве. Арендует землю. Сейчас планирует засеять арбузами. Поэтому обратился к нам за кредитом для покупки семян , пленки , а так же горюче смазочного материала. Это поможет ему своевременно засеить землю и получить качественный урожай. Засеивать хочет скороспелый сорт , урожай которого  будет готов уже в июне месяце.
texts.en:
Assadullo I. lives in the Khuroson district. He is 46 years old, married and has five children. He lives in one of the distant villages of the district. His oldest son is working in Russia. Our client works in agriculture. Assadullo leases land. Currently, he is planning to plant watermelons. He requested a loan from us in order to purchase seeds, plastic and petroleum-based lubricants. This will help him to sow the land and obtain a quality harvest. He wants to plant a quick-ripening variety, which can be harvested as early as in June.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of watermelon seeds, plastic and petroleum-based lubricants

loans.name: Apauline

texts.fr:
A. Apauline est née vers 1966; elle est de nationalité togolaise ( le Togo est un pays frontalier au Bénin). Apauline est mariée et mère de trois (3) enfants tous scolarisés; seulement deux (2) enfants sont encore à sa charge. Apauline réside au quartier Gbégamey; et c'est dans le marché de ce quartier qu'elle vend. Depuis dix huit, Apauline vend des céréales et des condiments pour préparer la sauce. Apauline se rend dans les petits marchés locaux du Bénin pour acheter les céréales qu'elle revient vendre au marché de Gbégamey. En ce qui concerne les condiments pour la sauce, c'est dans le marché international du Bénin que Apauline s'approvisionne. Apauline a déjà eu deux prêts de la part de ALIDé. Ces deux prêts lui ont permis d'élever le niveau de son activité. Toutefois, Apauline veut continuer de développer son commerce; c'est pourquoi elle sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé pour renforcer son fonds de commerce afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Apauline A. was born around 1966. She is Togolese (Togo is a border country of Benin). Apauline is married and the mother of 3 children, all in school. Only two of the children are still her responsibility. Apauline lives in the Gbégamey neighborhood and she does her selling in the market of that district.

For 10 years, Apauline has been selling cereals and condiments for sauces. Apauline goes to the little local markets in Benin to buy the cereals that she re-sells at the market of Gbégamey. As for condiments for sauces, Apauline buys her supplies in the international market of Benin. She has already had two loans through ALIDé. These two loans have permitted her to expand her business. However, Apauline wants to continue to develop her business; that is why she is requesting a third loan from ALIDé to reinforce her working capital so as to better satisfy her clientele. The significance of ALIDé in the local language of Bénin, Fon, is "there is always a pathway for the poorest of the poor. Bénin is a small West African country next door to Nigeria; the GDP of its inhabitants stands at US$ 1,500. ALIDé offers special loans at 0% interest for very vulnerable persons, and it is in a group which will soon be offering a micro health insurance program for micro-loan beneficiaries.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of sacks of maize and rice, and condiments for sauces

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
Nguyen Thi D. is a fifty-year-old female living in the town of Nghệ An.  She is married and has four adult -aged children.  To make a living, she works in a family member's business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale.  D. has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately $120 a month from these activities.

In 2004, D. joined TYM Fund, a Kiva field partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation as well as her ability to engage in business activities.  She has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund which was invested in renovating the business.  She is now requesting a new loan of $525 which will be used to purchase breeding livestock.  This loan will be the tenth loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund.  D. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Sonom

texts.en: B. Sonom lives with his wife and two children in Arhanghay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. His son is unemployed and stays home, and his daughter is a high school student. Using his truck, B. purchases food products from local wholesalers.  He then sells the food by driving to local herder families who do not have everyday access to food markets. With his wife's support, B. launched his business in 2002 with $170 of capital. Since then his business capital has increased to $2000. In the future, B. hopes to live in an apartment with access to hot, running water. He requests a loan to purchase more food products to increase his business inventory.

loans.use: To purchase food products

loans.name: Ujamaa Group

texts.en:
Mwanaisha owns a small shop in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $60. She works at her business daily.

She is requesting her fourth loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more charcoal and rice for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Mwanaisha is 38 years old, married, and has three children: ages 20, 17 and 13. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Ashura, who also has her own small business dealing in clothes-selling in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and rice for her business.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
Nguyen Thi H. is a thirty-two-year-old female living in the town of Nghệ An.  She is married and has two infant-aged children.  To make a living, Hằng works in a family member's business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising fish for sale.  Hằng has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately $145 a month from these activities.

In 2004, Hằng joined TYM Fund, a Kiva field partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities.  Hằng has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to purchase young livestock to raise and sell in the future.  Hằng is now requesting a new loan of $700 which will be used to purchase breeding livestock.  The loan will be the tenth loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund.  Hằng plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family.

loans.use: To buy breeding livestock

loans.name: Abdullo

texts.ru: Расулов Абдулло проживает в районе Хуросон. Возраст 23 года ,женат , но детей пока нет. С детства вместе с отцом занимается сельским хозяйством. Сажают овощи  и бахчевые культуры. Сейчас сезон посева арбузов , поэтому он обратился  к нам за кредитом , для того,,чтобы закупить семена , удобрения и пленку. Если он сможет приобрести качественные семена , он сможет получить качественный урожай.
texts.en:
Abdullo R. lives in the Khuroson district. He is 23 years old, married, but does not yet have children. Ever since his childhood, Abdullo has been involved in agriculture with his father. They plant vegetables and melon varieties. It is currently the season to sow watermelons, and this is why Abdullo reached out to us to obtain the loan. He wants to purchase seeds, fertilizer and plastic film. If he is able to purchase quality seeds, he will be able to obtain a quality harvest.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seeds, fertilizer and plastic film

loans.name: Jocelyne

texts.fr:
A. Jocelyne est née vers les années 1982. Jocelyne est mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants: l'ainé est scolarisé; le second enfant n'a pas encore l'âge d'aller à l'école. Jocelyne Réside au quartier Fidjrossè à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Jocelyne vend des divers (détergents, savons, pâtes dentifrices, brosses à dents, etc.) à Cotonou, au marché international du Bénin. Grâce à ses revenus, Jocelyne subvient à ses besoins et à certains besoins de sa famille. Jocelyne a pour projet de renforcer le fonds de roulement de son commerce afin de faire plus de bénéfice. C'est pourquoi Jocelyne sollicite de crédit à ALIDé. 


 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Jocelyne A. was born around 1982; she is married and the mother of two children. Her older child is enrolled in school; the second is not yet old enough to attend school. Jocelyne lives in the Fidjrossè neighborhood in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. Jocelyne sells various articles (detergents, soaps, toothpaste, toothbrushes, etc.) in Cotonou, at the international market of Bénin. Thanks to her income, Jocelyne supports herself and covers some of the needs of her family. Her goal is to bolster her working capital so as to make more profit. This is why Jocelyne is requesting this loan from ALIDé.

The significance of ALIDé in the local language of Bénin, Fon, is "there is always a pathway for the poorest of the poor. Bénin is a small West African country next door to Nigeria; the GDP of its inhabitants stands at US$ 1,500. ALIDé offers special loans at 0% interest for very vulnerable persons, and it is in a group which will soon be offering a micro health insurance program for micro-loan beneficiaries.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of detergents, soaps, toothpaste, and toothbrushes for re-sale

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.en:
Hải Trần (1044061359) is a 35-year-old female living in the town of Nghệ An. She is married and has two infant children.

To make a living, Hải works in a family member's business venture in the retail sector selling home products. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling personal home products to tourists and local community members. Hải has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2005, Hải joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Hải has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.

Hải is now requesting a new loan of 9,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be the 4th loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. Hải plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional personal home products to sell

loans.name: Chaguani

texts.en:
Chaguani has been a clothes, juice and bites seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for 20 years. She belongs to the Tujidhatiti group loan (Group code 2091). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $125. Each day, she works at her business for 8 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more food items (like juice, wheat flour, cooking oil, and sugar) and clothes for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use.

Chaguani is 42 years old, married, and has four children: ages 23, 18, 17 and 12. She also cares for one additional dependant.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and food items like juice, cooking oil, wheat flour and sugar for her business.

loans.name: Bui Thi

texts.en:
Bui Thi T. is a fifty-three-year-old female living in the town of Nghệ An.  She is widowed and has two adult-aged children.  To make a living, Thảo works in a family member's business venture in the services sector, operating a tailoring business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general alteration and tailoring services to local community members.  Thảo has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately $175 a month from these activities.

In 2004, Thảo joined TYM Fund, a Kiva field partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities.  Thảo has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional fabrics and materials.  Thảo is now requesting a new loan of $575, which again will be used to buy fabric and other sewing materials.  This will be the fifth loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund.  Thảo plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: To buy fabric and sewing materials.

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama has operated a clothes, food and juice shop in the Jang’ombe neighborhood of Zanzibar for 10 years. She belongs to Bora utu group loan (Group code 2028). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $95. She works at her business 2 hours daily.
Salama is requesting her third loan from BRAC Tanzania. With the loan, she will by more commodities like khanga, bedsheets, flour, sugar and juice for her business. She is hoping to increase her profit so that she can expand her business. Salama is 43 years old, married and has five children. Her children are 25, 24, 18, 9 and 8.

loans.use: To buy more commodities like khanga, bedsheets, flour, sugar and juice for her business.

loans.name: Mashallah

texts.en: Mashallah K., 45, is a butcher who has run his own meat shop for the last five years. He sells beef and mutton in his shop. Mashallah is married and has one adorable daughter. He lives in one house with parents and his own family. He is the only breadwinner for the whole family. Mashallah has applied for 1200 USD loan to purchase a bigger refrigerator to keep more meat. This will help to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator for his butcher shop.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
C. Nguyễn is a 33 year-old female living in the town of Nghệ An. She is married and has three young children. To make a living, C. owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. C. has been engaged in this business for more than four years and earns approximately 2500000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2004, C. joined TYM Fund (a Kiva partner) to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. C. has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business.

C. is now requesting a new loan of 2000000 VND, which will be used to pay for services to increase crop yield. The loan will be the fifth loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. C. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To pay for services to increase crop yield

loans.name: Oqtay

texts.en: Oqtay A. is a trader who has run his own business since 1995. He started this business and built his own shop, step by step, from his savings. Oqtay is married and has two children. He sells different kinds of goods such as sweets, home products, bath accessories, etc. This is the only source of income for his family. Oqtay tries his best to cover the family’s needs and to provide an excellent education for both of his children. Oqtay’s dream is to hand over the business to his children in the future. For this purpose he is applying for a US$1500 loan to increase the number of items he sells.

loans.use: To increase merchandise in shop.

loans.name: Mahmadisso

texts.ru: Гуломов Махмадиссо проживает в районе Абдурахмони Джоми. Возраст 36 лет , женат и имеет пятерых детей. Образования не имеет , работает в сфере животоноводства. Обратился к нам за кредитом для того, чтобы купить молодых породистых бычков. Таким образом он сможет  увеличить поголовье скота и улучшить положение бизнеса.
texts.en:
Mahmadisso G. lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi district. He is 36 years old, married and has five children. He has no formal education and works in the animal husbandry sphere. He reached out to us to obtain a loan in order to purchase young purebred bulls. This will enable Mahmadisso to increase his livestock headcount and improve his business situation.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of purebred bulls

loans.name: Alifali

texts.en: Alifali M. is a shop vendor who sells a variety of goods including women's clothing, textiles and kitchen articles. He has more than fifteen years of experience in this field. He reached his original goal two years ago when he realized his dream of building his own store. His one son studies at school, and Alifali dreams of providing him with an excellent education. To continue the growth of his business, Alifali applied for a $2000 loan with the loan term of fifteen months.

loans.use: To purchase more textiles to sell

loans.name: Elnur

texts.en: Elnur S. is twenty-eight years old and a trader who sells different kinds of products in the local bazaar. He sells home products, women's and children's clothing, sweets, beverages and other goods. He has three years of experience in this field. Originally, Elnur was an accountant, but it was very hard to provide for his wife and two children on the salary he was receiving, so he decided to start his own business. His knowledge of accounting helps him in the success of his current business and will make him successful in the future. Elnur applied for a $1200 loan to increase the amount of goods he sells, especially in the clothing line, because these products are in high demand.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Pascaline

texts.fr:
N. Pascaline est née en 1966. Pascaline est mariée à EZEBADA Hilaire; elle est mère d’une seule fille qui va au baccalauréat cette année. Pascaline est couturière et vend aussi les articles de mercerie. Pascaline s’approvisionne en articles de mercerie à Tokpa, grand international du Bénin. Pascaline veut développer son activité pour mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle. C'est la raison pour laquelle Pascaline sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Pascaline N. was born in 1966. She is married to Hilaire Ezebada and the mother of an only daughter who is going to try for her advanced high school diploma this year. Pascaline is a seamstress and also sells sewing supplies. She buys her supplies at Tokpa, the big international market of Benin. Pascaline wants to develop her business so as to better satisfy the needs of her clientele. This is why she is requesting a loan from ALIDé.

The significance of ALIDé in the local language of Bénin, Fon, is "there is always a pathway for the poorest of the poor. Bénin is a small West African country next door to Nigeria; the GDP of its inhabitants stands at US$ 1,500. ALIDé offers special loans at 0% interest for very vulnerable persons, and it is in a group which will soon be offering a micro health insurance program for micro-loan beneficiaries.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of sewing notions for re-sale

loans.name: Agamed

texts.en: Agamed M. is a fifty-three year old trader who owns his own food store where he sells a variety of goods, including cookies, sweets, pasta and beverages. Agamed is married and has five children. He tries very hard to provide for all of his family's needs. Being in this business for more than fifteen years has contributed to his success. People in the village know his store very well and always come back again because Agamed is very friendly and polite with customers.

loans.use: To buy food by the case to increase income.

loans.name: Sevinj

texts.en: Sevinj H. is a thirty-year-old mother, and at the same time a very successful entrepreneur. She started her business in 2002 when her husband passed away, and she had to feed her son. Being without higher education and job experience, she decided to borrow money from relatives to start her business. Sevinj chooses to sell very popular, best-selling dishes including both dinner and tea sets. These goods are in very high demand among young ladies and those who are getting married. Her business brings permanent income to Sevinj so she can pay for her son’s education. She applied for a $1200 loan to increase the number of items she sells. Let’s wish good luck to this brave and hardworking woman.

loans.use: To increase number of items

loans.name: Mgeni

texts.en:
Mgeni has been a clothes and home utensils seller in the Jang’ombe neighborhood of Zanzibar for four years. She belongs to the Mkorofi si mwenzetu group loan (Group code 2012).  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $60. She works twelve hours a day at her business.  

She is requesting her third loan from BRAC Tanzania, a Kiva field partner, so she can buy more items to expand her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to continue to grow her business.  

Mgeni is forty-seven years old, married, and has four children, aged twenty-seven, eighteen, sixteen and thirteen.

loans.use: To buy more items to expand her business.

loans.name: Zarobiddin

texts.ru: Давлатов Заробиддин проживает в районе Абдурахмони Джоми. Возраст 29 лет , женат и имеет двоих детей. Уже пять лет занимается бизнесом . Имеет магазин , где  торгует продуктами питания. Торговая точка находится на центральном рынке. Торгует конфетами. Бизнес имеет неплохую прибыль, так как его продукция пользуется спросом у населения. Таким образом он обратился к нам за кредитом для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот.
texts.en:
Zarobiddin D. lives in the Abdurahmon Jami district. He is 29 years old, married and has two children. He has been an entrepreneur for five years. He owns a store where he sells food products. His store is located at the central market. Zarobiddin sells candy. The business returns a fairly good profit because his products are in high demand. He requested a loan from us in order to increase his goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase goods turnover

loans.name: Fowzya Group

texts.en:
Fowzya G. is the group leader of the Fowzya group. There are three members in this group. All of them would like to receive money for his/her own business.

Fowzya wants to take a loan for her husband’s business of fresh fruit products.  He wants to buy the necessary materials for his business.  BIbi Ahfeyza wants to take a loan for her business of quilt making. She wants to expand her business. Hamid khan wants to take a loan for his general store. He wants to make his shop larger. They are very happy with these loans to Afghanistan.
 
They want to say that these loans are very useful because they can provide a good chance for poor entrepreneurs to expand their businesses and become stronger in business and in life. This group appreciates this loan process  in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To enlarge their businesses

loans.name: Parviz

texts.en:
Parviz M. is a 29-year-old merchant who has been selling different foodstuffs in his own store for the last ten years. Parviz is married and has two children. He enjoys his type of business because he is very social and likes to talk with customers.

Parviz would like to expand his business and purchase more goods to increase his income. For this purpose he applied for 2500 USD loan.

loans.use: purchase more goods for re-sale

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.en:
L. Pham (0) is a 50-year-old female living in the town of Nghệ An. She is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, L. owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income from the business comes primarily from selling animal feed & farm-related products in the local community. L. has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2005, L. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. L. has successfully repaid a previous L. from TYM Fund. This previous L. was used to invest in expanding the business.

L. is now requesting a new L. of 18.000,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. The L. will be the 5th L. taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. L. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Tusikose Yote Group

texts.en:
Zainab is a clothes seller in the Jang’ombe neighborhood of Zanzibar. She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 125. Daily she works at her business.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes for re-sale. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Zainab is 30 years old, married, and has three children: ages 8, 4, and 3. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Zunubi, MwanaJ., and Zuwena. Each woman also has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for re-sale

loans.name: Gulmurod

texts.ru: Кенджаев Гулмурод проживает в районе Абдурахмони Джоми. Возраст 46 лет, женат и имеет четверых детей. Занимается торговлей и разведением крупно рогатого скота. Этим видом бизнеса занимается уже 16 лет. За кредитом обратился , чтобы использовать  сумму для покупки дойной коровы. таким образом он сможет обеспечить семью молоком , а лишнее смогут продавать и получать деньги.
texts.en:
Gulmurod K. lives in the Abdurahmon Jami district. He is 46 years old, married and has four children. He is involved in sales and breeding of cattle. He has been in this business for 16 years. Gulmurod requested this loan in order to purchase a dairy cow, so that he could supply milk for his family and sell any excess milk for a profit.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: 07-Đông Hải Group

texts.en:
The women of Group 07 can be found in Ái Sơn 1 village located in Đông Hải commune, Thanh Hoa City. Thanh Hoa City is ~150 km south of Hanoi. 




* Ms. T. Thị Hằng is the group leader of Group 07- Đông Hải.  Ms. Hằng is 30 years old and has 2 daughters, both of whom are currently studying in Grade 1. Her husband, Mr. Lê Phú Thắng works as a driver.  To increase their family income and reduce the difficulties of life, Ms. Hằng decided to join the loan program to expand her grocery sales.  Her business has benefited from previous loans and she now wishes to borrow a higher amount to increase the inventory in her grocery store and also to invest in raising pigs. Ms. Hằng wishes to borrow 6.000.000 VND (~$344.8 USD) to be repaid over 20 months.  This will be her 7th loan from FPW.




Other members in the group are also borrowing a similar loan:  
   
* Ms. T. Thị Két was born in 1959.  She hopes to use her funds to invest in pigs for breeding. 

* Mrs. N. Thị Phương was born in 1975.  She wishes to use her loan to invest in pigs for breeding as well as to purchase pears, apples, mangoes and oranges for re-sale. 

* Ms. Lê Thị The wishes to use her funds to buy pigs for breeding as well as to buy rice to make homemade rice wine to sell. 

* Ms. N. Thị Phương plans to use her loan to purchase rice seed to plant and seed to feed her pigs.
 
* Ms. N. Thị Phác hopes to use her funds to buy chickens, ducks and pigs to breed and fish to re-sell. 

* Ms. Lê Thị Huệ wishes to use her loan to purchase pigs for breeding and to buy mangoes, oranges and other seasonal fruit to peddle.



--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
* Nhóm vay 07 thôn Ái Sơn 1,Xã Đông Hải thuộc Thành Phố Thanh Hóa,tỉnh Thanh Hoá. Tỉnh Thanh Hoá cách Hà Nội 150 km về phía nam. Nhóm 07 có chị T. Thị Hằng làm nhóm trưởng,chị Hằng năm nay 30 tuổi,có 2 con gái đang học cấp 1. Chồng chị là Lê Phú Thắng làm nghề lái xe,để có thêm thu nhập ,giảm bớt khó khăn trong cuộc sống anh chị đã quyết định tham gia vay vốn của chương trình để mở rộng cửa hàng tạp hoá của mình, qua nhièu kỳ vay vốn ,công việc kinh doanh của anh chị rất có hiệu quả, anh chị tiếp tục tham gia vay vốn với số tiền cao hơn để mua thêm hàng tạp hoá về bán , ngoài ra anh chị còn mua thêm lợn về nuôi. Hiện nay chị đang vay số tiền là 6.000.000VNĐ(~344,8USD), thời hạn vay là 20 tháng, chu kỳ vay thứ 7.Các thành viên khác trong nhóm cũng có cùng mức vay như chị. * Chị T. Thị Két sinh năm 1959, vay vốn để mua lợn về nuôi. *Chị N. Thị Phương sinh năm 1975, chị dùng vốn vay để mua lợn về nuôi, mua lê,táo ,xoài ,cam để bán. * Chị Lê Thị The dùng vốn vay để mua lợn về nuôi, mua gạo về để nấu rượu bán. * Chị N. Thị Phương dùng vốn vay để mua lúa giống, mua lợn giống về nuôi. * Chị N. Thị Phác vay vốn để mua gà, ngan,lợn về nuôi, mua cá về bán. * Chị Lê Thị Huệ dùng vốn vay để mua lợn về nuôi, mua xoài, cam ,dưa, ổi để bán rong.

loans.use: To invest in a small grocery store, animal breeding, fruit re-sale, rice wine production, etc.

loans.name: Jacklyn

texts.en:
Jacklyn owns a small beauty salon and she is a salon items seller in the Jang’ombe neighborhood of Zanzibar. She belongs to Mtaji wa masiki loan group (Group code 2067). She currently earns a very small monthly profit. Daily she works at her business.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more salon items like shampoo, hair oil, and weave-ons for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Jacklyn is single, and has two children: ages 3 and 1.

loans.use: To buy more salon items like shampoo, weave-ons, and hair oil for re-sale

loans.name: Azizatou

texts.fr:
F. Azizatou est née vers les années 1980 à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Azizatou est mariée à TIDJANI Yacoubou; elle est mère d’un seul enfant de nom de Henri. Azizatou vend des produits cosmétiques et produits pour bébé (habits, biberons, chaussures, couches, etc.). Azizatou achète ces produits au grand marché international du Bénin et à Lomé, Capitale du Togo (pays frontalier au Bénin). Azizatou a eu deux prêts de ALIDé qu'elle a bien remboursés et avec lesquels elle a pu augmenter le niveau de son activité. Aujourd'hui, Azizatou sollicite un troisième crédit à ALIDé pour renforcer son fonds de roulement afin de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle. 


 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Azizatou F. was born around 1980 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. Azizatou is married to Yacoubou Tidjani; she is the mother of an only son named Henri. Azizatou sells cosmetics and baby items (clothing, bottles, shoes, diapers, etc.) She buys these products from the big international market of Benin and in Lomé, the capital of Togo (a country that borders Benin).

Azizatou has had two loans through ALIDé and she reimbursed them correctly. They allowed her to expand her business. Today, Azizatou is requesting a third loan from ALIDé to bolster her working capital so as to respond to the needs of her clientele more completely.

The significance of ALIDé in the local language of Bénin, Fon, is "there is always a pathway for the poorest of the poor. Bénin is a small West African country next door to Nigeria; the GDP of its inhabitants stands at US$ 1,500. ALIDé offers special loans at 0% interest for very vulnerable persons, and it is in a group which will soon be offering a micro health insurance program for micro-loan beneficiaries.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of clothing and shoes for babies, toilet soaps, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en:
Mwajuma has owned a food items shop in the Jang’ombe neighborhood of Zanzibar for 4 years. She belongs to Allah Karim group loan (Group code 2021). She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 80.Every day she works at her business for 8 hours.

She is requesting her third loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more food items for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Mwajuma is 22 years old, married, and has a one-year-old child.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Kioni

texts.en:
Kioni has owned a small food vendor store in the Jang’ombe neighborhood of Zanzibar for 9 years. She belongs to Allah Karim group loan (Group code 2021). She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 40. Every day she works at her business for 8 hours.

She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more food items for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Kioni is 48 years old, married, and has two children: ages 30 and 28.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Hikmatullo

texts.ru: Халимов Хикматулло проживает в районе Абдурахмони Джоми. Образование среднее. Всю жизнь занимается животноводством. Этот бизнес является единственным источником дохода его семьи. Он имеет хозяйство , где разводит бычков для продажи. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить поголовье скота. Это поможет развивать бизнес и уевличить доход семьи.
texts.en:
Hikmatullo H. lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi region. He has a high school education. He has been raising livestock for his entire life. This business is the sole source of income for his family. He has a plot where he raises bulls for sale. He plans to get credit in order to increase his livestock count. This will help to grow his business and increase the family’s income.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase livestock count

loans.name: Usijali Group

texts.en:
Ramla has been a potato seller in the Darajabovu neighborhood of Zanzibar for 3 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 40.Each day she works at her business for 12 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more potatoes for re-sale to expand her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Ramla is 29 years old, married, and has a two-year-old child. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Arafa, Nuru and Riziki. Each woman has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Rafoat

texts.ru: Рафоат – женщина 46 лет. Замужем, имеет 3-х детей. Занимается продажей сладостей и кондитерских изделий. Кондитерские изделия ей поставляет сестра а также дочка Рафоат помогает печь кондитерские изделия. Монад старается расширить свой бизнес и закупать импортные конфеты и сладости, для расширения своего ассортимента. Этим она хочет увеличить свой семейный доход.
texts.en:
Rafoat is a 46 year old woman. She is married and has 3 children. Rafoat sells sweets and baked items. Her sister supplies her with the baked goods and Rafoat’s daughter also helps to bake. She is trying to expand her business and to purchase imported candy and sweets in order to expand her product selection. She would like to increase her income this way.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase imported candy and sweets

loans.name: Tavarali

texts.ru: Шомахмадов Таварали проживает в районе Абдурахмони Джоми. Возраст 48 лет . женат и имеет семерых детей. Семья очень большая , поэтому он очень много работает для того, чтобы обеспечить свою семью.Он занимается и сельским хозяйством и животноводством. Кредит запрашивает для того, чтобы купить двух молодых и породистых бычков. Таким образом он обновит  поголовье ,а  так же сможет получать породистое потомство.
texts.en:
Tavarali S. lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi district. He is 48 years old, married and has seven children. His family is very big, and Tavarali has to work a lot in order to provide for his family. He is involved in both agriculture and animal husbandry. He is requesting the loan in order to buy two young purebred bulls. This will enable him to renew his livestock headcount and have a purebred breed.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of purebred bulls

loans.name: Jitahidini Group

texts.en:
Saumu has been a bites (chapati and maandazi--sweet fried breads) seller in the Darajabovu neighborhood of Zanzibar for 7 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 50. Every day she works at her business for 12 hours.

She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more food items for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Saumu is 32 years old, married, and has a seventeen-year-old child. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Fatma, who has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business

loans.name: Mireille

texts.fr:
S. Mireille est née vers les années 1977. Mireille est mariée à SOGBOSSI Sylvain et mère de deux enfants dont un seul est scolarisé. Mireille Réside au quartier fidjrossè un quartier populaire de la commune de Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Mireille vend les produits cosmétiques et les vêtements. Mireille a eu deux crédits de la part de ALIDé grâce auxquels elle a élargi son activité à la vente de chaussures et bijoux. Aujourd'hui, Mireille veut renforcer son fonds de roulement et développer son activité. C'est la raison pour laquelle Mireille sollicite un troisième prêt à ALIDé. 
 
 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Mireille S. was born around 1977. She is married to Sylvain Sogbossi and the mother of two children, of whom one is enrolled in school. Mireille lives in the Fidjrossè neighborhood, a working class district of the commune of Cotonou, economic capital of Bénin. Mireille sells cosmetics and clothing. She has had two loans through ALIDé, thanks to which she expanded her business to include selling shoes and costume jewelry. Today, Mireille wishes to bolster her working capital and further develop her business. That is why she is requesting a third loan from ALIDé. The significance of ALIDé in the local language of Bénin, Fon, is "there is always a pathway for the poorest of the poor. Bénin is a small West African country next door to Nigeria; the GDP of its inhabitants stands at US$ 1,500. ALIDé offers special loans at 0% interest for very vulnerable persons, and it is in a group which will soon be offering a micro health insurance program for micro-loan beneficiaries.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of costume jewelry, shoes, and cosmetics

loans.name: Asli

texts.ru: Давлатов Асли проживает в районе Абдурахмони Джоми. Возраст 47 лет, женат и имеет пятерых детей. Работает в дехканском хозяйстве , а так же в сфере животноводства. Имеет хозяйство , где разводит крупно рогатый скот. Обратился зха кредитом для того, чтобы купить дойную корову. Это поможет ему обеспечить семью молоком , а так же кисло молочными продуктами.
texts.en:
Asli D. lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi district. He is 47 years old, married and has five children. He works at a dekhan farm and also in the sphere of animal husbandry. Asli has a farm where he breeds cattle. He requested this loan to buy a dairy cow. This will help him to provide his family with milk and other dairy products.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a dairy cow

loans.name: Joséphine

texts.fr:
G. Joséphine est née dans les années 1971. Joséphine est mariée à HOUNTONDJI Patrice et mère de deux enfants tous scolarisés. Joséphine est couturière mais, elle vend aussi. Joséphine vend des détergents et des seaux et bassines en plastique; qu'elle distribue de maison en maison. Joséphine achète ses produits à Cotonou au grand marché international du Bénin. Grâce à son activité Joséphine aide son mari à subvenir aux charges de ménage notamment à la scolarité des enfants. Joséphine a déjà eu deux crédits de ALIDé; qu'elle a bien remboursés. Joséphine a pour projet de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle et d'éviter les ruptures de stock en ses différents produits qu'elle vend. C'est pourquoi Joséphine sollicite de ALIDé un troisième crédit. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
G. Joséphine was born in 1971. She is married to HOUNTONDJI Patrice and is the mother of two children, both in school. She is a seamstress, and she also sells detergents and plastic buckets, tubs, and basins. She distributes from house to house. Joséphine buys goods in Cotonou at the grand international marketplace of Benin. Thanks to her business, she is helping her husband provide for the household, notably with schooling costs for the children. She has had two Alidé loans before that she has repaid. Her plan is to do better in responding to the demands of her customers and to avoid shortages in the different products she sell. These are the reasons why she’s requesting a third loan from Alidé.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program for micro-loan recipients.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cloth for sewing and some detergents

loans.name: Mahmadmirzo

texts.ru: Дустов Махмадмирзо проживает в районе Абдурахмони Джоми. Возраст 51 год , женат и имеет восьмерых  детей. Всей семьей занимается животноводством и сельским хозяйством. Старший сын в России на заработках ,жена занимается посевом , а он уходом и откормкой за животными. Имеет небольшое хозяйство.Планирует получить кредит  для того, чтобы купить дойную корову. Так он сможет обеспечить семью молоком. Если будет лишнее , то он сможет продавать его и получать прибыль.
texts.en:
Mahmadmirzo D. lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi region. He is 51 years old, is married and has eight children. The whole family raises livestock and works in agriculture. The oldest son is in Russia earning money, the wife works on planting, and he takes care of and fattens the animals. He has a small farm. Mahmadmirzo plans to receive credit in order to purchase a dairy cow. This way he will be able to provide the family with milk. If there are leftovers, he will be able to sell it and make a profit.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Saodat

texts.en:
A. Saodat is a hard-working woman and since 1996 has dedicated herself to selling a variety of vegetables in the central market of Dushanbe. She characterized herself as happy and humble. She started her business with her savings which she had accumulated over a long period of time. She is the mother of 4 children that she would like to offer an education as they are minors.

Her biggest dream is to prepare her children to have professions so they don't have to suffer like she did since childhood, working at hard labor. To realize this dream, Saodat now requests 1000 USD for a term of 9 months. With this loan she wants to buy more goods to increase her earnings.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History <> Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Increasing the range of vegetables she sells

loans.name: Abdull Jamel Group

texts.en:
Abdull Jamel is the group leader of the Abdull Jamel group. There are four members in this group. Each of them would like to take a loan for their own business. The total of their group loan is 30000Af for the term of 10 months.

Abdull Jamel wants to take a loan for his business of selling vegetables. He wants to buy necessary materials for his shop. Fowzya wants to take a loan for her business of tailoring. She wants to buy new machine for her business. Syweta wants to take a loan for her husband’s general store. He wants to expand his business. Maryna wants to take a loan for her business of carpet weaving.

They want to say that these loans will be used for growing and enlarging the businesses and they all want to thank the Kiva process in Afghanistan for supporting poor people.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Amirbeg

texts.ru: Давлатов Амирбег житель района Абдурахмони Джоми. Возраст 49 лет, женат и имеет четверых детей. Старший сын работает в Российской Федерации. Сам клиент вместе с женой работают в сельском хозяйстве , а так же  в сфере животноводства.Бизнесом по перепродаже крупно рогатого скота они работают уже 12 лет. Сейчас планируют купить еще пару молоденьких бычков для их откормки и дальнейшей перепродажи.
texts.en:
Amirbeg D. lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi region. He is 49 years old, is married and has four children. His older son works in the Russian Federation. The client himself together with his wife works in agriculture and raises livestock. They have had a business reselling large livestock for 12 years now. Now they plan to purchase two more young bulls in order to fatten them and resell them in the future.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increaese livestock count

loans.name: Djamilya

texts.en:
D. Djamilya is 42 years old. She is married with three children. Djamilya sells different kinds of salads made of vegetables which she prepares herself. She has been in this kind of business for almost 16 years and has gained rich experiences and many constant customers. Her children help her with the business. She works very hard to give them a good education and to make them happy.

Today Djamilya is planning to expand the business and purchase more vegetables to prepare more kinds of salads for selling. With this purpose she requests 1300 US Dollars for a term of 9 months. Djamilya and her faithful children are counting on your help. Let’s get behind this dedicated mother to help her with increasing the business.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule.
