It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing vegetables for preparing salads to sell

loans.name: Anastasiya

texts.en:
Anastasiya M. is 26. She is married with two children. Anastasiya is selling makeup and cosmetics. She has been in the business for two years already. Anastasiya is dreaming of expanding her business and opening her own store.  She wants to establish contacts with the constant suppliers of well-known producers. Anastasiya and her husband are working hard in order to have sufficient funds for educating of their kids so that they become highly sought-after experts in the future. 

Now Anastasiya requests US $900 in order to purchase new make-up, such as lipsticks, mascaras, powder, skin cream, etc. with the aim of increasing the range of goods she sells. Anastasiya would like to thank everybody supporting her and promises to pay the loan. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To increase store inventory

loans.name: Sabr

texts.en: Sabr Z. is a 38 year old trader who rents a store where he has sold different kind of goods for the last five years. Sabr is married and has two children. He trying his best to meet all the needs of his children and provide them with an excellent education. Sabr applied for a US $1200 loan to increase the number of goods he sells.

loans.use: To increase store inventory

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en:
Nargis S. is an enterprising woman with a big desire to improve the quality of life of her family. She is married and the mother of three children. Because of difficult living conditions and the lack of a job her husband had to leave for Russia for employment.

Nargis has been a seamstress since she was very young, learning in her mother's office. She was able to open her own shop at her home 20 years ago and has been successful because her customers have recognized the high quality of her products. In this way, she constantly adds new clients and has seen her business grow. Today Nargis is applying for a loan from IMON International for the second time. She is requesting a loan of US $1050 for the term of 10 months to purchase spring fabrics for sewing the national dress. You can help improve the quality of life of Nargis’s family.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase spring fabrics

loans.name: Zulhumor

texts.ru: Худжамуродова Зулхумор проживает в районе Хуросон. Возраст 47 лет, вдова с одним ребенком на руках. Арендует магазин , в котором продает продукты питания. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже пять лет. Для покупки холодильной камеры , которая необходима для хранения продуктов в летнее время, она решила получить кредит. А часть денег , которая останется использовать для товарооборота.
texts.en:
Zulhumor H. lives in the Huroson district. She is 47 years old, a widow with a young child. She sells groceries in a rented store. She has been in this type of business for five years already. She decided to apply for a loan to buy a cold storage unit necessary for keeping foods fresh during summer. A bit of leftover money will by used for turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cold storage unit

loans.name: Cécile Edwige

texts.fr:
G. Cécile Edwige est née vers 1974. Cécile Edwige est mariée à GLELE Paul; elle est mère de deux (2) enfants tous scolarisés. Cécile Edwige réside avec sa famille au quartier fidjrossè à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Cécile Edwige vend des chaussures et sacs ainsi que des divers (bonbons, biscuits, boîtes de lait, de sardines, de tomates, de sucres, les pâtes alimentaires, les savons de lessive, de vaisselle et de toilette, etc.). Cécile Edwige achète ses articles à Cotonou au grand marché international du Bénin. Cécile Edwige a eu deux crédits de ALIDé qu'elle a bien remboursés et avec quoi elle a élevé le niveau de son activité. Cécile Edwige demande un troisième prêt à ALIDé; toujours dans le but de développer son activité afin de faire plus de profit pour mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. 


 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
G. Cécile Edwige was born around 1974. She is married to GLELE Paul and is the mother of two children, both in school. She resides with her family in the Fidjrossè district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. She sells shoes and bags, as well as various goods (candy, cookies, cans of milk, sardines, and tomatoes, sugar, pasta, and soaps for the laundry, dishes, and bath, etc.) She buys her merchandise in Cotonou at the grand international marketplace of Bénin. Cécile Edwige has had two Alidé loans before and has repaid them. With those loans, she raised her level of business activity. She’s asking Alidé for a third loan today with the goal of developing her business, so as to make more profit for supporting her family better.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program for micro-loan recipients.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods:  soap, detergents, past, peanut oil, sugar, shoes and bags, and canned milk and sardines

loans.name: Mahmadrajab

texts.ru: Джураев Махмадраджаб проживает в районе Хуросон. Женат и имеет четверых детей. Имеет тандыр рядом с домом , где выпекает самбусу. Хочет получить кредит для того, чтобы закупить самбусу и масло для производства самбусы. В дальнейшем он планирует развивать свой бизнес и расширять точку.
texts.en:
Mahmadrajab J. lives in the Huroson district. He is married and has four children. He has a traditional oven near his house which he uses to bake sambusa, traditional filled breads. He would like a loan to buy flour and oil for making the sambusa. In the future he plans to further develop the business and expand the bakery.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Flour and oil purchase

loans.name: Shiraz

texts.en: Shiraz S. is a 42 year old man who sells sweets, candies, tea and some home products in his small store which he rents. Shiraz has two years of experience in this field. His dream is to build his own store in the future. Now he enjoys his business and is trying his best to grow it and provide the best future for his three children. Shiraz applied for a US $1200 loan to purchase more goods for his store.

loans.use: To increase store inventory

loans.name: Davud

texts.en:
Davud I. is a 26-year-old man who lives and works in the small village of Agsu city. He is married and has run his own business for three years. Davud sells beverages, cookies and cleaning agents. He also works as a driver, taking people from his village to downtown and back. But the store brings in the main income for his family.

Davud would like to expand his business and purchase more goods for his store. He believes this will increase his monthly income and improve his life conditions.

loans.use: Purchase more products for sale

loans.name: Pardali

texts.ru: Содиков Пардали житель района Хуросон. Возраст 45 лет , женат и имеет двоих детей. Уже 10 лет, занимается торговлей автозапчастями. Торговая точка находиться на центральном рынке района. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот.
texts.en:
Pardali S. lives in the Huroson district. He is 45 years old, married, and has two children. For the past 10 years he has worked selling spare auto parts. His store is in the district's central market. He plans to use a loan to increase sales turnover. The loan will be repaid over 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase sales turnover

loans.name: Zamina

texts.en:
Zamina S. is a 36-year-old woman who is dedicated to her business raising sheep. Zamina has been in this business for the last eight years. She is married and has three children. She is dedicated to them and tries to give them the best she has.

Zamina wakes up early in the morning and spends all day looking after her sheep. She decided on sheep breeding because it is very profitable business and brings good income to her family. Now Zamina would like to increase her herd and purchase 20 sheep. For this purpose she has applied for 2000 USD as a loan.

loans.use: purchase 20 sheep

loans.name: Elkhan

texts.en: Elkhan Q. has very interesting sort of business: he is a bee keeper. He started his business in 2005 when he lost his job. Elkhan is responsible for his five children and tries to expand his business. Honey is very popular, not only in the village where he lives but also in the whole of Azerbaijan; people value quality honey very highly. This business requires a lot of attention and care and Elkhan spends most of his time near his bees.  Elkhan would like to expand his business and for this purpose he needs 2000 USD as a loan.

loans.use: purchase more bee hives

loans.name: Zumrud

texts.en: Zumrud Q. is a 38-year-old woman who raises calves in the small village of Agsu. She is married and has five children!  Zumrud is a housewife and her business is the only source of income in her family. She got into this business when she was very young, and thanks to know-how that her parents shared with her, she is very experienced in her business. Financial limits don’t allow her to expand her business enough. Now she has applied for 1500 USD as a loan to purchase three calves and fodder.

loans.use: purchase three calves and fodder

loans.name: Safura

texts.en: Safura M. is a 42-year-old woman who raises calves and brings up her two children. Safura started this business five years ago to increase income in her family and cover her children's basic needs. Safura has applied for 1500 USD loan to purchase three calves and fodder. She is dreaming of providing her children an excellent education. Safura and her family count on your help.

loans.use: purchase three calves and fodder

loans.name: Rafiq

texts.en:
Rafiq F. is a 59-year-old merchant who sells different kinds of food in his own store. Rafiq started his business more than 20 years ago. He is also an accountant which helps him to run his business. Rafiq is married and has five children.

Rafiq has dedicated his life to bringing up his children and providing excellent education for them. Rafiq would like to expand his business and purchase more food products and in the future open one more store where his son will be working.

loans.use: purchase more goods for his store

loans.name: Paula

texts.fr: Mme Paula K. est née le 13/01/1965 à Vogan. Elle est mariée et est mère de trois (03) enfants avec deux autres personnes en charge. N’ayant pas eu la chance de faire de brillantes études par faute de moyens financiers, elle s’est très tôt lancée dans l’apprentissage de la fabrication du pain (boulangerie) avec l’aide de ses parents. A la fin de sa formation, grâce à son savoir faire, elle a très vite conquit la confiance de sa clientèle par la qualité de son produit. Actuellement, la demande dépasse l’offre, mais Mme Paula K. n’a pas les moyens nécessaires pour répondre aux besoins de ses clients. Elle sollicite donc un financement pour s’installer convenablement, s’approvisionner en farines de blé et sucre et s’équiper en outils de travail. Les revenus tirés de cette activité lui permettront de mieux contribuer aux charges de sa famille et à la bonne éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Ms. Paula K. was born on January 1, 1965 in Vogan. She is married and the mother of three, plus she has two other people to support. Having lacked the chance to excel in school due to a lack of financial means, she soon got started in an apprenticeship for making bread (baking) with the help of her parents. At the end of her training, thanks to her know-how, she quickly won over the trust of her customers through the quality of her product. Right now, the demand exceeds the supply, but Ms. K. doesn’t have the means necessary to respond to the need. She’s therefore requesting financing to get situated appropriately, to get supplies of flour and sugar, and to equip herself with tools of the trade. The revenues derived from this work will enable her to do better in helping to cover family expenses and to provide the right education for her children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make and sell bread

loans.name: Félicité

texts.fr: Née en 1967 à Tsévié, mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants, Mme Félicité A. est une charmante femme qui a depuis son jeune age du penchant pour le commerce. Ainsi, lorsque l’occasion s’est offerte à elle, Mme A. n’a pas hésité à embrasser le commerce de vente de chaussures et sacs pour femmes avec détermination dans le marché de sa localité. Grâce à sa clairvoyance, elle gère bien cette activité avec la collaboration de son mari qui n’a pas un emploi stable. Elle sollicite un financement pour louer un grand magasin, varier ses gammes de produits et élargir son étalage. Les bénéfices tirés de son commerce contribueront à renouveler régulièrement son stock et à améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Born in 1967 in Tsévié, married and the mother of 3 children, Mrs. Félicité A. is a charming woman who, since her youth, has had a taste for commerce. Thus, when the occasion presented itself, Mrs. A. did not hesitate to take up selling shoes and women's handbags with determination, in her local market.

Thanks to her clairvoyance, she has been managing this business well, with the collaboration of her husband who does not have a steady job. She is requesting a loan to rent a big store, vary her assortment of products, and expand her shelving. The profit from her business contributes to regular renewal of her inventory and to improving living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of shoes and women's handbags

loans.name: Honorine

texts.fr: Mme Honorine B. est née le 20/ 01/1986 à Kara. Mariée et mère d’un (01) enfant, elle est coiffeuse de formation. Elle a très vite dompté sa clientèle par son accueil exemplaire et son sourire légendaire. Afin de bien couvrir tous les besoins de ses clients, elle a associé à la coiffure, la vente des produits de beauté. Très appréciée par la qualité de son travail, elle sollicite un emprunt financier pour mieux équiper son salon des outils de travail modernes et plus performants. Les recettes pourront l’aider à mieux s’émanciper, à bien organiser son foyer avec son mari chômeur et veiller à l’éducation de leur enfant.
texts.en:
Mrs. Honorine B. was born on January 20, 1986 in Kara. Married and the mother of one child, she is a trained hairdresser. She quickly won over her clientele with her exemplary welcome and her legendary smile.

So as to respond to all the needs of her customers, Honorine sells beauty products as well as doing hairdressing. She is greatly appreciated for the quality of her work. She is requesting a loan so as to better equip her salon with more modern and efficacious equipment. The income will help her to be independent and organize her household correctly, in view of the fact that her husband is out of work, and let her see to the education of their child.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: equiping her beauty salon and selling beauty products

loans.name: Baby

texts.fr: Née à Bassar en 1970, Mme Baby K. est mariée et mère d’un (01) enfant. C’est grâce à son petit commerce de vente de louga (biscuit d’arachide grillé et du sucre), bonbons, arachide grillée qu’elle arrive à subvenir aux charges de sa famille. Aujourd’hui, elle veut agrandir son étalage et faire augmenter son chiffre d’affaires mais n’a pas les moyens financiers nécessaires. Elle sollicite un financement pour louer une petite boutique, élargir son stock et augmenter ses revenus. Ainsi, elle pourra avec l’aide de son mari contribuer à l’émancipation de toute la famille.
texts.en:
Born in Bassar in 1970, Mrs. Baby K. is married and the mother of one child. It is thanks to her little business selling "louga" (sweet biscuits made of grilled peanuts and sugar), candy, and grilled peanuts that she manages to support her family. Today she would like to expand her display space and grow her turnover, but she does not have the necessary financial means. She is requesting a loan to rent a little store, expand her inventory, and increase her revenue. Thus she will be able, with the help of her husband, to contribute to freeing up the whole family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: production and sale of snacks

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria has been growing vegetables for more than 4 years. She has two greenhouses with a total area of 180 m2, and raises tomatoes, cabbage, eggplant, radishes, watermelons and carrots. This year she wants to buy seeds for the already advanced business in Chisinau City. Now she wants to buy film for her greenhouses, which will be procured from Odessa. Victoria decided to borrow a sum from Microinvest to purchase film and seedlings necessary for vegetables. For the future she plans to grow fruits that also are requested by her customers.

loans.use: increase working capital

loans.name: Monifa

texts.fr: Agée d’une cinquantaine d’années et avec sept (07) personnes à charge, Mme Monifa M. est née à Sokodé et vit avec son mari qui contribue tant bien que mal aux charges du ménage malgré ses moyens financiers très limités. Le commerce de vente de "Watsè" (riz préparé avec du haricot, du piment sec rouge et de l’huile) très apprécié dans la région centrale du pays, mais aussi dans certaines localités de la capitale (Lomé) connaît un coup d’arrêt dû à la crise financière qui frappe les pays en voie de développement dont le Togo. Elle sollicite donc un financement pour stoker du riz,du haricot,de lhuile afin de rentabiliser son activité. Ce qui lui permettra d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa nombreuse famille.
texts.en:
Around 50 years of age and with 7 persons for whom she is responsible, Mrs. Monifa M. was born in Sokodé and lives with her husband who contributes what he can to their household expenses, despite his very limited means. Her business selling "Watsè" (rice prepared with dried beans, dried red peppers, and oil), very much appreciated in the central part of the country but also in certain parts of the capital (Lomé), has been dealt a blow by the economic crisis which is striking the developing countries, Togo included. She is requesting a loan to stock up on rice, dried beans, and oil, so as to put her business on a stable footing. This will allow her to improve living conditions for her numerous family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: preparation and sale of a cooked rice dish

loans.name: Assiba

texts.fr:
J.	Assiba est âgée de 52 ans; elle est scolarisée. Assiba est mariée à DEGBE Pierre et mère de trois enfants tous scolarisés. Les enfants de Assiba sont respectivement âgés de 35 ans, 30 ans et 25 ans. Assiba réside au quartier gbégamey un quartier populaire de la ville de Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Assiba vend des céréales depuis une vingtaine d’années dans l’un des marchés décentralisés de la ville de Cotonou. Assiba achète ses produits à Cotonou, au marché international du Bénin. Assiba est à son troisième crédit avec ALIDé. Pour éviter les problèmes de rupture de stock en céréale comme d'habitude, Assiba décide de s’approvisionner en quantité importante auprès des grossistes. C'est pourquoi Assiba demande de prêt à ALIDé. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
Assiba J., 52, is married to Pierre Degbe and the mother of 3 children. Her children are aged 35, 30, and 25. Assiba lives in the Gbégamey district, a working class neighborhood of the town of Cotonou, economic capital of Benin.

Assiba has been selling cereals for about 20 years in one of the decentralized markets in the town of Cotonou. She buys her products in Cotonou, in the international market of Benin. She is on her third loan with ALIDé. In order to avoid running short of cereals, as often happens, Assiba decided to stock up, buying from wholesalers. That is why she is requesting the loan from ALIDé.

The meaning of ALIDé in the local language of Benin, Fon, is "there is always a pathway for the poorest of the poor". Benin is a small West African country next to Nigeria, where the GDP stands at US$ 1,500 per inhabitant.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of sacks of wheat flour, manioc flour, maize, and rice

loans.name: Hélène

texts.fr: Mme Hélène G. est née le 16/07/1964 à Tsévié. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants. Avec le concours de son mari, elle a commencé la vente de riz blanc et de spaghetti préparés devant un établissement scolaire de sa localité. "Maman Moluto" comme aiment l’appeler affectueusement les écoliers et les enseignants, elle a très vite conquit la confiance des enfants par son service de qualité, son enthousiasme et son hygiène. Aujourd’hui, Mme G. sollicite un financement pour stocker du riz, s’approvisionner en spaghetti, huile, ingrédients et autres. Les profits serviront à l’éducation des enfants et à l’amélioration de leur condition sociale.
texts.en:
Ms. Hélène G. was born on July 16, 1964 in Tsévié. She is married and the mother of four. With the assistance of her husband, she started selling white rice and cooked spaghetti in front of an educational establishment in her town. "Maman Moluto", as the school student and teachers affectionately like to call her, has quickly won over the children’s trust through her quality service, enthusiasm, and cleanliness. Today, she’s requesting financing to stock up on rice and to get supplies of spaghetti, oil, and other ingredients. The profits will be used for educating the children and for improving their social condition.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock up on, make, and sell rice

loans.name: Kokoè

texts.fr: Agée d’environ trente-cinq (35) ans, Mme Kokoè A. est mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants. Très soucieuse du bien être de son foyer, elle entreprit très tôt la préparation et la vente du jus de caramel pour soulager les charges de son ménage, son mari étant sans emploi stable. Actuellement, elle sollicite un financement pour stocker les matières premières. Les revenus serviront au maintien et à la survie de toute la famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Kokoè A. is about 35 years old, married, and the mother of four. Very concerned about the well-being of her family, she soon started an enterprise, making and selling jus de caramel in order to alleviate household expenses, since her husband is without stable employment. Currently, she’s requesting financing to stock up on basic ingredients. The revenues will go toward caring for and the survival of her whole family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make and sell "jus de caramel"

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 50 years old and married with 5 children. She sells sarongs and shoes. She hopes to own a boutique in future. She is requesting the loan amount of N 40,000  to purchase more sarongs and shoes to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and shoes to sell

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.fr:
A.	Jeanne est née vers les années 1966. Jeanne est mariée à AHOUISSOU Francis et mère de cinq enfants. Seulement deux, des cinq enfants sont scolarisés. Jeanne Résidente à Cotonou. C'est les perles que Jeanne vend depuis vingt cinq ans dans l’un des marchés locaux de Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Grâce à cette activité Jeanne arrive à satisfaire ses besoins et ceux de ses enfants. Jeanne a pour projet de renforcer son fonds de roulement afin de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle. C'est la raison pour laquelle, Jeanne demande de crédit à ALIDé. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
A. Jeanne was born around 1966. She is married to AHOUISSOU Francis and is the mother of five children. Only two of these five are in school. Jeanne resides in Cotonou. What she has been selling for twenty years is pearls, at one of the local marketplaces of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Thanks to this business of her, she is managing to satisfy the needs of her children and her own as well. Her plan is to boost her working capital in order to respond better to customer demands. That’s why she’s asking Alidé for a loan.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program for micro-loan recipients.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pearls

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El socio es el Sr.: Carlos; natural de la ciudad de Cusco, vive en la asociación pro vivienda San Antonio I-5 en el distrito de Santiago en la ciudad de Cusco.

Nuestro socio tiene 45 años de edad el es casado con doña Florentina y tienen 4 hijos de (24, 23, 19, 14) años, el socio tiene una carpintería ubicada en su domicilio, siendo esta su principal actividad, el hace muebles y los acabados los realiza su esposa, ellos trabajan para seguir apoyando a sus hijos con sus estudios y así darles una mejor calidad de vida, el socio solicita el préstamo para poder comprar materiales de carpintería y así hacer un número mayor de muebles para vender.

El socio se encuentra muy feliz con el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago respectivo de su préstamo en el plazo programado.
texts.en:
Sr. Carlos was born and raised in Cusco, where he sill lives, in San Antonio I-5, in the neighbourhood of Santiago. He is 45 years old and married to Doña Florentina. Together, they have 4 children, who are 14, 19, 23, and 24 years old. Carlos runs a carpentry business from his home, building furniture that his wife then finishes.They are working so that they can continue to support their children's studies and improve the family's quality of life. This loan will be used to buy material for furniture making so that Carlos can increase his stock. Carlos is very happy with the support he has received from the communal bank and is committed to making his payments responsibly.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wood and tools

loans.name: Abigail M.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings) from Tanzania! This is 30-year-old Abigail N. from Mbeya. She is married with 2 children, aged 7 and 10. Abigail has been running a "duka" business since 2007. She owns a small "duka" or neighborhood shop in the city where she sells common household and grocery items.

She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 7 days per week. Abigail currently earns about 250 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 600 USD in order to purchase items in bulk for her business. In the future, she plans to diversify her business. Abigail thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback micro-finance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase items in bulk for her business

loans.name: Rosario Group

texts.es: El grupo Rosario está conformado en su mayoría por mujeres con la presencia de un solo hombre que se dedica a la venta de periodicos y revistas y es el socio que demuestra mayor responsabilidad, pero en general las socias se dedican a la venta de diferentes productos pero por la misma actividad que realizan necesitan a menudo mayor capital de trabajo por esta razón estas socias quieren seguir trabajando con Agrocaptal pues consideran que con nosotros tienen alguna ventaja. por lo mismo la presidenta en alguna ocación realiza charlas de reflexión a las socias.
texts.en:
The Rosario group is made up of primarily women and only one man. He sells newspapers and magazines, and he is the most responsible member. In general, the members sell different products. They frequently need more working capital. The group wants to keep working with Agrocapital. Agrocapital sees the advantage in working with them, and occasionally its president conducts business conferences with them.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
La socia es la sra. AURELIA; ella es natural de Cusco, vive en la asociación pro vivienda en el distrito de Santiago en el departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 49 años de edad y es casada, ella tiene 3 hijos de (23, 16, 13) años, la socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, ella tiene un restaurante ubicado en la calle pera 489, ella elabora diferentes platos típicos en su local, para lo cual desea el préstamo para poder comprar productos al por mayor y abastecer su negocio, ella manifiesta que se vienen meses altos y también subirán los productos.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado para realizar sus compras y así tener mayor ingreso de su venta por lo que se compromete a pagar el total de su préstamo en el tiempo determinado.
texts.en:
Sra. AURELIA was born and raised in Cusco. She lives in the neighbourhood of Santiago, in Cusco city. She is 49 years old, married, and has 3 children who are 13, 16 and 23 years old. As well as taking care of her home, Aurelia runs a restaurant at 489 Perra St., where she serves traditional food. She is requesting this loan so that she can buy the things she needs for her business, including a few high tables and the ingredients for her meals. Aurelia is grateful for this loan, as it will allow her to improve her business and thus, increase her income. She is committed to making her payments responsibly.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock a restaurant's kitchen

loans.name: Margaret Nabachwa 's Group

texts.en:
Margaret is 40 years of age and married with 8 children, aged between 7 and 22. All her children go to school. She owns a five-roomed house where she lives with ten people and takes care of additional family members (orphans of her late sister). She has access to electricity and piped water at home. The family gets two meals a day.

Margaret sells charcoal in Kisaasi market in one of the city suburbs and that is how she earns a living. She rents her stall at 25,000 /= a month and receives about 20 customers a day. Margaret doesn’t incur any transport cost as she buys from her place of work and works seven days a week. She has done this business for 6 years now and prior to this she had a poultry farm at her home, but because of cocidiosis she lost all her chickens

This is her 8th loan ever since she joined MCDT; she has been with MCDT for 4 years, working with the same group mates for 1 and a 1/2 years. Margaret wants to use this loan partly to buy more sacks of charcoal and also to pay school fees for her children who are at a higher level. Margaret hopes to build a house from her savings and also own a permanent place for her business.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Valeriu

texts.en:
Valeriu has two greenhouses on a surface of 776 m. p. He works growing tomatoes, cucumbers, peppers, and eggplants. Business is profitable because Valeriu has experience in business and knows how to use technology for increasing vegetable production. He also has 1. 5 hectares of arable land where he grows cabbages and onions. 

Valeriu sells his vegetables at the wholesale market in his district. Valeriu used to grow vegetables mostly in the field, but now he grows them in the greenhouses. He has taken out a loan from Microinvest to purchase film to build another greenhouse.

loans.use: construction of a new greenhouse

loans.name: Bupe A.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 38-year-old Bupe M. from Kyela. She is married with five children, between the ages of 9 and 18. Bupe has been running a small shop since 2007. She owns a small duka or neighborhood shop in the city where she sells common household and grocery items.

She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by her husband. Bupe currently earns about US $210 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of USD 400 in order to purchase commodities such as sugar, salt, cooking oil, soap and rice in bulk. In the future, she plans to open a new business. Bupe thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase commodities in bulk for retail sale

loans.name: Florentina

texts.es:
Nuestra socia es la sra. FLORENTINA; ella es del departamento de Cusco, vive en la asociación pro vivienda en San Antonio en el distrito de Santiago en Cusco.

La socia tiene 45 años de edad y es casada con el socio sr. Carlos, ella tiene 4 hijos (24, 23, 19, 14) años de edad, la socia alterna sus actividades domésticas con el comercio, ella realiza los acabados de los muebles que su esposo hace, ella los tapiza, y hace los almohadones y cojines de los diferentes modelos de muebles, si son roperos los pule y los barniza con varias capas, a otros les pone pinturas esmaltes y según sea el pedido de los clientes. Para lo cual la socia requiere el préstamo para poder comprar materiales y telas para los sillones.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago general de su préstamo en el plazo programado.
texts.en:
Our member is FLORENTINA. She is from the Peruvian departamento of Cusco and lives in the Santiago district of Cusco.

She is 45 years old and is married to another member, Carlos. She has 4 children (24-, 23-, 19-, and 14-years old, respectively). She alternates her responsibilities at home with a business finishing the furniture that her husband makes. She does the upholstery and makes pillows and cushions for upholstered pieces; for wardrobes, she polishes and applies layers of varnish; for other pieces, she paints or applies enamel, depending on what her customers order. The member needs the loan to be able to buy materials and supplies for the business.

The member is grateful that loans are available in this way and she commits herself to repaying the loan in the agreed-upon time.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials and supplies for furniture business.

loans.name: Tinuke

texts.en: Tinuke G. is 45 years old and married with 4 children. She sells sarongs at retail to her customers. She hawks her goods with a tray on her head from street to street within her community. She is requesting the loan amount of 50,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Justine

texts.fr:
C. Justine est née le 26 Septembre 1963. Justine est mariée à COUAO ZOTTI Jonas et est mère de quatre enfants tous scolarisés. Justine vend des divers (bonbons, biscuits, boîtes de lait, de sardines, de tomates, de sucres, les pâtes alimentaires, les savons de lessive, de vaisselle et de toilette, etc.). Justine achète ses articles à DANTOKPA, marché international du Bénin. C'est dans l'optique de diversifier son activité et de renforcer son capital que Justine sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé.

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
Justine C. was born on September 26, 1963. She's married to Jonas COUAO ZOTTI, and the mother of four school-attending children. Justine sells various products (candies, biscuits, cans of milk, sardines, tomatoes, sugar, pasta, laundry detergents, dish washing detergents, soaps, etc). She buys the products in DANTOKPA, an international marketplace in Benin. Aiming to diversify her business and to bolster her working capital, Justine is seeking a loan from Kiva's partner, Alidé.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy candies, biscuits, cans of milk, sardines, tomatoes, sugar, pasta, soaps, etc

loans.name: Yetunde

texts.en: Yetunde T. is 35 years old and married with 2 children. Her eldest child is in primary school while the younger child is a baby. She sells groundnut oil at retail to her customers. She is requesting the loan amount of 50,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more groundnut oil to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groundnut oil to sell

loans.name: Rey De Reyes 2 Group

texts.es: Las socias del banco comunal "Rey D. Reyes 2",  presentan  como nexo consanguíneo a la Sra. Maria Teresa y la Sra. Ana Gabriela son madre e hija. Las socias D. este banco tienen diferentes actividades algunas venden comida por las noches y son promotoras D. cosméticos, otros como la señora María se dedican a la confección D. prendas D. vestir, también algunas venden plantas y todo lo referente jardinería. Como en todo rubro comercial siempre existe la competencia D. la oferta y la demanda. Este crédito esta destinado para la variación D. productos y para invertir en lo que se refiere a cada uno D. sus rubros. Efectivamente las socias comentan que trabajan con  créditos D. otras instituciones financieras. Lo que respecta a la Fundación se encuentran en su 1er ciclo.
texts.en:
The members of the communal bank "Rey D. Reyes 2" have chosen the mother-daughter team of Mrs. Maria Teresa and Mrs. Ana Gabriela as their representatives. The members each have different activities such as selling food in the evenings, selling cosmetics, sewing clothing (like Maria), as well as gardening-related items such as plants. As in all business there is competition through supply and demand. This loan is targeted to buy varied merchandise and to invest in each of the businesses. The members commented they have worked with loans from other financial institutions. This is their first loan with the Fundación Agrocapital.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment in operations and merchandise

loans.name: Carolina Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline G. is 41 years old and lives with her common-law husband, Cristhian, and their one daughter.  The family lives in Cusco, Peru, where they have several businesses. Cristhian owns an auto lubricants store, while Jacqueline has a number of different businesses of her own: she sells furniture, offers interior decorating services, and also runs a spa. She has had the furniture and interior decorating businesses for about three years  (it will be three years on April 17th). She also recently opened a spa, where she offers a variety of beauty services. When she first opened the spa, she dedicated most of her time to administering it, but she quickly found that the furniture business suffered as a consequence. Today, she splits her time between the businesses: she spends about 60% of her time on interior decorating and furniture sales, and the other 40% to running the spa. She has five employees at the spa and three employees selling furniture, and says that she serves a wide spectrum of the public with each of her businesses. 

Jacqueline is requesting a loan of 2300 soles to buy more furniture. She will buy furniture made from plastic and wood, especially entertainment centers to shelve DVDs, TVs and stereos. Her goal for the future is to see all of her businesses grow.

Jacqueline has pledged to repay this loan in full and on time.

loans.use: To buy furniture

loans.name: Aurelia De

texts.es: La familia de Aurora está compuesta por cuatro personas, sus tres hijitos menores de edad y ella, toda la familia vive en casa que es propia. Aurora se dedica al comercio de frutas en su propio puesto que se encuentra ubicado en el mercado central de la localidad en la que vive. El nivel de competencia en este rubro es de término medio ya que hay otras personas que también se dedican al comercio de frutas. El crédito fue destinado para la ampliación de su vivienda con lo cual tendrá mayor espacio para que sus hijitos puedan dormir mejor. Respecto a su historial crediticio tuvo deudas anteriormente pero las mismas fueron canceladas puntualmente.
texts.en:
Aurora's family is made up of four members: her three young children and herself, and the whole family lives in their home owned by them. Aurora works selling fruit from her own stand, which is located in the central market in her neighborhood. The level of competition is about average since there are other fruit sellers in the market. The loan was targeted to expand her home to create space for her children to sleep better at night. Her credit history is such her past debts were all paid timely.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand the house

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Mme Akossiwa A. est née le 26/11/1964 à Tsévié. Elle est mariée et est mère de cinq (05) enfants. Avec le peu de moyens financiers dont elle dispose et avec l’assistance de son mari, elle a pu ouvrir une boutique où elle vend les produits de première nécessité. Ses débuts n’ont pas été du tout facile, mais grâce à son dynamisme et son courage exemplaire, elle arrive à s’en sortir et à participer de plus en plus aux charges du ménage. Afin de pérenniser son activité, elle sollicite un crédit pour ouvrir une seconde boutique des produits de première nécessité dans un autre quartier de la ville où les besoins se font sentir. Elle pourra ainsi contribuer pleinement au développement de sa famille et assister financièrement les cinq (05) enfants de ses frères et sœurs qui vivent dans une pauvreté extrême.
texts.en:
Akossiwa A. was born on 26/11/1964 in Tsévié. She is married with five children. With her few financial resources and the help of her husband, she has managed to open a store selling essential goods. She did not have an easy start by any means, but thanks to her dynamism and exemplary courage, she has managed to pull through and pay progressively more towards household expenses. In order to keep her business going, she is looking to obtain a loan to open a second store in another part of town where there is clear demand for essential goods. It will allow her to contribute fully towards her family's development and provide financial support for her siblings' five children, who are living in extreme poverty.

Translated from French by Eleanor Stilgoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of essential goods

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence A. O. is 50 years old and married with 3 children. She sells drinks and cooking utensils like plates, cooking pots, etc. She is requesting the loan amount of 50,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more drinks and cooking utensils to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and cooking utensils to sell

loans.name: Ayinde

texts.en: Ayinde H. is 32 years old and married with one child. He is a fashion designer. He is requesting the loan amount of 40,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more tailoring materials. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es: La familia de Rosmery está compuesta por tres integrantes, ella su esposo y su pequeño niño de 1 año de edad. La familia vive en una casa prestada de sus padres. Rosmery trabaja  como operaria  en una empresa de limpieza, por las noches y los fines de semana vende dulces, el esposo también ayuda en la economía de la casa ya que trabaja en pil y en sus horas libres trabaja en el transporte de pasajeros en la zona con su moto taxi. La competencia en sus actividades es media. El crédito fue destinado para la compra de un frezzer el cual será para poder almacenar y congelar sus víveres. Su historial  crediticio en sus anteriores operaciones fue excelente.
texts.en:
There are three members in Rosmery's family: herself, her husband, and their 1-year-old son. They live in a house lent to them by their parents. Rosemery works nights as an operator in a cleaning business and sells sweets on the weekends. Her husband also supports the household by working at the dairy company, and in his free time transports passengers around their neighborhood in his moto-taxi. The competition is average. This loan was targeted to buy a freezer in order to freeze and store food supplies. Her previous credit history is excellent.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a freezer

loans.name: Véronique

texts.fr:
A. Véronique est née vers 1974. Véronique est mariée à AYIDOTE Augustin et est mère de trois (3) enfants tous scolarisés. Véronique vend de produits cosmétiques et des colliers. Véronique achète ses articles à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin; plus précisément au marché international du Bénin. Véronique a pour projet de développer son activité afin de mieux répondre à la demande de ses clients. C'est pourquoi Véronique sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
A. Véronique was born around 1974. She is married to AYIDOTE Augustin and is the mother of three children, all in school. She sells cosmetics and necklaces. The merchandise is purchased in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, at the international marketplace of Benin to be exact. Véronique’s plan is to develop her business in order to respond better to the demands of her customers. This is why she’s requesting a loan from Alidé.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program for micro-loan recipients.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and necklaces

loans.name: Mama

texts.fr: Agée d’environ vingt sept (27) ans, Mme Mama L. est née à Agoè dans la Préfecture du Golfe où elle pratique le commerce des poissons frits dans l’huile (Canami). C’est une recette qui entre dans l’alimentation de tous les jours et qui peut accompagner facilement n’importe quel plat (konŋ, ablo, colico, riz, pâte, foufou, couscous, petit pois, haricot…). La qualité de son produit et la régularité de son service lui ont value une grande renommée. Compte tenu de sa popularité et la demande souvent assez élevée, certaines bonnes femmes font des commandes trois jours et des fois une semaine d’avance pour être sûre d’être servies au moment opportun car c’est un aliment également utilisé lors des cérémonies de libération des apprentis, des funérailles, des naissances, des réceptions, des mariages, des fêtes de famille et autres. Le financement qu’elle sollicite présentement pourra lui servir à moderniser ce secteur d’activité par l’achat d’un grand four moderne, à s’approvisionner régulièrement en gros en poissons et huile, en sel et charbon de bois et se procurer un conservateur de poissons frits digne de ce nom. Elle pourra ainsi veiller à l’épanouissement de son unique (01) enfant pour le moment et assister son jeune mari toujours sans emploi stable.
texts.en:
Ms. Mama L. is about 27 years old and was born in Agoè, in Golfe prefecture, where she does commerce in fish fried in oil (Canami). This is a recipe for every-day food, which can easily accompany absolutely any dish (kom, ablo, colico, rice, corn mash, foufou, couscous, peas, beans, ...). Her quality of product and regularity of service have won her great fame. Given her popularity and the often high demand, some women put in special orders three days in advance, and sometimes a week in advance, to be sure of timely service. This is because it’s food that is served equally for graduation ceremonies of apprentices, funerals, births, receptions, marriages, family celebrations, and more.

The financing she’s presently requesting will allow her to modernize this business sector through the purchase of a large modern oven. It will also allow her to get bulk supplies of fish and oil on a regular basis, and salt and charcoal, too, as well as to have a worthy and proper way to keep fried fish. She will thus be able to watch over the ultimate development of her only child for the moment and to help her young husband, who is still without stable employment.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell fried fish

loans.name: Christabela N.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 48-year-old Christabela M. from Kyela. She is married with 4 children between the ages of 14 and 23. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting 2 dependent orphans. 

Christabela has been running a business purchasing and selling crops since 2007. She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 6 days per week. Christabela currently earns about US $90 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $ 400 in order to purchase more crops in bulk for her business. Christabela thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy crops in bulk for resale

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr: Née en 1985 à Adétikopé, banlieue de Lomé dans la Préfecture du Golfe, Mme Ama G. est une jeune femme mariée avec un (01) enfant à charge. Ses études scolaires étant écourtées dûes aux manques de moyens financiers, elle entreprit très tôt l’apprentissage de la coiffure et tresse. Actuellement, elle a terminé sa formation et veut s’installer dans son propre compte, mais n’a pas les ressources. Néanmoins, avec son esprit d’initiative, elle réussit à faire pour le moment la tresse dans un carrefour au bord de la route afin de trouver un revenu substantiel pour s’installer convenablement et ouvrir son atelier. En ces périodes de fêtes de Pâques, où les demandes en tresses des femmes et des filles sont très élevées, elle sollicite un financement pour s’approvisionner en mèches et "chouchouvi". Ses clientes pourraient acheter directement les mèches chez elle pour les tresses. Ainsi, elle pourra faire des bénéfices sur la vente des mèches en plus de sa main d’œuvre. Ceci lui permettra de se tailler une place au soleil et de rivaliser d’ardeur avec ses camarades qui ont pu poursuivre leurs études.
texts.en:
Born in 1985 in Adétikopé, a suburb of Lomé in Golfe prefecture, Ms. Ama G. is a young married woman with a child to support. Since her schooling was cut short due to a lack of financial means, she soon undertook an apprenticeship in hairdressing and braiding. Currently, she is finished with her training and wants to get situated and on her own but doesn’t have the resources. Nevertheless, with her initiative, she is for the moment successful in doing braids at a crossroads location in order to find substantial revenues for getting situated properly and to open her own workshop. During the Easter season, when the demand for braids from women and girls is very high, she’s requesting financing for supplies of hair extensions and chouchouvi. Her customers would be able to buy hair extensions directly from her for braiding. Thus, she will be able to make a profit from selling hair extensions, in addition to her handiwork. This will enable her to carve out a place for herself under the sun and to rival her friends, who have been able to pursue their schooling.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Hairdressing and braiding hair

loans.name: Kadiatou

texts.fr:
Madame Kadiatou S. est mariée et a une coépouse, mère de 3 enfants (1garçon et 2 filles) elle est née le 20 Novembre 1965 à Bougouni une  préfecture de la 3eme région administrative du Mali.  Elle vit dans la maison de leur mari avec son coépouse et leurs enfants à Kadiolo quartier Noumousso.
Elle fait le commerce de pagnes wax,de  tissus et de tasses depuis 3ans et possède un atelier de couture où elle coud et vend des habits et fait également des prestations de couture. Elle se fait aider par un tailleur qu’elle paye en fin du mois. Kadiatou  enseigne aussi à l’école primaire de Kadiolo ( Noumousso) . Elle mène ses différentes activités en harmonie. 
Elle est à son premier prêt  avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso pour pouvoir satisfaire le besoin de ses clients. 
Elle compte acheter avec son prêt 10 complets de tissus homme, 1pièce de  bazin, 2 pièces de pagnes wax et autres articles. Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako(capitale du Mali) et au Burkina faso. Elle vend au comptant ou à crédit (sur commande et en détail) à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 80.000 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour augmenter le fonds de commerce et l’autre partie fera l’objet d’épargne car elle  aimera construire une maison à usage d’habitation à Sikasso ville.
texts.en:
Mrs. S. Kadiatou is married and the mother of three children, one boy and two girls. She was born on November 20, 1965 in Bougouni, a prefecture in the third administrative region of Mali. She lives in her husband's house, together with his co-spouse and their children, in the Noumousso neighborhood in Kadiolo. She sells wax pagnes (colorful African cloth), fabrics, and bazins (highly prized cloth). For three years, she's been owning a sewing workshop where she sews and sells clothing. She also offers sewing services. She's getting help from a tailor, who she pays at the end of the month. Kadiatou is also a teacher at Kadiolo's elementary school. She manages to do all these activities harmoniously.

She's seeking her first loan from Kiva's partner, the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso, in order to meet customer demand. She intends to use it to buy 10 full sets of men's fabric, 1 piece of bazin, 2 pieces of wax pagnes, and other items. She gets her supplies in Bamako, the capital of Mali, and in Burkina Faso. She sells for cash or on credit (retail and on order) to a clientele comprising both women and men. She foresees turning a monthly profit of XOF 80'000 (ca US$ 165), to be used in part to bolster her working capital. The other part will be put aside, because she would like to build a home to live in the city of Sikasso.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabrics, pagnes and bazin (African cloth), and other items

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es: La señora Alba Luz tiene 42 años de edad, casada y con dos hijos de 8 y 16 años de edad, su esposo es maestro de obra, reside en el barrio La Fuente del pali 1 c al sur. Ella es docente de primaria, y sus planes es poder estar en mejores condiciones para ofrecer a su familia. Este es su segundo ciclo en Afodenic del cual se ha beneficiado para hacer las mejoras a su casa. Con esta solicitud va a comprar materiales de construcción para hacer mejoras a su cuarto y comprar madera para el piso, da las gracias a la institución por el apoyo bienestar que ha sido para su familia. Sus mejores deseos es poder ayudar a sus hijos que sean hombres profesionales.
texts.en:
Mrs. Alba Luz is a 42-year-old married mother of two sons, aged 8 and 16 years old. Her husband is a master carpenter, and they live in the La Fuente neighborhood. She teaches at the elementary school and her plans are to improve her family's living conditions. This is her second loan with Afodenic having previously used a loan to make improvements on her house. With this loan she will buy construction materials to make improvements to her room and wood for the flooring. She is grateful to the institution for its support of her family's improved living conditions. Her ultimate dream is to help her sons to grow up to become men with careers.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to complete home improvements

loans.name: Jemilat

texts.en: Jemilat A. is 36 years old and married with 3 children. She sells bags of cement for building houses. She is requesting the loan amount of 50,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more bags of cement to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of cement to sell

loans.name: Abosede

texts.en: Abosede F. is 43 years old and married with 4 children. She sells planks for roofing and making furniture. She is requesting the loan amount of 50,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more planks to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more planks to sell

loans.name: Anne Marie

texts.fr:
G. Anne Marie est née vers les années 1974. Anne Marie est mariée à GOUDEGNON Pierre et mère de trois enfants dont deux scolarisés. Anne Marie est installée à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du BENIN, où elle exerce son activité. Anne Marie vend des bidons d’huile et des condiments pour faire la sauce. 
Anne Marie veut renforcer son fonds de roulement pour mieux faire fasse à la demande de sa clientèle; c'est pourquoi elle sollicite un prêt à ALIDé.      

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
G. Anne Marie was born around 1974. She is married to GOUDEGNON Pierre and is the mother of three children, two of whom are in school. Anne Marie is established in Cotonou, the economic capital of BENIN, where she works selling drums of oil and condiments for making sauces. She wants to boost her working capital to cope with the demands of her customers better. This is why she’s requesting a loan from Alidé.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program for micro-loan recipients.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy drums of oil and condiments for making sauces

loans.name: Lemou

texts.fr:
Madame  Lemou T. est mariée, mère de 5 enfants (2garçons et 3filles). Elle est née vers 1964 à Bamako (capitale du Mali).  Elle vit dans la maison de son mari avec leurs enfants à Kadiolo quartier Noumousso.
Elle fait le commerce  de boubous bazin teintés, de pagnes bazin teintés et  de l’encens il ya plus de 17ans ans. Expérimentée en raison des années d’activités, elle le fait avec beaucoup de réussite.
Elle est à son sixième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Les prêts passés  se sont  bien dénoués.
Elle compte acheter avec son prêt 4 pièces de bazins blancs de motifs différents, de la graine de gueni, du magnon et d’autres ingrédients. Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et à Sikasso. Elle vend au comptant ou à crédit (sur commande et en détail) à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elle envisage  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25.000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour augmenter le fonds de commerce et l’autre partie pour aider  son mari à subvenir aux dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lemou T. is married and the mother of 5 children (2 boys and 3 girls). She was born circa 1964 in Bamako, the capital of Mali. She lives in her husband's house with their children, in the Noumousso neighborhood in Kadiolo. For more than 17 years, she's been selling boubous made out of dyed bazin (highly prized cloth), pagnes (colorful African cloth), and incense. Very experienced thanks to her many years in this business, she runs it with much success. She's seeking her sixth loan from Kiva's partner, the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso. Past loans ended without problems.

She intends to use this loan to buy 4 pieces of white bazin with different patterns, and ingredients to make incense: gueni seeds (frankincense), magnon (a plant), ... She gets her supplies in Bamako and in Sikasso. She sells for cash or on credit (retail and on order) to a clientele comprising both women and men. She foresees turning an average monthly profit of XOF 25'000 (ca US$ 50), to be used in part to bolster her working capital. The other part will help her husband provide for the day-to-day family expenses.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bazin (highly prized cloth) and ingredients to make incense

loans.name: Seydou

texts.fr:
Mr Seydou B. est marié à deux femmes, père de 2 enfants (1garçon et 1fille). Il est né vers 1972 à Tousseguela une des communes de la préfecture de Kolondièba, 3eme région administrative du Mali.  Il vit avec ses épouses et leurs enfants à Kadiolo quartier Noumousso.
Il est commerçant  depuis 4 ans et vend essentiellement des céréales et quelques fois de petits articles. Expérimenté en raison des années d’activité, il le fait avec beaucoup de réussite.
Il est à sa deuxième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Le premier prêt  a été bien remboursé. 
Il compte acheter avec son prêt ,   500 kg de maïs, 500 kg de sorgho et d’autres  articles. Il s’approvisionne dans les villages avoisinants  Kadiolo. Il vend au comptant, à crédit, en gros et en détail à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. Souvent il vend ses céréales sur commande.
Il envisage  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40.000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour augmenter le fonds de commerce et l’autre partie sera mise en épargne car il  prétend construire une maison à usage d’habitation à Sikasso ville.
texts.en:
Mr. Seydou B. is married to two women, and the father of two children (one boy and one girl). He was born circa 1972 in Tousseguela, one of the towns in the Kolondièba prefecture, third administrative region of Mali. He lives with his spouses and their children in Kadiolo, a neighborhood in Sikasso. He's been a merchant for 4 years, and mostly sells cereals and, occasionally, small items. Experienced thanks to his years in this business, he runs it with much success. He's seeking his second loan from Kiva's partner, the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso. The first loan was repaid without problems.

With this loan, he intends to buy 500 kg of corn, 500 kg or sorghum, and other items. He gets his supplies in the villages surrounding Kadiola, and sells for cash and on credit, both retail and wholesale, to a clientele comprising women and men. Often, he sells cereals on order. He expects to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 40'000 (ca US$ 80), to be used in part to bolster his working capital. The other part will be put aside, because he wants to build a home to live in Sikasso city.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 500 kg of corn, 500 kg or sorghum, and other items

loans.name: Enesi D.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 33-year-old Enesi M. from Kyela. She is married with four children between the ages of 4 and 15. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependents because they are orphans.

Enesi has been running a red palm oil business since 2005. Her business is to purchase red palm seed, extract them the oil, and sell it to those who using it for cooking and for making soap. She works at the business for 5-8 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by her husband. Enesi currently earns about US $200 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of US $400 in order to purchase more red palm seeds in bulk for oil processing. In the future, she plans to open a new location. Enesi thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase red palm seeds in bulk for oil extraction

loans.name: Mariame

texts.fr:
Madame  Mariame K. est une veuve qui est  mère de 8 enfants. Elle est née le 18 Avril 1957 à Bamako (capitale du Mali). Elle  vit dans la maison de son défunt mari avec ses  enfants à Loulouni ville (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Matrone de son état au Centre de Santé Communautaire de Loulouni, elle mène conjointement à cette activité le commerce de bois de chauffe depuis plusieurs années. Expérimentée et très sollicitée, elle s’est procurée d’un âne et d’une charrette. Elle utilise les services d’un charretier pour assurer le transport et la livraison du bois de chauffe à ses clients. 
Elle est à son onzième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
Elle compte acheter avec son prêt, 5 chargements de charrette en bois de chauffe par semaine. Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages avoisinants  Loulouni. Elle vend au comptant ou à crédit, en gros, et en détail à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes; et plus souvent sur commande.
Il envisage  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 60.000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour augmenter le fonds de commerce et l’autre partie sera mise en épargne car elle  souhaite construire une maison à usage d’habitation dans la ville de Sikasso.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mariame K. is a widow and mother of 8 children. She was born, April 18,1957, in Bamako, the Capital of Mail. She lives in the house of her deceased husband, with her children in Louliouni City (the third administrative region in the Republic of Mali). She maintains her own business at the Community Health Center in Loulouni, where she has managed her firewood business for several years. Inovative and outgoing, she would like to procure a donkey and a wagon. The donkey and wagon would help transport and deliver firewood to her clients. She has made eleven loans with the Soro Jiriwaso microfinance company. These loans have been duly repaid. With this new loan she expects to be able to purchase 5 wagon loads of firewood each week. She buys her supplies from the various villages near the city of Loulouni. She sells her firewood for cash or credit, in wholesale or in retail and often on order, to a clientele made up of both men and women. She expects to earn a monthly income of 60,000 Francs CFA. A part of the loan would be used for business capital and another part would be saved, as she hopes to build a house to live in the City of Sikasso.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies of firewood for resale.

loans.name: Ana Lucia

texts.es: Doña Ana Lucia tiene 43 años de edad, reside en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama 14 de Febrero de la Terminal de buses 1 c al sur. Tiene tres hijos de 2,8 y 16 años de edad, su esposo  trabaja de docente da  alumnos de primaria y secundaria. El negocio de la señora Ana Lucia es la venta de ropa que ella misma elabora con su fina costura que hace desde hace cinco años, el cual inicio con dinero propio y ayuda de su esposo el cual siempre la apoyado para que ella salga adelante con sus proyecciones ya que tiene que cubrir las necesidades de su familia. Con este crédito va hacer mejoras a su casa como: reparar el techo de su casa que esta en mal estado y hacer divisiones de cuarto para estar cómodos con su familia. Sus planes es poder seguir apoyando  a sus hijos con los estudios.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ana Lucia is 43 years old and lives in the "14 de Febrero" neighborhood in the capital city of Managua. She has three sons aged 2, 8, and 16 years old. Her husband is a teacher for elementary and middle school students. Mrs. Lucia's business is selling clothes, which she herself has sewn for the past five years. She began the business with her own money and with help from her husband who has always provided moral support for her to succeed in her projects and help augment the household income. With this loan she will make the following home improvements: repair the roof of the house, which is in poor condition, and create separate rooms to make the family living conditions more comfortable. Her plans are to provide support for her sons to continue with their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to repair the roof of the house and create separate rooms.

loans.name: Enjo M.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 26-year-old Enjo K. from Kyela. She is married with 2 children between the ages of 7 and 8.  Enjo has been running a cosmetics business since 2003. Her business is purchasing and selling cosmetics. She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 7 days per week. Enjo currently earns about US $80 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of US $550 in order to purchase cosmetics in bulk. In the future, she plans to open another business. Enjo thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics in bulk for resale.

loans.name: Devila

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 24-year-old Devila D. from Mwanza, married with two children aged 4 and 7.   Additionally, she is responsible for supporting one dependent who is an orphan. Devila has been running a tailoring business since 2007, currently earning about $175 each month, working for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week.  She is requesting a loan of $400 in order to purchase bed sheets to sell, and in the future plans to open another business. Devilla thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase bed sheets to sell.

loans.name: Olubisi
