texts.en: Olubisi O. is 40 years old and married with 3 children. She produces and sells orange drinks. The demand for her orange drinks is high and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She is requesting the loan amount of 60,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase one deep freezer. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase one deep freezer

loans.name: Dupe

texts.en: Dupe A. is 55 years old and married with four children. She sells groundnut oil to her customers and is requesting a loan amount of N60,000 to purchase more groundnut oil to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groundnut oil  to sell.

loans.name: Benadetha

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 33-year-old Benadetha M. from Mwanza. Benadetha has been running a tailoring business since 2007. Her business is to make and sell clothes. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week. Benadetha currently earns about US $240 from her business. She is requesting a loan of US $400 in order to buy a sewing machine, vitenge (African traditional clothes) and thread. In the future, she plans to open another business. Benadetha thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine, vitenge (African traditional clothes) and thread

loans.name: Esili M.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 40 years old Esili M. from Kyela, married with five children between the ages of 12 and 25. Esili has been running a rice business since 2004. Working at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 6 days per week, she currently earns about $100 a month and is now requesting a loan of $375 in order to purchase rice in bulk. In the future, she plans to increase the variety of crops she sells. Esili thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase rice in bulk.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkadi est composé  de six femmes mariées. Elles vivent majoritairement  dans des familles monogamiques et  sont âgées en moyenne de 36 ans avec  4 enfants, vivant toutes dans le quartier Bamanankin du village de Togo (4ème région administrative du Mali).
 Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de mariage et de voisinage. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin de sa clientèle, le groupe a décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit  de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son  septième prêt solidaire, après avoir correctement remboursé les six premiers.
Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt  pour acheter : 2 tonnes de graines de néré au grand marché de Ségou. Ces graines sont transformées en sounbala condiment très prisé et utilisé dans les sauces africaines. Les graines  de néré (obtenues à partir d’un grand arbre fruitier, protégé par la loi forestière du Mali) qui sont décortiquées, lavées et longuement cuites, sont ensuite pilées, lavées plusieurs fois  pour  être débarrassées de leurs épluches  et de tout corps étranger; cuites de nouveau et fermées hermétiquement dans un vase sans rouille pendant deux jours  puis  broyées, mises en boules, passées à la vapeur et séchées. Le sounbala ainsi fait est prêt pour la consommation. Elles vendent au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle majoritairement composée de femmes, à domicile, en ambulant au village et au grand marché de la ville de Ségou au bord du fleuve Niger à côté des vendeuses de calebasses. 
Elles espèrent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 17.000FCFA  qui sera utilisé pour  le remboursement du prêt et la prise en charge de certaines dépenses familiales (savon, pétrole et habillements).
Elles ont pour ambitions  la construction d’une maison en tôle à usage  d’habitation.
texts.en:
This Benkadi group is composed of six married women. They live for the most part in monogamous families and have an average age of 36 with 4 children. All live in the Bamanankin district of the village of Togo (fourth administrative region of Mali). They know each other because of ties of marriage and neighborhood. With the intention of satisfying the needs of their clientele, the group decided to join the credit program of Soro Yiriwaso with whom they are on their seventh solidarity loan, after having correctly reimbursed the first six. They intend to use this loan to buy 2 tons of néré seeds in the big open-air market of Ségou. These seeds are transformed into "sounbala", a condiment much esteemed and used in African sauces. The néré seeds (obtained from a tall fruit tree which is protected by the laws of the forest in Mali) are hulled, washed and cooked for a long time, then pounded and washed several times to get rid of their peels and any foreign matter. Then they are cooked again and hermetically sealed in a rust-free container for two days, then stirred, shaped into balls, steamed and dried. The resulting sounbala is ready for consumption. They sell for cash and credit to a clientele composed mainly of women, out of their homes, walking around the village, and in the big open-air market of the town of Ségou, and on the banks of the Niger River beside the women who sell gourds. They hope to make a monthly average profit of 17,000 F CFA which will be used to reimburse the loan and cover certain family expenses (soap, gasoline, and clothing). Their ambition is to be able to build a house made of corrugated iron to live in.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing néré seeds

loans.name: Penina

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 44-year-old Penina M. from Mwanza. She is married with four children between the ages of 10 and 17. Penina has been running a shop since 2000. Her business is to sell rice, cooking oil and wheat flour. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week. Penina currently earns about US $100 from her business. She is requesting a loan of US $400 in order to purchase beans, wheat flour and cooking oil for resale. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Penina thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase beans, wheat flour, and cooking oil for resale

loans.name: Arlen Patricia

texts.es: La Joven Arlen tiene 28 años de edad, reside en el barrio Isaías Gomez, con un hijo de dos años, su esposo trabaja como albañil, y su negocio es la venta de cosméticos y perfúmenes, sus venta la inicio debido a la necesidad de apoyar a su esposo ya que todo esta caro y hay que trabajar para cubrir las necesidades, lleva dos años de vender con la productos de Avon donde se afilio. Con este crédito quiere comprar mercadería variada para ofertar a sus clientes y poder tener mejores ingresos. Ya que sus planes  es poder comprar un terreno y hacer su casa propia ya que en este momento viven donde su mama.
texts.en:
Arlen is 28 years old and lives in the Isaías Gomez area with her 2-year old son. Her husband is a builder and she sells cosmetics and fragrances. She began selling out of the need to support her husband as everything is expensive and both must work to cover their basic needs. She is affiliated with Avon and has been selling their products for two years now. She intends to use this loan to buy a variety of merchandise to offer her customers and generate more income as a result. Her future plans involve buying a piece of land on which to build her own house, as they currently live with her mother.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Stilgoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetics and fragrances

loans.name: Esta S.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings) from Tanzania! This is 48-years-old Esta K. from Mbeya. She is a widow with five children between the ages of 24 and 30. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting one dependant who is an orphan.

Esta has been running a crops business since 1986. This client’s business is purchasing crops from the villages and selling them in town. She works at this business 11 hours a day, 6 days a week. Esta currently earns about 150 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $450 US in order to purchase stock crops in bulk for her business. In the future, she plans to increase the variety of crops in her business.

Esta thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania through microleasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase stock crops in bulk for her business

loans.name: Avenir Plus Group

texts.fr: Marie-Angel B. est entrée dans le monde de petites affaires depuis 1995 après le décès de son mari. La vente des chikwangues qu’elle fabrique à base de la farine de manioc (Kind of homemade manioc flour bread), constitue l’activité principale de son affaire. Elle vend aussi des poissons salés et fumés. C’est avec la fabrication et la vente des chikwangues que Marie a commencé son commerce. Après un dur travail et une bonne gestion, son affaire a prospéré. Avec des bénéfices et expérience accumulés aux cours des années, elle est parvenue à la diversifier en y ajoutant des poissons salés et fumés. Suite à la demande croissante de ses clients et dans le souci d’accroitre le bénéfice de son affaire afin de subvenir aux besoins de son ménage, Marie a décidé en août 2008, d’intégrer un des groupes de l’IMF Hope RDC dénommée «  Avenir Plus ». Elle a acheté avec le crédit reçu au mois d’avril en courant 1 sac de manioc et quelques paniers des poissons salés et fumés dans le but de renforcer son capital. Actuellement, Marie totalise un capital propre de $120. Son affaire génère $30 par semaine. Son ambition est d’ouvrir une maison de vivres frais qui se vendent mieux dans son quartier périphérique qui se situe au nord de Kinshasa. Marie a 57 ans. Elle a  deux enfants dont l’âge varie de 30 à 33 ans. Celle de 30 ans vit avec elle.
texts.en:
Marie-Angel B. entered the world of small business in 1995 after her husband died. Selling chikwangues (a kind of homemade bread), which she makes from cassava flour, constitutes the main work of her business. She also sells salted and smoked fish. By making and selling chikwangues, she began her business. After hard work and good managing, her business has prospered. With the profits and the accumulated experience over the years, she managed to diversify her commerce by including salted and smoked fish. Following the growing demand of her customers and wanting to grow her profits, so as to provide for her household, she decided in 2008 to join a group of the micro-finance institution HOPE RDC named “Avenir Plus”. This April, she used the loan she received to buy a sack of cassava and a few baskets of salted and smoked fish with the goal of boosting her capital. Right now, her working capital amount to $120. Her business generates $30 a week. Her ambition is to open a house of fresh staple foods, which sell better in her outlying district located in northern Kinshasa. Marie is 57 years old and has two children, ages 30 and 33. The one who is 30 lives with her.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 1 sack of cassava and baskets of fish

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Justine

texts.fr:
A. Justine est née vers 1970. Justine est mariée mais elle n'a pas encore d'enfant. Justine réside au quartier AKPAKPA dans la ville de Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin; où elle exerce son activité de vente de maïs. Justine s’approvisionne en maïs à l’intérieur du pays dans les marchés locaux du Bénin. Justine a besoin de plus de moyens financiers qu'elle n'en a aujourd'hui pour faire fasse à la demande de ses clients. C'est pourquoi Justine demande de crédit à ALIDé. 


 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
Justine A. was born around 1970 and is married, as yet without children. She lives in the Akpakpa area of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, where she makes a living selling corn. She gets her corn supplies at local markets in Benin. Justine needs greater financial resources than she currently has in order to meet customer demand, which is why she is requesting this loan from ALIDé. ALIDé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Fon, a regional language in Benin. Benin is a small West African country next to Nigeria with a per capita GDP of $1,500.

Translated from French by Eleanor Stilgoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of corn sacks

loans.name: Jeniffer

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 26-year-old Jeniffer N. from Mwanza. She is married with two children, 1 and 8 years old. Jeniffer has been running a clothes business since 2008, selling used clothes. Second-hand clothes journey across the oceans from America and Europe, and are then washed, ironed and sold in bulk by wholesalers in Tanzania to retailers who then re-wash and re-iron them for sale on the streets and in the surrounding towns and villages. These clothes are becoming increasingly popular, especially amongst the younger generation, because of their low cost, and the general appeal of anything modern.

Jeniffer works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by one employee. Jeniffer currently earns about 200 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400 USD in order to purchase more used clothes and re-sell them to her customers. In the future, she plans to open another business. Jeniffer thanks you for your support! SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothes and re-sell them to her customers

loans.name: Marcio Enrique

texts.es:
En el municipio El Sauce, el señor Marcio M. se dedica con mucho entusiasmo a su actividad de ganadería el cual atiende con mucho esfuerzo para llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación y así beneficiar a su humilde familia.

Es de importancia destacar que el señor Marcio con mucha dedicación ha logrado salir adelante en la crianza de ganado y es por esto que hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra del ganado y así proceder a su crianza y comercialización en su municipio.
texts.en:
In the municipality of El Sauce, Marcio M. works with great enthusiasm and effort raising cattle to bring in income for his family, who live very humbly. It is worth pointing out that Marcio has, with a great deal of devotion and hard work, managed to succeed in the business of cattle raising, for which reason he is now seeking a loan from Ceprodel to buy more cattle to raise and sell in his municipality.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Stilgoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Folawiyo

texts.en: Folawiyo A. is 52 years old and married with 4 children. She sells sarongs. She has been in this business for a long time. She is requesting the loan amount of N 60,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Teodora Melida

texts.es:
En el municipio de El Sauce la señora Teodora R. se ha destacado en la actividad de agricultura con el propósito de llevar a cabo el mejoramiento en las condiciones de su habitación. Para mejorar la situación de su hogar ella ha adquirido un panel solar debido a que en la localidad donde ella vive no se tiene energía eléctrica y por medio de este panel solar ella logra alumbrarse por las noches y también permite realizar algunos quehaceres del hogar que requieren de energía eléctrica como lo es el planchar.

La razón por la que ha acudido a Ceprodel es para solicitar un crédito para el pago del panel solar y de esta manera aprovechar este recurso que le benéficia a diario en su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
Mrs. Teodora R. has excelled in agriculture in the municipality of El Sauce. Her goal is to make improvements to her room. To improve her home she has acquired a solar panel. There is no electricity in the area where she lives. By using this panel, she will be able to have light in the evenings. She will also be able to do household chores, like ironing, that require electricity. She has come to Ceprodel to ask for a loan to pay for the solar panel. She can then take advantage of this resource that will bring daily benefits to the house where she lives.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for solar panel

loans.name: Ines

texts.es: Doña Inés tiene 46 años de edad, tiene una pulpería que desde hade diesiciete años administra sus ventas la cual inicio con liquidación del trabajo anterior y ayuda de su esposo, reside en el barrio Villa Venezuela con tres hijos de 9, 20 y 25 años de edad, los dos mayores trabajan y el pequeño estudia, esta es su novena solicitud en Afodenic y da las gracias por la oportunidad y los beneficios que ha logrado en su negocio como en sus ventas. Con este crédito va invertir en mercadería variada como granos básicos, productos enlatados, y productos de consumo diario. Lo cual espera elevar las ventas y poder tener mejores ganancias. Sus planes a futuro es poder mantener ahorros para apoyar a a su hijo con los estudios.
texts.en:
Inés, 46, has had a mini market for 17 years. She started the business with liquidation from a previous job. She also had her husband’s help. She lives in the Villa Venezuela with her three children who are 9, 20 and 25. The two older children work, and the youngest goes to school. This is her 9th application with Afodenic. She is thankful for the opportunity and benefits she has achieved (like sales) in her business. With this loan she will buy various merchandise like basic grains, canned goods, and products that are consumed daily. She hopes this will increase her sales and give her better earnings. Her future plan is to be able to have savings to support her son in his studies.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic grains and canned goods

loans.name: Ester B.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings) from Tanzania! This is 48-year-old Ester K. from Mbeya. She is a widow with two children, 26 and 28. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependents because their parents cannot take care of them. Ester has been running a doughnut business since 2000. She prepares doughnuts or sweet round bread and sells them as snacks along the street.

Ester works at the business for 1-4 hours per day, 5 days per week and is assisted by her house girl. Ester currently earns about 30 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 325 USD in order to pay school fees for her children. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Ester thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Fumilola

texts.en: Fumilola O. is 43 years old and married with 2 children. She sells drinks. She has two deep freezers and a fridge that she uses to keep her drinks cool for her customers. She is requesting the loan amount of N 50,000  to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings) from Tanzania! This is Mary N. from Mwanza. She is a 38-year-old married mother of four children between the ages of 3 and 10. Mary has operated a tailoring business since 2006. She works at it for 12 hours a day, 6 days a week and has one employee. Mary currently earns about $200 from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400 in order to purchase a sewing machine for making clothes and bed sheets for her customers. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Mary thanks you for your support! 

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets.  Because of this, they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that is allows clients to use the leased equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine for making clothes and bed sheets to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Mata De Palma En Desarrollo - Group 7

texts.en:
This is the newest group of five to join the Mata de Palma en Desarrollo Bank of Hope in Hato Mayor. They are taking their first loan with Esperanza International, Kiva's partner. In view of the slow movement of the economy in the past few months, many people have decided to become self-employed as an alternative to unemployment. Hato Mayor is one of the provinces with the lowest population in Dominican Republic, and many of its inhabitants are forced to perform their work activities elsewhere, or commute to other provinces to work. This results in an additional burden to their businesses and families, as on many occasions, our clients have to be away from home either for work or to restock their inventory. 

Altagracia S. has been appointed as group representative. She has 4 children; the oldest is 19 and the youngest is 6. Her group mates recognize her as a leader and trust her to do a good job in keeping the group together. Altagracia has set up a clothing sales business, so she will use her loan to buy new clothes to sell. For the present time, she will sell from her own home and visit her acquaintances with her merchandise. She hopes to eventually set up a store where her customers can come to her instead. She also wants to start building a house with her sales profits and be able to help her children acquire a college education. 

Please help us support this group of new micro entrepreneurs through this Kiva loan.
Thank you!

loans.use: To purchase new clothing items to resell.

loans.name: Guillermo Jose

texts.es: El señor Guillermo tiene 67 años de edad, hombre trabajor que desde muy joven comenzó su jornada y ahora esta gozando de los beneficios recibe una pensión mensual que le da el Inss. Reside en barrio Laureles Norte en la ciudad de Managua, su esposa es ama de casa, la cual tiene tres hijos mayores de edad, en Afodenic este es su séptimo ciclo y lo va invertir en comprar repuestos para reparar su microbús el cual hace viaje de acarreo, que la tiene en mal estado, sus planes es poder seguir ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
Guillermo, 67, is a hard working man who started working at a young age. Now he is enjoying the benefits. He receives a monthly pension from Social Security. He lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood in the city of Managua. His wife is a housewife. They have three adult children. This is his seventh loan with Afodenic. He will buy spare parts to repair his minivan, which he uses to transport merchandise. The minivan is in bad shape. His plans are to be able to continue helping his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy spare parts to fix his vehicle to be able to keep working

loans.name: Kagoli

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings) from Tanzania! This is Kagoli H. from Mwanza. She is a 33-year-old married mother of four children between the ages of 5 and 17. Kagoli has run a tailoring business since 2005. She makes clothes and sells them to her customers. She does this for 12 hours a day, 6 days a week and has one assistant. Kagoli currently earns about $150 from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400 in order to buy a sewing machine to make vitenge (traditional African clothes). In the future, she plans to open another business. Kagoli thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets.  Because of this, they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that is allows clients to use the leased equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine to vitenge (traditional African clothes)

loans.name: Fatuma H.

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings) from Tanzania! This is Fatuma S. from Kyela. She is a 35-year-old mother of with 4 children between the ages of 3 and 17. Additionally, she supports one dependant who is an orphan.
 
Fatuma has been purchasing rice wholesale and reselling it retail since 1999.  She works for 9-12 hours a day, 6 days a week. Fatuma currently earns about $120 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $375 in order to purchase rice in bulk for her business. Fatuma thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets.  Because of this, they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that is allows clients to use the leased equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase rice in bulk for her business.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es: Aurora es casada, tiene 34 años de edad y es madre de 6 hijos. Se dedica a la venta de comida por las noches en un lugar que acondiciona fuera de su casa para recibir a sus comensales. Este trabajo lo viene realizando desde hace 3 años, y lo que gusta es preparar bien cada uno de los platos de comida, para que sus clientes se sientan satisfechos por su buena sazón, además que también le agrada conversar con las personas mientras las atiende. Este negocio es muy rentable para Aurora, ya que para ella, cocinar no es complicado y prepara especialidades de rápida cocción y poca inversión, pero muy demandadas, es por ello que para el futuro se proyecta a tener un restaurante. Con MFP ya tiene 5 préstamos, y está contenta de ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos se apoyan y son bien coordinados. Aurora invertirá 1500 soles en la compra de mesas y sillas para su negocio, y con lo restante comprará los ingredientes básicos de sus comidas (carnes, arroz, papas y otros).
texts.en:
Aurora is 32 years old and married with six children. She sells food in the evenings in a spot away from home where she also sets up tables and chairs for her guests to eat. She has been doing this for three years now and likes to take time preparing each dish properly so that her customers can fully enjoy their delicious taste. She also likes to talk to people whilst serving them. This is a highly lucrative business for Aurora since she finds cooking easy and is able to prepare special dishes both quickly and inexpensively, and which prove very popular. It is for this reason that she plans to own a restaurant in the future. She has previously obtained 5 loans from MFP and happily participates in her local communal bank, as everyone is well-coordinated and supportive of each other. Aurora intends to invest 1500 sols in buying tables and chairs for her business and will use the rest to buy basic ingredients (meat, rice, potatoes etc.).

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Stilgoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of furniture and cooking supplies for business purposes

loans.name: Yao

texts.fr: Yao T. est l’un des photographes les plus reconnus de la ville. Il exerce cette activité depuis 5 ans. Agé de 36 ans, il est marié et père d’un petit garçon. Yao souhaite avec ce crédit acheter un nouvel appareil photo, un ordinateur et une imprimante pour faire des traitements
texts.en:
Yao T. is one of the most recognized photographers in town. He has been in this business for five years. He’s 36 years old, married, and the father of a young boy. Yao would like to use this loan to buy a new camera, a computer, and a printer to process this work.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a new camera, computer, and printer

loans.name: Enoc

texts.es:
El señor Enoc H. se dedica a su actividad de ganadería en el municipio de El Sauce donde a diario se esfuerza grandemente para salir adelante ya que requiere de mucho apoyo para continuar llevando el mantenimiento a su casa de habitación.

Hoy en día debido a su gran necesidad en su actividad, ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con un crédito para la reparación de cercos y corral para el ganado y de esta manera proceder con la comercialización de estos animales brindándole mejores condiciones de vida a su familia que tanto depende de él siendo su actividad ganadera el único sustento que posee.
texts.en:
Enoc H. raises cattle for a living in the municipality of El Sauce. He strives very hard to keep going every day as he needs a lot of financial support to maintain his household. As his livelihood depends so greatly on his business, he is now requesting another loan from Ceprodel in order to make improvements to his cattle pens and fences. This will allow him to get on selling his animals and offering his family a better quality of life, as they depend heavily on his cattle raising, being their sole means of support.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Stilgoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cattle pen maintenance

loans.name: Remi

texts.en: Remi D. is 32 years old and married with 2 children. She sells medicines and provisions to her customers. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more medicines to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Bukola

texts.en: Bukola O. is 40 years old and married with 3 children. She sells provisions. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more provisions to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Sara Maria

texts.es: Doña Sara reside en el barrio Laureles Norte en la ciudad de Managua, tiene 52 años de edad, su esposo es contratista, sus hijos son mayores de edad, independientes, la señora Sara trabaja como conserje trabajo cansado pero tiene que salir adelante, ya que su anhelo es poder terminar de hacer las mejoras de su casa, con este crédito va a comprar materiales de construcción para hacer el frente de su casa y poder tener una casa digna. Da las gracias Afodenic por el apoyo que le ha brindado este es su séptimo crédito que ha sido de muchos beneficios para su familia.
texts.en:
Sara is 52 years old and lives in the Laureles Norte area of Managua. Her husband is a contractor and her children are of age and independent. Sara works as a caretaker, a job she finds tiring but must do to keep going, as she is very keen to finish making improvements to her house. She intends to use this loan to buy building materials to make the front of her house look presentable. She is very grateful to Afodenic for the support it has offered previously, which has been of great help to her family. This is her seventh loan.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Stilgoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of building materials to make the front of her house concrete

loans.name: Aydee

texts.es: Aydee tiene 42 años, vive con su pareja, quien es agricultor y con sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 15 años se dedica a atender su bodega donde vende abarrotes y bebidas, y está instalada en su misma casa. Aydee atiende durante todo el día y cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos quienes atienden la tienda cuando ella no se encuentra. Su trabajo le agrada porque sus clientes se convierten en excelentes compañeros de conversación, y muchas veces hace muy buena amistad con ellos. Y lo mejor de todo, es que este negocio no es solo una distracción, sino también una fuente de ingreso muy rentable, porque es la única persona, que por su zona, vende productos de primera necesidad. Para más adelante, Aydee quiere llegar a constituir un minimarket. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y ha notado, desde el inicio, lo importante que es trabajar responsablemente, para el progreso de ella misma y de los demás integrantes de su banco comunal. El dinero que viene solicitando lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes y bebidas (gaseosas, cervezas y jugos).
texts.en:
Aydee is 42 years old and lives with her husband, who is a farmer, and their three children in their own home. For the past fifteen years, she has been dedicated to working in her grocery store, located in her own home, where she sells groceries and beverages. Aydee works all day with the support of her children; they work in the store when she is not around. Her work gives her pleasure because her clients are excellent companions for making conversation, and many times she forms a good friendship with them. And the best thing of all is that this business is not just entertaining but also a very profitable source of income, because she is the only person in her area who sells basic needs products. In the future, Aydee wants to establish a minimarket. This is her first loan with MFP, and she has said, that the important thing is to work responsibly; it is important for her own progress and for the progress of the rest of the members in her community bank. The money that she is requesting will be invested in purchasing groceries and beverages (sodas, beers, and juices).

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase in merchandise

loans.name: Djemanguelen Group

texts.fr:
Le six femmes du groupe Djemanguelen ont en  moyenne de 49 ans,  4 enfants et vivent toutes  dans le quartier Bamanankin du village de Togo (4ème région administrative du Mali) dans des foyers polygames. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de mariage et de voisinage et font la transformation vente des graines de néré en sounbala et la vente du bois de chauffe.  
Après avoir correctement remboursé les six premiers prêts solidaires, ce groupe est à son septième prêt de groupe qui sera utilisé pour acheter, 800 kg de graines de néré. Elles s’approvisionnent  hebdomadairement au grand marché de Ségou, ces graines sont transformées en sounbala qui est un condiment très prisé et utilisé dans les sauces africaines. Le sounbala est obtenu à partir des graines de néré qui sont décortiquées, lavées et longuement cuites, ensuite pilées, lavées plusieurs fois  pour  être débarrassées de leurs épluches et de tout corps étranger ; cuites de nouveau et  fermées hermétiquement dans un vase sans rouille pendant deux jours  puis  broyées, mises en boules, passées à la vapeur et séchées. Le sounbala est ainsi prêt pour la consommation et la vente. Elles vendent au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle majoritairement composée de femmes à domicile, en ambulant au village et au grand marché de Ségou.
Elles envisagent  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 17.000FCFA qu’elles comptent utiliser pour le remboursement du prêt et la participation aux évènements sociaux (mariages, baptêmes et funérailles). 
Elles ont pour ambitions la construction d’une maison en usage  d’habitation dont la toiture est en tôle
texts.en:
The six women of the Djemanguelen group have an average age of 49 with 4 children and live in the Bamanankin district of the village of Togo (fourth administrative region of Mali) in polygamous households. They met each other because of ties of marriage and neighborhood and they transform néré seeds into "sounbala" (a condiment) and sell firewood.

They are on their seventh solidarity loan, after having correctly reimbursed the first six. They intend to use this loan to buy 800 kg of néré seeds. They buy their supplies weekly in the big open-air market of Ségou. These seeds are transformed into "sounbala", a condiment much esteemed and used in African sauces. Sounbala is made out of néré seeds are hulled, washed and cooked for a long time, then pounded and washed several times to get rid of their peels and any foreign matter. Then they are cooked again and hermetically sealed in a rust-free container for two days, then stirred, shaped into balls, steamed and dried. The resulting sounbala is ready for consumption and sale. They sell for cash and credit to a clientele composed mainly of women, out of their homes, walking around the village, and in the big open-air market of the town of Ségou.

They hope to make a monthly average profit of 17,000 F CFA which will be used to reimburse the loan and participate in community events (marriages, baptisms, and funerals). Their ambition is to be able to build a house to live in with a corrugated iron roof.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of néré seeds

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 56 year old Avelina G. from Mwanza. She is married with four children, between the ages of 24 and 34 years old. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting one dependant because her parents do not take care of her. Avelina has been running a poultry or "Kuku" business since 2008. Raising kuku is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially amongst SELFINA clients. Kuku means chickens in Swahili, and raising them for sale is popular for a number of reasons. Firstly, they require little start-up capital. You can start with one or two, and either add to them as you go, or wait for them to multiply naturally! Secondly, they require little space, so sometimes you can just let them run around in your garden or compound. Thirdly, while they are growing they produce eggs, which can either be sold to provide a supplementary source of income, or eaten to provide a supplementary source of protein. Avelina works at the business for 4 hours per day, 7 days per week and currently earns about 120USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400USD in order to purchase chickens and raise them. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Avelina thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase chickens and raise them

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: La señora Maria tiene 43 años de edad, reside en el barrio Laureles Norte en la ciudad de Managua, tiene un hijo que estudia la secundaria, su negocio es la venta de ropa desde hace diez años, la cual inicio con prestamos que Afodenic otorgo para seguir adelante, este es su décimo ciclo y va a invertir en infraestructura en la compra de materiales de construcción para hacer el porche de su casa y poder dar mejores condiciones a su familia. Su meta es poder ampliar el local como su inventario para captar clientes y vender más.
texts.en:
Maria, 43, lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood in the city of Managua. She has a son who is in high school. She has been selling clothes for ten years. She started her business with a loan from Afodenic to help her get ahead. This is her tenth loan cycle, and she will buy construction materials to build a porch on her house and give her family better living conditions. Her goal is to be able to expand her place of business (increase inventory) to gain new customers and sell more.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build a porch

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen tiene 32 años, es madre de 3 hijos en edad escolar y vive junto a su esposo, quien se dedica al transporte de pasajeros. Desde hace 4 años se viene dedicando a la venta de productos helados como; hielo, chupetes, gelatinas, gaseosas, etc. en un ambiente que mandó a construir en su casa. Carmen también recorre las calles de su ciudad vendiendo sus productos, ella se esfuerza en su trabajo por el bienestar de sus hijos, y es lo que la motiva a trabajar cada día. Hasta ahora, esta labor le es rentable porque todos sus productos se venden fácilmente y obtiene ganancias diariamente, por lo que se siente satisfecha. También nos comenta que la mayoría de sus clientes son los niños. Para el futuro, a Carmen le gustaría tener una bodega en su casa para vender sus productos helados y otros comestibles. Con MFP ya tiene 9 préstamos, su banco comunal se llama “Campo Verde” y le gusta trabajar ahí porque sus compañeros de grupo son responsables y puntuales en sus pagos. El dinero que viene solicitando lo invertirá en la compra de una congeladora, esta tiene un costo de 2500 soles, pero ella cubrirá lo que falta con un ahorro de 1000 soles que tiene gracias a su trabajo. Con esta máquina podrá producir más hielos.
texts.en:
Carmen is 32, and she has 3 school age children. She lives with her husband who transports passengers. For 4 years she has been selling chilled products like ice, popsicles, jell-o, soft drinks, etc. in the space she had built in her house. Carmen also travels the streets of her city selling her products. She works hard for the well being of her children, and that is what motivates her to work every day. The work has been profitable because her products sell easily. She receives daily earnings, which makes her feel satisfied. Most of her customers are children. In the future, Carmen would like to have a grocery store in her house to sell her products and other foods. She has had 9 loans with MFP. Her community bank is “Campo Verde”, and she likes to work there because the group members are responsible and on time with their payments. She will use the loan to buy a freezer that costs 2500 PEN. She will cover the part of the cost not covered by the loan with her savings of 1000 PEN (that she has thanks to her work). With this machine she will be able to produce more chilled products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a freezer

loans.name: Dalia

texts.es: Dalia tiene 37 años, es madre de 4 hijos y vive junto a su esposo, quien es trabajador dependiente, gracias al trabajo de ambos, cuentan con una casa propia. Desde hace 4 años Dalia  se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad (arroz, azúcar, sal, fideos, etc.) formando así, su pequeña bodega. Lo que le gusta de su labor diaria es el trato con sus clientes, sobre todo con aquellos que también tienen otros negocios, y comentan al respecto de sus experiencias en sus trabajos. La bodega de Dalia es rentable porque es la única en su zona, por ello, es visitada por sus vecinos más cercanos y también por otras personas que no encuentran en su zona, lo que Dalia vende, a razón de esto, le va muy bien. Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP, y el dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de productos de primera necesidad para implementar su negocio.
texts.en:
Dalia is 37 years old, a mother to 4 children and lives together with her husband who is employed. Thanks to both of their labours, they have their own house. For 4 years Dalia has been selling essential produce (rice, sugar, salt, noodles, etc.), that make up her grocery shop. The thing she likes about her job is dealing with her customers on a daily basis, especially those who have their own businesses and talk about their experiences at work. Dalia’s grocery shop is profitable because it is the only one in the area so local residents use it as well as other people who do not have what Dalia sells in their area, so she does very well. This is her first loan with MFP and the money she is asking for will be used to buy the essential produce for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Rose

texts.fr:
K. Rose est née vers 1966. Rose est mariée à MIKPONHOUN Nestor et mère de cinq enfants dont quatre sont scolarisés. Rose réside dans un quartier de Cotonou où elle exerce ses activités commerciales de  vente de condiments pour la sauce. Rose achète les condiments pour faire la sauce au marché international du Bénin à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Rose veut répondre au mieux aux besoins de sa clientèle; et pour ceci elle a besoin de renforcer son fonds de roulement. C'est pour cette raison que Rose sollicite un prêt auprès de ALIDé. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
K. Rose was born around 1966. She is married to MIKPONHOUN Nestor and is the mother of five children, four of whom are in school. She resides in a district of Cotonou where she does business selling condiments for making sauces. She buys these condiments at the international marketplace of Benin in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Sometimes she alternates with her domestic help (see photo) in doing the selling. Rose wants to respond better to the needs of her customers. To do so, she needs to boost her working capital. This is why she’s requesting a loan from Alidé. Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy condiments (fresh and canned tomatoes, chili peppers, onions, spices, bouillon cubes, pasta, sacks of salt, etc.)

loans.name: Getruda M.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 32 year old Getruda Mpiyila from Mbeya. She is married with 2 children, between the ages of 2 and 5. Getruda has been running a salon business since 1997. Gertruda's beauty salon is a place where her friends and fellow women can gather and literally let their hair down.  Most beauty salons in Tanzania are places where you can buy long hair, short hair, curly hair, straight hair, red hair, blue hair, and then have it attached to your head, woven, cut, or braided, and made to look like your own.  Gertruda works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 7 days per week and currently earns about 160USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 375USD in order to purchase rastas and cosmetics for her salon. In the future, she plans to start a new business. Getruda thanks you for your support!


ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase rastas and cosmetics for her salon

loans.name: Alhamchon

texts.ru: Алхамчон и его жена продают детскую одежду и обувь. Занимаются этим уже несколько лет и за счет бизнеса живут. Алхамчону 37 лет, у него один ребенок. После окончания школы служил в армии 2 года. После приезда стал работать. Несколько лет назад увидев что заработной платы не хватает на жизнь, тем более его жена тоже нигде не работала, Алхамчон решил заняться предпринимательством. За товаром он ездит сам, а в это время его жена уже торгует. Алхамчон сотрудничает с МикроИнвест 1,5 года, показал себя ответственным заемщиком. Сейчас решил получить новый займ и расширить ассортимент своих товаров.
texts.en:
Alhamchon and his wife sell children’s clothing and shoes. They have been doing this for several years and live on the earnings from their business. Alhamchon is 37 years old, he has one child. After finishing school he served in the army for 2 years. After coming back he started working. Several years ago, after seeing that his salary was not enough to live on, especially since his wife did not have a job, Alhamchon decided to become an entrepreneur. He travels to purchase the products on his own and at the same time his wife sells their products. Alhamchon has been working with MicroInvest for 1.5 years and has shown that he is a responsible borrower. Right now he decided to take out a loan and expand his product selection.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase product assortment

loans.name: Alika

texts.fr: Alika A. est âgé de 33 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. il est tapissier à Lomé, la capitale togolaise. il désire avec ce crédit acheter une machine à coudre et des outils de travail pour la bonne exécution de son travail. Cette opportunité lui permettra de gagner plus d’argent afin de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Alika A., age 33, is married and the father of two. He is an upholsterer in Lomé, the capital of Togo. He would like to use this loan to buy a sewing machine and tools of the trade for carrying out his work well. This opportunity will enable him to earn more money in order to provide for his family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and work tools

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Sabougnouma ont en moyenne 42ans, 5 enfants. Le groupe est composé de 3 veuves et 5 femmes mariées majoritairement polygames mais vivent toutes dans des grandes familles traditionnelles   dans le quartier bamanan kin de kirango Markala (4ème région administrative du Mali).
Ce groupe fait  le commerce de céréales et des poissons. 
Après trois prêts solidaires correctement remboursés ce groupe est à son quatrième prêt qui sera utilisé pour acheter, 250 kg de poisson frais, 15 sacs de mil, 6 sacs de riz et 2 sacs d’haricot. Elles s’approvisionnent en poisson au bord du fleuve Niger à l’entrée du barrage de Markala et en céréales au marché hebdomadaire de Diamarabougou .Actuellement la moitié du poisson est séchée à domicile ; les poissons sont ensuite revendus en détail parfois au marché journalier de Kirango Markala, à Ségou et à Bamako à des grossistes au comptant ; les céréales sont revendus à domicile et au marché de Kirango à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser  un bénéfice moyen de 49.000FCFA par mois qui servira pour la prise en charge des frais scolaires des enfants et de la famille. 
Elles ont pour ambition d’acheter une maison à usage d’habitation.
NB : Fatoumata D. a accouché c’est pourquoi elle ne figure pas sur la photo
texts.en:
The members of this Sabougnouma group have an average age of 42 and 5 children. The group is composed of 3 widows and 5 married women, mostly polygamous, but all live in big traditional families in the Bamanan Kin district of Kirango Markala (fourth administrative region of Mali).

This group sells cereals and fish. After three solidarity loans, correctly reimbursed, this group is on its fourth loan which will be used to buy 250 kg of fresh fish, 15 sacks of millet, 6 sacks of rice, and 2 sacks of dried beans. They buy their fish along the banks of the Niger River at the entrance to the Markala dam, and their cereals at the weekly market of Diamarabougou.

Presently, half the fish is dried at home; the fish is then sold retail, sometimes in the daily market of Kiranga Markala, in Ségou, and in Bamako to wholesalers, for cash. The cereals are sold out of their houses and at the Kirango market to a clientele composed of men and women.

They expect to make an average profit of 49,000 F CFA per month which will be used to cover school fees for the children of the family. Their ambition is to buy a house to live in. NB : Fatoumata D. had just had a baby; that is why she is not in the photo.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cereals and fish for re-sale

loans.name: Dorith

texts.es: Dorith tiene 38 años, es madre de 2 hijos, y vive con su esposo, quien se dedica a L. crianza y venta de ganado. L. casa donde habitan es propia. Desde hace 7 años se dedica a vender comida en un puesto del mercado de su localidad, y también brinda pensión (menús diarios) a los trabajadores de una empresa constructora. Dorith sabe ganarse L. confianza de todos ellos quienes degustan de su buena sazón, porque los platos que prepara son muy sanos y deliciosos. Para L. preparación y atención cuenta con el apoyo  de  uno de sus hijos, y por ello le gusta mucho su trabajo, además, ver L. sonrisa de sus clientes al probar su comida es su gran satisfacción, y trabaja en lo que más le gusta, cocinar. Con MFP ya tiene 3 préstamos, considera que trabajar en su banco comunal es una gran experiencia, todos los integrantes son cumplidos y ordenados, y eso alienta mucho a Dorith a su progreso personal. 1000 soles del monto que viene solicitando serán invertidos en su negocio de comida, y con lo restante apoyará a su esposo para L. compra de un toro para que sea el padrillo de sus vacas.
texts.en:
Dorith is 38 years old and a mother of two children. She lives with her husband, who is dedicated to raising and selling livestock. The house in which she lives is her own. For the past seven years, she has been dedicated to selling food in a local market stand and she also has been offering a daily menu for workers of a construction business. Dorith knows how to win the trust of all those who sample her tasty food, because the plates that she prepares are healthy and delicious. For the preparation and service of her food she works with the support of one of her children, and for this reason, she likes her job a lot. Furthermore, seeing the smiles of her clients upon tasting her food is a great satisfaction; she works doing what she likes most: cooking. With MFP, she has already had three loans. Working in her community bank is a great experience, because all the members are punctual and organized, which encourages Dorith's personal progress. The 1000 soles that she is requesting will be invested in her food business, and with the rest she will support her husband in purchasing a bull to be the father for more cows.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her food business and the business of her husband

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 30 year old Dina B. from Mwanza. She is married and has been running a pharmacy business since 2006. Dina sells different medicines which are used as treatment for different sicknesses.  She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by one employee. Dina currently earns about 270USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400USD in order to purchase more medicine to resell to customers.   In the future, she plans to expand her business. Dina thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA!
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to resell to customers.

loans.name: Badenya Group

texts.fr:
Les sept membres  du groupe Badenya ont en moyenne 34 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies dans le quartier Bamanan kin de Kirango Markala   (4ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont sollicité Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire après avoir correctement remboursés les trois  prêts précédents. 
Elles comptent  utiliser ce prêt pour acheter : 3 sacs d’haricot, 25 pièces de pagnes wax, 20 draps, 16 chargements de bois de chauffe et des ingrédients pour fabrication des boissons locales (25kg de gingembre, 20kg d’oseilles de Guinée, des essences et 4sacs de sucre).
Elles se ravitaillent en pagnes wax et draps à Ségou, en bois de chauffe à Djibougou, en haricot et en produits de jus au marché de Diamarabougou. . Les produits sont revendus à domicile, en ambulant dans les quartiers, dans les marchés de Diamarabougou, de kirango et dans les foires de Sansanding et de Siribala  à une clientèle composée d’hommes, de femmes et d’enfants. Elles envisagent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 39.500FCFA par mois utilisé généralement pour rembourser le prêt et constituer petit à petit le trousseau de mariage.
NB : Korotoumou B. était malade raison pour laquelle il y’a 6 femmes su la photo au lieu de 7.
texts.en:
The seven members of this Badenya group have an average age of 34 and 3 children. They live in big extended traditional families in the Bamanan Kin district of Kirango Markala (fourth administrative region of Mali).

They met through bonds of neighborhood, marriage, and kinship. With the intention of increasing their working capital, they came to Soro Yiriwaso and are on their fourth solidarity loan after having correctly reimbursed the three preceding loans.

They intend to use this loan to buy 3 sacks of dried beans, 25 lengths of high quality "pagne" (brightly colored African print cloth), 20 bedsheets, 16 loads of firewood, and ingredients for making local soft drinks (25 kg of ginger, 20 kg of hibiscus flowers, flavorings, and 4 sacks of sugar).

They stock up on "pagnes" and bedsheets in Ségou, on firewood in Djibougou, in beans and ingredients for juice in the market of Diamarabougou. The products are sold at home, walking around the residential neighborhoods, in the markets of Diamarabougou and Kirango, and in the weekly markets of Sansanding and Siribala to a clientele composed of men, women, and children. They expect to make an average profit of 39,500 F CFA per month, which will be used in general to reimburse the loan and put together wedding trousseaus little by little.

NB: Korotoumou B. was ill; that is the reason why there are 6 women in the photo instead of 7.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of cereals, ingredients for making juice, "pagnes" and firewood

loans.name: Grace M.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 27 year old Grace M. A. from Kyela. She is married with 3 children, between the ages of 2 and 9. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependents because their parents are too poor to care for them. Grace has been running a cereals (maize, rice, wheat etc.) business since 1998. A typical maize business is a stand on the side of the road where maize is often piled high in baskets.  Customers can scrutinize the quality of the product before they purchase it and can specify the exact amount that they would like to purchase. Maize is very important to the Tanzanian culture as it is used to make a staple dish called ugali, which is made solely of maize, flour and water.  Grace works at the business for 9 - 12 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by her husband. Grace currently earns about 300USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 675USD in order to buy more maize, wheat, a mallet and beans in bulk. In the future, she plans to increase the stock. Grace thanks you for your support!


ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy more maize, wheat, a mallet and beans in bulk.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.es: La señora Imelda tiene 51 años de edad, reside en Laureles Norte en la ciudad de Managua, con cuatro hijos mayores de edad, dos a un dependen de ella, ella se desempeña en servicios domésticos, un trabajo agotador pero tiene que sobresalir adelante para poder ofrecer a sus hijos una vida en mejores condiciones,  este es su tercer ciclo en Afodenic el cual da las gracias por el apoyo que ha brindado hasta ahora, con esta solicitud de crédito va a comprar materiales de construcción para cambiar el techo de su casa que esta en mal estado y desea hacerlo ante que caigan las primeras agua de Mayo. Sus planes es poder tener salud y poder seguir trabajando para seguir haciendo mejoras a su casa ya que su casa es una parte de concreto , pero el resto es de zinc y cartón. Uno de su anhelo es poder tener una casa digna.
texts.en:
Señora Imelda is 51 years of age and resides in Laureles Norte in the city of Managua with her four older children. Two of them are dependent still upon her. She works doing household services, which is an exhausting job but she must move forward so she may offer her children a life with better conditions. This is her third cycle with Afodenic, to whom she gives thanks for the support that has been offered to her so far. With this credit request, she is going to buy construction materials to change the roof of her house. It is in a bad state and she desires to complete this project before the first rains of May fall. Her plans are to have good health and continue working in order to continue making improvements to her house since though it is partially concrete, the rest of it is made of zinc and cardboard. One of her yearnings is to be able to have a decent house.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to change the roof of her house, which is in a bad state.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 59 year old Martha M. from Mwanza. She is married with nine children, between the ages of 24 and 30 years old. Martha has been running a pharmacy business since 2008. Martha’s business is to sell medicine to customers. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week. Martha currently earns about 300USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400USD in order to purchase medicine to sell to customers.  In the future, she plans to renovate her house. Martha thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA!
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sum

loans.use: To purchase medicine to sell to customers.

loans.name: Rachetés Plus Group

texts.fr: Elisa N. vend des vivres frais et des épices. Elle a commencé son affaire en 2000 après le divorce avec son mari. Son capital initial était de $25 qui lui avaient permis d’acheter un carton des poissons à revendre. Après un dur travail, elle est parvenue à accroitre son capital à $100 en 2005. L’affaire d’Elisa a connu des difficultés de 2005 à 2007 suite aux coupures intempestives d’électricité dans son quartier qui causait la pourriture des poissons. Son affaire a reprit l’élan normal en 2008 depuis la stabilisation du courant électrique. Dans le souci de renforcer son affaire de façon permanente et d’accroitre son revenu,  Elisa a rejoint un des groupes de l’IMF Hope RDC dénommé « Rachetés » en décembre 2008. Le crédit qu’elle a obtenu lui a permit d’acheter un carton des poissons frais, des arachides et épices à revendre en vue d’augmenter le bénéfice. Actuellement,  son affaire génère un bénéfice de $20 par semaine. Son ambition est d’ouvrir une maison de chambre froide pour revendre des vivres frais. Elisa est agée de 50 ans, divorcée et mère de 4 enfants agés de 16 à 30 ans dont les deux derniers vivent encore avec elle. Elisa est contente des crédits reçus de Hope parce qu’ils l’aident à développer son activité et lui donner l’espoir.
texts.en:
Elisa N. sells fresh staple foods and spices. She started her business in 2000 after her divorce. Her initial capital was $25, which had enabled her to buy a box of fish to resell. After working hard, she was able to grow her capital to $100 in 2005. Her business experienced some difficulty in 2005-2007 following untimely electrical outages in her district that caused the fish to spoil. Her business regained its normal momentum in 2008 since electrical power was stabilized.

Wanting to bolster her business continually and to grow her revenues, Elisa joined one of the groups of the micro-finance institution HOPE RDC named “Rachetés” in December 2008. The loan she obtained enabled her to buy a box of fresh fish, some peanuts, and spices to resell with the goal of augmenting her profits. Currently, her business generates a profit of $20 per week. Her ambition is to open a house with a cold room for reselling fresh staple items.

Elisa is 50 years old, divorced, and the mother of four children, ages 16 to 30. The last two of them live with her. She is happy with the loans received from HOPE because they help her to develop her business and give her hope.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a box of fresh fish, peanuts, and spices to resell

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Zanifa

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 37-year-old Zanifa K. from Mwanza. She is married with two children, 15 and 18 years old. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting one dependent because her parents do not take care of her. Zanifa has been running a beauty salon since 2007. This is the place where you can buy long hair, short hair, curly hair, straight hair, red hair, blue hair, and then have it attached to your head, woven, cut, or braided, and made to look like your own.

Zanifa works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by two employees. Zanifa currently earns about 200 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400 USD in order to buy more dryers for her salon. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Zanifa thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy more dryers for her salon

loans.name: Atasse

texts.fr: Atasse A. est un jeune homme de 37 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. il est propriétaire d’un dépôt des produits FanMilk. Il souhaite avec ce crédit accroître la taille de son magasin en Achetant deux congélateurs pour la conservation de ses marchandises. Ce faisant, il évitera les pertes et tirera et dégagera plus de profits.
texts.en:
Atasse A., age 37, is a young man, married, and the father of two. He is the owner of an outlet for FanMilk products. He would like to use this loan to expand his store by buying two freezers for keeping his merchandise. By doing this, he will avoid losses and will derive more profit.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two freezers

loans.name: Hawa C.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings) from Tanzania! This is 23-year-old Hawa M. from Mbeya. She is single with two children, aged 3 and 6. Hawa has been running a "Duka" business since 2003. She owns a small duka or neighborhood shop in the town where she sells common household and grocery items.

Hawa works at the business for 9 - 12 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by one employee. Hawa currently earns about 130 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 625 USD in order to purchase more goods in bulk. Hawa thanks you for your support.

ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more goods in bulk

loans.name: Hilda D.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings) from Tanzania! This is 46-year-old Hilda M. from Kyela. She is married with 3 children, between the ages of 10 and 18. Hilda has been running a rice-selling business since 2000. She buys rice from farmers at wholesale prices and sells it in town at retail prices.

Hilda works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by her husband. Hilda currently earns about 120 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400 USD in order to purchase more rice in bulk. In the future, she plans to open a new business. Hilda thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more rice in bulk

loans.name: Marlene Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Marlene del Socorro R. Pérez tiene la edad de 49 años,  habita en el barrio Juan Ramón Padilla , junto a su esposo , él cual trabaja para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar , ya que ellos tienen a su cargo una hija de 15 años que actualmente estudia , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida y apoyar a su hija para que sea una profesional en el futuro , desde hace seis años doña Marlene trabaja como agricultura , la mayor dificultad es la falta de financiamiento , el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de insumos y fertilizantes para obtener una mejor cosecha y poder vender mejor en el mercado.
texts.en:
Marlene del Socorro R. Pérez is 49 years old, and she lives in the Juan Ramón Padilla neighborhood of Managua with her husband. He also works to help her cover their household expenses, since they must look after their 15-year-old daughter, who is currently a student. Marlene's plans for her family are to improve their living conditions and to support her daughter so that she may become a professional in the future. Since the age of 6, Marlene has worked in farming. The main difficulty in her work has always been a lack of funding. She will invest her loan in the purchase of raw materials and fertilizers so that she can obtain a better harvest, allowing her to sell more when she goes to market.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar insumos agricolas para mejorar el cultivo

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 29-years-old Paulina P.. She is married with a 1-year-old child. Paulina has been running a mobile phone accessories business. It is amazing how many people have mobile phones in Tanzania! This is probably because it is the only form of phone communication available to most people since there are few landlines. Also, mobile phones are relatively cheap.

Paulina works at her business for 4 hours a day, 7 days a week and is assisted by two employees. She currently earns about $210 US. She is requesting a loan of $400 US in order to purchase phone accessories and sell them to customers. In the future, she plans to open another business. Paulina thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania through microleasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase phone accessories

loans.name: Jane K.

texts.en:
