Mambo (Greetings) from Tanzania! This is 28-years-old Jane Z. from Mbeya. She is married with a 1-year-old child. Jane has been running a crops business since 2006. She purchases crops from villages on a whole sale basis and sells them on a retail basis in town.

She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 6 days per week. Jane currently earns about $120 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $475 in order to purchase crops in bulk for her business. In the future, she plans to increase the variety of crops in her business. Jane thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania through microleasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase crops in bulk for her business

loans.name: Eliza

texts.es: Eliza tiene 33 años, es madre soltera, vive en casa de sus padres con su único hijo. Hace 6 años se dedica a la venta de golosinas y bebidas (gaseosas y jugos) en su casa. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es dar una buena atención a sus clientes para que los mismos se sientan a gusto y regresen otro día. Su negocio le es rentable porque por donde ella vive es la única que vende estos productos que gustan a muchos y sobre todo a los niños. Eliza está contenta con su trabajo, y gracias al mismo, está logrando, poco a poco, sus objetivos. Para más adelante quiere ampliar su negocio y ambientarlo mejor para dar una mejor acogida a sus clientes. Con este ya son 11 préstamos que tiene con MFP, y le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque todos los integrantes son responsables, coordinados y puntuales en sus pagos. Con el dinero que ahora viene solicitando comprará golosinas y bebidas gaseosas a un costo de 1000 soles, lo demás lo invertirá en la construcción de su casa, ya que sus padres le cedieron una parte de su terreno para que construya su vivienda, donde podrá implementar mejor su negocio.
texts.en:
Eliza is 33 years old, a single mother, and lives in her parents’ house with her only son. For six years she has dedicated herself to the sale of candies and drinks (sodas and juices) in her house. What she likes about her job is to give good service to her customers so that they like it and come back another day. Her business is profitable because where she lives she is the only person that sells these products that so many enjoy, above all the children. Eliza is happy with her work and, thanks to that, is achieving her objectives little by little. In the future she wants to increase her business and improve the atmosphere in order to give her customers a better reception.

This will be her eleventh loan with MFP, and she enjoys working with her communal bank because all of the members are responsible, coordinated, and punctual in their payments. With the money she is now asking for she will purchase candies and sodas at a cost of 1000 PEN, and the rest will be invested in the construction of her house, now that her parents have given her a part of their land to build her own house, where she will be able to better set up her business.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing of merchandise and arrangement of her living quarters

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Koffi A. est un homme de 45 ans marié et père de 2 enfants tous sur les bancs de l’école. Il est propriétaire d’un cyber café à Lomé la capitale togolaise. Koffi souhaite avec ce crédit acheter des ordinateurs pour accroître la taille de son activité et offrir un service de qualité à sa clientèle. Il compte sur cette opportunité pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Koffi A. is a 45-year-old man, married, and the father of two children who are both in school. He is the owner of an internet café in Lomé, the capital of Togo. Koffi would like to use this loan to buy some computers for expanding his business and for offering quality service to his customers. He is counting on this opportunity to improve his family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy computers

loans.name: Elizbet

texts.es: Elizbet tiene 32 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive con su hija, quien es su razón de salir adelante. Desde hace 3 años vende ropa para niños y adultos, lleva sus prendas por diferentes lugares de su localidad dejándolas al crédito o al contado visitando a sus clientes de casa en casa. También es propietaria de un motocarro, el mismo que lo maneja su hermano realizando transporte de pasajeros y Elizbet administra las ganancias. Lo que le gusta de su negocio de venta de ropa es que vende todos los días y le es rentable porque ya tiene una clientela seleccionada con quienes trabaja regularmente. Para más adelante, Elizbet quiere tener una tienda de ropa. Es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque nota que existe mucho apoyo por parte de ellos y son responsables. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más prendas, a un valor de 800 soles, con el resto mandará a reparar su motocarro para que esté en buenas condiciones y produzca mejor.
texts.en:
Elizbet is 32 years old, and is a single mother living with her daughter, who is the reason she continues to struggle forward. Since she was three years old she has sold clothing for children and adults, taking her wares to different places in the region in which she lives, selling them door-to-door on credit to her customers. She also owns a mototaxi, which her brother uses for a taxi service, with Elizabet managing the finances. What she most likes about her clothing sales business is that she sells every day, and it's profitable for her because she already has an established clientele with which she works regularly. In the future, Elizabet would like to have a clothing store.

This is the first time Elizabet will take a loan from MFP, and she likes working with her communal bank because she sees that there is a lot of support among its members, and they are very responsible. With the money she's asking for she will buy more clothes to sell, at a price of 800 soles, and with the rest she will get her mototaxi repaired so it is in better shape and can earn her more.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for sale

loans.name: Calisto Simeao

texts.pt:
Calisto nasceu em inhambane tem 38 anos de idade estudou ate a 12 classe casado e pai de 2 filhos o primeiro de 5 anos e o segundo de 1 ano  somente o mais velho e que se enconbtra a estudar


Calisto sai de inhambane a namaacha uma vila na fronteira da swazilandia apos concluir a 5 classe. Seu irmao mais velho e transferido para namaacha e vem junto com ele, chegado ele continua com os seus estudos e consequentimente ganha uma bolsa de estudo de assistente juridico e e colocado para trabalhar no tribunal da namaacha como assistente juridico, mas como a sua instituiçao não estava oficializada não tinham direito de salario. A educaçao estava a fazer contratos e ele e um dos beneficiados já e do quadro com categoria de adjunto pedagogico trabalha das 7h as 12h auferindo por mês um valor de 5.900.00mt. para alem da educaçao tem sido solicitado para fazer trabalhos de advogacia pelos seus clientes que apesar de ser demorado tem havido sucesso de acordo com o processo em causa. Calisto com ajuda da sua esposa que e funcionaria da saude consegue colectar um valor e inicia a sua obra, não consegue terminar e aproxima se aos serviços da  hluvuku solocitando um valor de 15.000.00mt para dar continuidade da mesma que por motivo de chuvas os tijolos partecem com muita facilidade. Para alem dos seus filhos responsabiliza se pela sua irma e sobrinho que vivem com ele em sua casa.



Este e o primeiro emprestimo de calisto na hluvuku e kiva. Estes 15.000.00mt  seram usados para comprar material de construçao para concluir a sua varranda que esta a ser consumida pelas aguas das chuvas, esta confiante que vai reembolsar antes do tempo determinado e pedir um novo emprestimo para concluir com a manuntençao e pintura da sua casa.
texts.en:
Calisto was born in Inhambane. He is 38 years old and went to school until the 12th grade. He is married, and he is the father of 2 children. The first is 5 years old, and the second is 1 year old. Only the oldest is in school. Calisto left Inhambane for Namaacha, a town on the border of Swaziland, after he finished the 5th grade. His oldest brother was transferred to Namaacha and he came with him. When he arrived he continued with his studies, and consequently he earned a scholarship to be a legal assistant. He found work in the courts as a legal assistant, but as his institution was not acredited, he did not have the right to a salary. The school entered into contracts, and he was one of the beneficiaries. He is already on the staff as an assistant instructor. He works from 7:00am until 12:00pm and earn a monthly sum of 5,900MT. Besides teaching he has also does advocacy work for his clients who, in spite of being delayed, have had success in the cause process. Calisto, with help from his wife, who is a health official, was able to collect enough money to begin his work, but he was unable to finish so he approached Hluvuku and solicited a loan for 15,000MT to continue because the rain causes his bricks to break very easily. Besides his children, he is responsible for his sister and nephew who live with him in his house. This is his first loan with Hluvuku and with Kiva. The 15,000MT will be used to purchase construction materials to finish his veranda that is being eroded from the rain. He is confident that he will pay off the loan before maturity and request another to finish the maintenance as well as paint his house.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es: Elvira de 30 años, es madre de dos hijos, vive junto a su esposo, quien es trabaja en la venta de madera. Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la crianza de pollos en un pequeño galpón construido atrás de su casa, para luego llevarlos a vender al mejor postor en el mercado. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es criar bien a sus animales para que sus clientes no tengan queja alguna acerca de su tamaño o su peso. Este negocio es rentable porque en un lapso de 35 días, los pollos ya están listos para la venta. Lo difícil es no contar con un lugar adecuado, ya que lo viene haciendo en su propio domicilio en un pequeño galpón, el que no es del todo adecuado para una buena crianza de este tipo de animales. Con MFP tiene 2 préstamos y le gusta el trabajo en su banco comunal porque todos sus compañeros son responsables y solidarios. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de pollos bebés y suficiente alimento para su crianza.
texts.en:
Elvira is 30, has two children, lives with her husband who works selling wood. Four years ago she started raising chickens in a small area built behind her house, she then takes them to the market and sells them for the best offer. What she likes about her job is raising good chickens so that her clients have no complaints about size or weight. This is a profitable business because in approximately 35 days the chickens are ready for sale. The difficult part of her job is not having an appropriate location, because the small area in her house is not suitable to properly raise the chickens. With MFP she has two loans, she likes to work with the community bank because everyone is responsible and helpful. The money now requested is to be invested in buying baby chickens as well as feed to raise them.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy feed and chickens to raise.

loans.name: Rolando Jose

texts.es: El señor Rolando Sánchez Hernández tiene la edad de 49 años, habita en el barrio Juan Ramón Padilla, junto a su esposa, la cual trabaja como comerciante en el mercado oriental, ellos tienen once hijos de los cuales cuatro están a su cargo , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus cuatro hijos y darle estudios , don Rolando desde hace 30 años se dedica a la agricultura , la mayor dificultad es la falta de financiamiento , y las plagas que atacan al cultivo , el inicio sus trabajos agrícola con el apoyo de sus padres , el financiamiento lo quiere para la compra de fertilizantes e insumos para poder tener una buena producción y vender a mejor precio.
texts.en:
Mr. Rolando S. H., 49, lives in the neighborhood Juan Ramon Padilla with his wife, who works as a vendor in the market on the east side of town. They have 11 children, 4 of whom still live at home. Rolando began working as a farmer 30 years ago with the support of his parents, and has continued that work despite difficulties with pests and a lack of proper financing. Today, the loan that he is requesting is for the purchase of fertilizers and other agricultural supplies in order to produce a good yield and sell his crops at a better price. With the increase in income, Rolando hopes to improve the living conditions of his four children and make sure they have access to a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of farm supplies

loans.name: Jenti G.

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings) from Tanzania! Jenti M. from Kyela is married with four children, and also supports two dependants because they are orphans. Jenti has been running a business purchasing and selling rice since 2006. She works for nine to twelve hours per day, six days a week. Jenti currently earns about $80 USD a month, and is requesting a loan of $400 in order to purchase rice in bulk for her business. In the future, she plans to open a new business. Jenti thanks you for your support!

About SELFINA
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania through microleasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and lease-back microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase rice in bulk for her business

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings) from Tanzania! Agnes M. from Mwanza is 45 years old and married with four children between the ages of 18 and 24. Agnes has been running a business selling charcoal since 2005. Charcoal is used by many Tanzanians as a fuel to cook their daily meals. Women cook food in small coal pots, in which they arrange mkaa (charcoal), and add paper, dry grass, old plastic bags or kerosene in order to light it.

As there is such a high demand across the country, being a charcoal seller is quite lucrative! Agnes works at the business for twelve hours per day, seven days a week, and is assisted by one employee. She currently earns about $150 USD from her business, and is requesting a loan of $400 USD in order to purchase more charcoal and resell it. In the future, she plans to open another business. Agnes thanks you for your support!

About SELFINA
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania through microleasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and lease-back microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal for resale

loans.name: Emerita

texts.es: Emerita tiene 50 años, vive sólo con su esposo, ya que sus hijos son independientes y tiene sus propias familias. Se dedica a la venta de útiles de escritorio (cuadernos y libros en general), en un puesto cercano a una institución educativa y a una institución pública, llegando a implementar una pequeña librería. Esta actividad la viene ejerciendo desde hace 5 años y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo. Además, su negocio le es rentable porque sus productos son muy demandados y ya cuenta con clientes fieles, quienes le compran regularmente. Para el futuro, Emerita quiere ampliar su negocio e implementarlo mucho mejor. Con MFP ya tiene 9 préstamos, y el dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de libros, cuadernos y demás útiles de escritorio.
texts.en:
Emerita is 50 years old and lives just with her husband because her children are independent and have their own families. She sells office supplies (notebooks and books in general) at a booth near a school and a public institution and her booth has become a small bookstore. She has been running this business for the past 5 years with the help of her husband. It is profitable for her because there is high demand for her products and she has loyal customers who buy from her regularly. In the future, Emerita wants to expand her business and run it better. With MFP she has already received 9 loans and the loan she is applying for now will be used for purchasing books, notebooks and other office supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase stock of merchandise

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es: Gladis tiene 50 años D. edad, es madre D. 3 hijos, siendo uno D. ellos estudiante y los otros dos, mayores, solteros y trabajadores. También vive junto a su esposo, quien la apoya mucho en su negocio, él es trabajador independiente (carpintero y albañil). Juntos pudieron construir su casa es propia. Ella se dedica a vender abarrotes, productos comestibles (leche, arroz, golosinas, etc.) y bebidas.  Esta actividad la viene realizando desD. hace 5 años atrás en un espacio que acondicionó en su casa y cuenta con el apoyo D. sus dos hijos. Lo que le gusta D. su trabajo es dar lo mejor D. ella a sus clientes, para que se sientan satisfechos y regresen a comprarle, además le es rentable, ya que se encuentra ubicada en un lugar muy transitado, por lo que le va bien en su negocio. Posteriormente, Gladis quiere ampliar su tienda para dar mejor acogida a sus consumidores. Con MFP, tiene 11 préstamos, y le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque sus compañeros son todos cumplidos y ordenados. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mercadería para su tienda en un monto aproximado D. 1000 soles, con el resto arreglará algunas estructuras D. su casa.
texts.en:
Gladis is 50 years old and the mother of 3 children. One of her children is a student and the other two, who are older, are single and working. She lives with her husband who helps her a lot with her business. He is an independent carpenter and bricklayer. Together they were able to build their own house. Gladis works selling groceries such as milk, rice, sweets and drinks. She has been working in this business for the past 5 years in a space in her house that was outfitted for that purpose, and she depends on the help of two of her children. What she likes about her work is doing her best for her clients so that they are satisfied and return to buy from her store. It is a profitable business because the store is located in a very busy location which makes business go quite well for her. In the future, Gladis wants to expand her store so it can better accommodate her customers. With MFP she has received 11 loans and she likes to work with the communal bank because all of her fellow members are polite and organized. With this loan she will use about 1000 Soles (Peruvian currency: about half of the loan) to buy merchandise for her store and with the rest she will fix her house.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase stock of merchandise and to fix house

loans.name: Yao

texts.fr: Yao A. est un cordonnier à Lomé. Agé de 38 ans, il est marié et père d’un enfant. Yao exerce ce métier depuis 3 ans et ses œuvres sont de haute qualité. Pour répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle, Yao souhaite avec ce crédit, acheter des peaux de bêtes et des boîtes de colle pour la confection des chaussures. cette chance lui permettra d'augmenter son chiffre d'affaires et par conséquent dégager des profits pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille
texts.en:
Yao A., age 38, is a shoemaker in Lomé. He's married and the father of one child. Yao has been in this business for 3 years, and he makes high quality shoes. To answer the needs of his clientele, he wishes to use this loan to buy animal skins and boxes of shoemaking glue. This opportunity will enable him to increase his revenue and, as a consequence, to turn a profit to provide for his family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy animal skins and shoemaking glue

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase crops in bulk

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 29 year old Veronika K. from Mwanza. She is married with three children, between the ages of 5 and 9 years old. Veronika has been running a grains business since 2004. Veronika sells rice, maize and wheat flour. She works at the business for 12 hours a day, 6 days per week and is assisted by two employees. Veronika currently earns about 220USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400USD in order to purchase more rice to resell. In the future, she plans to open another business. Veronika thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA!
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more rice to resell.

loans.name: Monica M.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 56 year old Monica M. M. from Mbeya. She is a widow with 8 children, between the ages of 18 and 40. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependents because their parents cannot care for them.  Monica has been running a bar since 2000. Her bar is a good place to relax with a beer if you manage to finish work early on a Friday afternoon. You can relax on a plastic chair under a tree, with a local beer in hand, the aroma of roasting ‘mishikaki’  (kebabs made on an open fire) wafting around you, and talk to everyone who happens to wander by.  Monika works at the business for 9 - 12 hours per day, 7 days per week and is assisted by two employees. Monica currently earns about 230USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 300USD in order to purchase more drinks in bulk. In the future, she plans to increase the range of her business. Monica thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks in bulk.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 47 year old Lucy M. from Mwanza. She is married with two children, between the ages 15 and 21 years old. Lucy has been running a tailoring business since 2006. Lucy makes tailored clothes and sells them to customers. She works at the business for 8 hours a day, 5 days per week and is assisted by one employee. Lucy currently earns about 250USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400USD in order to purchase another sewing machine. In the future, she plans to open another business. Lucy thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA!
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase another sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cocoa in bulk for her business.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi A. est une femme de 55 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants. elle est revendeuse de céréales au grand marché de Lomé. Pour accroître la taille de son commerce, Afi souhaite avec ce crédit acheter des sacs de maïs, mils, haricots et d'arachides pour la revente. Elle gagnera à cet effet plus de fonds pour subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants
texts.en:
Afi A., age 55, is married and the mother of 5 children. She resells cereals at the grand market in Lomé. In order to expand her business, Afi wishes to use this loan to buy sacks of corn, millet, beans and peanuts, for reselling. She will thus earn a higher income to provide for her children.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of corn, millet, beans and peanuts

loans.name: Eliane Kossiba

texts.fr:
T.Eliane Kossiba est née vers les années 1980. Eliane Kossiba est célibataire sans enfant et réside à COTONOU, Capitale Économique du BENIN. Eliane Kossiba vend des produits cosmétiques, des tissus, des chaussures et des sacs de sortie. Eliane Kossiba a pour projet de développer son activité afin de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle. Mais Eliane Kossiba n'a pas suffisamment de moyens financiers pour y arriver seule. C'est pourquoi Eliane Kossiba sollicite l'appui de ALIDé. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
Eliane Kossiba TOGOUAN was born circa 1980 and lives in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She's unmarried and doesn't have children. She sells cosmetics, fabrics, shoes, and handbags. She projects to bolster her business, in order to better meet customer demand. But she lacks financial means to achieve this on her own. This is why Elias Kossiba is seeking the help of Kiva's partner, Alidé.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics, fabrics, and handbags

loans.name: Suzana

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 40 year old Suzana K. from Mwanza. She is single with two children, between the ages of 12 and 18 years old. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependents because they are orphans. Suzana has been running a pharmacy business since 2007. Suzana sells medicine to customers and works at the business for 4 hours a day, 7 days per week.  She is assisted by one employee. Suzana currently earns about 260USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400USD in order to purchase more medicine and to renovate her building. In the future, she plans to open another business. Suzana thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA!
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine and to renovate her building.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase items in bulk for her shop.

loans.name: Maria Inocencia Remedios

texts.es:
Maria Inocencia es una señora que mantuvo a sus hijos  ahora ya están grandes y tienen su propia familia por lo que ella vive sola, con lo poco que ganaba pues no le alcanzaba para darle mantenimiento  a su casa. Su deseo de Maria es ampliar su casa construir un cuarto en la parte de enfrente. Anteriormente se le otorgo un préstamo el cual pagó muy bien donde puso un portón. 
Ella es una señora emprendedora que le gusta el trabajo se dedica a vender tiene una tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Maria Inocencia is an older woman who used to support her children, but now that they are older and have their own families, she lives alone. Her small income is not sufficient to allow her to do maintenance work on her house. Maria’s wish is to expand her house by building a room on the front of the house. She previously obtained a loan to build a gate and successfully paid it back. She is a take-charge woman who likes her work. She works in sales and has her own grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Construction Materials

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi A. est une femme de 45 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. elle est revendeuse de charbons de bois à Lomé depuis 5 ans. Ce commerce est très prospère à cause de la forte demande. Pour satisfaire cette demande, Afi souhaite avec ce crédit s’approvisionner en en charbon de bois. Elle compte sur cette opportunité pour réaliser ses rêves.
texts.en:
Afi A., age 45, is married and the mother of 4 children. She's been reselling charcoal in Lomé for 5 years. This business is flourishing due to high demand. To meet this demand, Afi would like to use this loan to get charcoal supplies. She counts on this opportunity to make her dreams come true.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal supplies

loans.name: Ashura

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 33 year old Ashura A. from Mwanza. She is married with three children, between the ages of 12 and 16 years old. Ashura has been running a shop since 2008. She owns a small duka, or neighborhood shop, in the city. She sells eggs, cigarettes, flour, and sleepers. She works at the business for 12 hours a day, 6 days per week.

Ashura currently earns about $250 from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400 to purchase beans, wheat flour, and cooking oil for resale. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Ashura thanks you for your support!

About SELFINA!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-Leasing. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase beans, wheat flour, and cooking oil for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy 2 hairdryers and hair extensions

loans.name: Iluminata

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 35 years old Iluminata L. from Mwanza. She is married with four children, between the ages of 4 and 11 years old. Iluminata has been running a shop selling clothes since 2006. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week, and is assisted by one employee.

Iluminata currently earns about $100 from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400 to add her capital and buy clothes for resale. In the future, she plans to open another business. Iluminata thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To add her capital and buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 50 year old Catherine N. from Mwanza. She is married with five children, between the ages of 17 and 25 years old. Catherine has been running a pharmacy business since 1986.  Catherine sells medicine to customers 12 hours a day, 6 days per week. Catherine currently earns about 120USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400USD in order to purchase additional medicine to resell to customers. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Catherine thanks you for your support!

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 30 year old Catherine K. from Mwanza. She is single with two children, between the ages of 4 and 10 years old. Catherine has been running a grains business since 2002. Catherine sells grains to different customers. She works at the business for 12 hours a day, 6 days per week. Catherine currently earns about 100USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400USD in order to purchase more grains and then sell them to customers. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Catherine thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA!

loans.use: To purchase more grains and then sell them to customers.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 23 year old Monica S. from Mwanza. She is married and has been running a timber business since 2007. Monica sells timber which is used for house construction. She works at the business for 12 hours a day, 6 days per week. Monica currently earns about 150USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400USD in order to add more timber to her business. In the future, she plans to open another business. Monica thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA!
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To add more timber to her business.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 24 years old Rosemary M. from Mwanza. She is married. Rosemary has been running a African clothing business since 2008. She has established a store that sells traditional clothing worn by Tanzanian women, called kanga and vitenge. The kanga is a piece of printed cotton fabric often with a border along all four sides. It is printed using the silkscreen method with its pattern in frames. Kitenge (the Swahili plural is vitenge) is a cotton fabric with wax print, printed by using rotary printing machines. Kitenge is a communicating textile - the various colors, patterns, writings and symbols represent moods, feelings, cultures, and traditions of native African people.

Rosemary works at the business for 12 hours per day, 5 days per week. Rosemary currently earns about 100USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400USD in order to purchase shirts, trousers and vitenge (African cloths). In the future, she plans to open another business. Rosemary thanks you for your support! ABOUT SELFINA! SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase shirts, trousers and vitenge (African cloths)

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 32 years old Zainabu G. from Mwanza. She is married with a one year old child. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependents because they are orphans. Zainabu has been running a beauty salon business since 2008.  This is the place where you can buy long hair, short hair, curly hair, straight hair, red hair, blue hair, and then have it attached to your head, woven, cut, or braided, to make to look like your own. Zainabu works at the business for 8 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by one employee. Zainabu currently earns about 130USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400USD in order to purchase dryers and to renovate her building. In the future, she plans to open another business. Zainabu thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA!
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase dryers and to renovate her building

loans.name: Wendelyn

texts.en: Wendelyn C. is a 40 year-old mother of three. Her husband Jimmy is a caretaker. She does laundry to help support the needs of the family. Her income together with her husband’s income is very limited if they hope to finance a business. She heard about ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.) from her friend.  It is an institution that helps mothers get capital to start a venture. She joined ASHI in 1999 to start a simple business and is hoping that this application will be successful so that she can buy assorted goods for her general store in order to continue its operation and to keep her regular customers.  She dreams of saving enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy assorted foods for variety store.

loans.name: María Emilia

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Managua capital de Nicaragua, la señora María F. se dedica arduamente a su actividad de venta de bebidas ubicada en una terminal de buses donde a diario se esfuerza comercializando sus bebidas.

Hoy en día la razón por la cual ella ha acudido a Ceprodel es para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de las bebidas como lo son gaseosas, jugos y aguas para comercializarlos y de esta manera salir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
In Managua, the capital of Nicaragua, Maria F. works hard at her business of selling drinks in the bus terminal where she tries hard everyday to market her beverages. Nowadays, she turns to Ceprodel in order to benefit from loans that she uses to buy drinks such as sodas, juice, and water to sell and in this way advance her business.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beverages for resale

loans.name: Vicente Manuel

texts.es: El Señor Vicente Manuel Álvarez tiene la edad de 40 años, su estado civil es soltero. Don Vicente tiene 1 hijo. La actividad económica de Don Vicente es la venta de mariscos. Hace más de 9 años que se dedica a este negocio, Don Vicente inicio este negocio por que no conseguía un trabajo y decide realizar la venta de estos productos de manera ambulante. Los propósitos de Don Vicente son de mantener activo su negocio para darles la satisfacción necesaria a sus clientes. El financiamiento esta destinado para capital de trabajo por lo que podrá comprar conchas, camarones, pescados y los productos para la presentación de su venta. Los sueños de Vicente son de establecer su un local propio y brindar un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Vicente Manuel Álvarez is 40-years old and single. He has one son. Vicente works selling seafood. He has done this for more than nine years. Vicente started his business because he couldn't find work and decided to start selling these products as a street vendor. Vicente's intentions are to keep his business growing to provide customer satisfaction. The loan funds will be used as working capital to buy shellfish, shrimp, fish and other items to sell. Vicente dreams of establishing his business in his own store and providing a better service.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ramona Raquel

texts.es:
La señora Ramona F. es una dama digna de imitar por lo que se dedica desde hace 7 años a su negocio de venta de alimentos elaborados por ella misma en su localidad.

Gracias a sus grandes esfuerzos, ella ha logrado mantener a su familia y ha mejorado sus condiciones de vida. La razón por la cual ella ha acudido a Ceprodel es para obtener un crédito para la compra de la materia prima para elaborar los alimentos y así continuar con su negocio en su respectiva localidad,
texts.en:
Ramona F. is a good role model for hard working women; she has worked for seven years in her local business of selling food she makes herself. Thanks to her hard work, she has managed to support her family and improve their quality of life. The reason she has turned to Ceprodel is to get a loan for the purchase of ingredients to make her food and thus continue her business in town.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients

loans.name: Melita

texts.en: Melita F. is a 48-year-old mother of two children. Her husband, Elvenio, is a laborer and makes furniture. To help support the family Melita buys and resells various vegetables. She applied for this loan in order to buy assorted raw materials for furniture making, such as good lumber, nails, varnish, etc. In the future Melita hopes to establish a shop from which they can fulfill orders. She also wants to be able to save for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for furniture making

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Edgar Plutarco

texts.es: El señor de Nombre Edgar Plutarco tiene la edad de 33 años, su estado civil es casado. Don Edgar tiene 1 hijo. La actividad económica de Don Edgar es la venta de mercadearía en general como pantalones, camisas, ropa interior y calzado. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio, ya que dio inicio por la necesidad de proveerle a su familia una fuente de ingresos por que no poseía un trabajo. Los propósitos de Don Edgar son de invertir cada día en su negocio para ofrecerles a sus clientes lo que ellos solicitan. El financiamiento solicitado por Edgar es destinado para capital de trabajo para realizar la compra de calzado, camisetas, faldas y cosméticos. El mayor deseo de Edgar es obtener una tienda y mantener disponible la ayuda que le brinda Fundación León 2000 y las organizaciones amigas.
texts.en:
Mr. Edgar Plutarco is 33-years-old and married. He has one child. Mr. Edgar sells general merchandise like pants, shirts, underwear, and shoes. He has worked in this field for more than ten years. He began doing this sort of work because he saw that he needed to provide for his family and didn't have a job. Mr. Edgar plans to spend each day working on his business so he can offer his clients what they ask for. The loan Edgar is requesting will be capital for his business so he can buy footwear, shirts, skirts, and cosmetics. His greatest wish is to have a store and to continue receiving the help offered him from the Leon 2000 Foundation and its sister organizations.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Josefa Esperanza

texts.es: La Señora Josefa Esperanza R. Alarcón tiene la edad de 49 años, su estado civil es soltera. Doña Josefa tiene 4 hijos y todos trabajan. La actividad económica de Doña Josefa es una pulpería. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, la ubicación del negocio es en su casa de habitación, ya que dio inicio con una pequeña venta de pollo en el mercado, mas tarde decide establecer toda la pulpería en su vivienda. Es por eso que los propósitos de Doña Josefa son de mantener a sus clientes y además proporcionarle mejoras a su negocio. Por eso solicita la ayuda de financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo y realizar la compra de granos básicos como arroz, aceite, azúcar, pan, golosinas y cosméticos. Doña Josefa desea convertir su negocio en una distribuidora para obtener los ingresos que necesarios.
texts.en:
Mrs. Josefa Esperanza R. Alarcón is 49 years old, single, with 4 children who all work. Doña Josefa has been running a local store for a living for more than 5 years. The store is located at her home. She started selling small amounts of chicken at the market and later decided to establish the store at her home. Doña Josefa´s goal is to maintain her clients as well as to make improvements to her business. Therefore she requests financial support to be used as work capital to buy basic grains such as rice, cooking oil, sugar, bread, candy, and cosmetics. Doña Josefa wishes to turn her business into a wholesale business in order to obtain the necessary income.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Gunter

texts.es: Gunter tiene 52 años de edad, es padre de tres hijos y vive con su esposa en su casa propia. Se dedica al sembrío y cultivo de frutos cítricos, pimienta, yuca, entre otras cosas; así como a la horticultura (flores y plantas medicinales) porque hay instituciones que requieren de estas y las abastece a un precio muy cómodo. En esta actividad ya lleva 32 años y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa. A Gunter le gusta mucho su trabajo porque desde siempre se ha interesado mucho por la agricultura, además que es un negocio rentable, ya que él mismo produce y vende sus productos. Para más adelante, Gunter quiere entrar en convenio con algunas instituciones para exportar sus productos a otros lugares. Con MFP tiene 2 préstamos, y le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque existe solidaridad entre sus integrantes, algo que no ha visto en otros sitios cuando ha trabajado grupalmente. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá íntegramente en la preparación de sus cultivos, abonos y fertilizantes para sus plantas.
texts.en:
Gunter is 52 years old, a father of three and lives with his wife in his own house. For a living he farms and grows citrus fruits, pepper, yuca, among others, as well as horticulture (flowers and medicine plants) as there are institutions interested in buying and he sells at a very convenient price. He has been doing this for 32 years with the support of his wife. Gunter enjoys his work as he has always been interested in farming, and it is a profitable business as well, as he himself grows and sells his products. For the future, Gunter wishes to establish an agreement with some institutions in order to export his products to other locations. With MFP he has had 2 loans and he likes to work with his communal bank as the partners are solidary, something he has not experienced with other groups he has worked with. The money requested will be invested in the preparation of his crops,and in fertilizers for his plants.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Preparation of farm land

loans.name: Kay

texts.es: Kay, de 41 años de edad, tiene 5 hijos y vive con su esposo, quien se dedica al transporte de pasajeros (chofer). Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de uno de los platos regionales más conocido de su ciudad, como es el “Juane” (arroz con pollo, aceitunas y huevo envuelto en una hoja de Bijao), este platillo lo lleva a vender por diferentes lugares de su zona de forma ambulante, y cuando llueve acondiciona un espacio fuera de su casa para vender desde ahí. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que conoce muchos lugares y a mucha gente, y así se gana la confianza de sus clientes. Su negocio le es muy rentable porque cuenta con clientes quienes esperan todas las tardes a “la vendedora de Juanes” para consumir este delicioso potaje. Kay está trabajando duro para poder tener un kiosko donde pueda vender con mayor comodidad. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y con el dinero que solicita comprará los ingredientes para preparar sus juanes (pollo, arroz, aceitunas, huevos), gastará 200 soles; con el resto adquirirá materiales e utensilios de cocina (ollas, platos, etc).
texts.en:
Kay is 41 years old, she has 5 children and lives with her husband who transports passengers for a living (chauffeur). For 3 years she has been selling one of the most popular regional dishes of her town called "Juane" (rice with chicken, olives and egg, wrapped in a "Bijao" leaf). She sells this dish at different locations as a street vendor and when it rains she sells from a space she sets up at home. What she likes about her job is that she knows many places and people, and her clients trust her. Her business is doing well as her clients await the "saleswoman of Juanes" every afternoon to eat this delicious dish. Kay is working hard to be able to acquire a stand where she can feel more comfortable. This is her first loan with MFP, and with the money she will buy ingredients for the "juanes" (chicken, rice, olives, eggs) for 200 soles and with the rest she will buy material and kitchenware (pots, plates, etc.)

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to prepare "juanes".

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es: Juana María O. tiene la edad de 41 años, su estado civil es soletera. Doña Juana tiene 2 hijos todos sus hijos estudian. La actividad económica de Doña Juana es la venta de leña y gaseosa. Hace más de 8 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que inicio por la necesidad que ella enfrentaba con sus hijos y Doña Juana no poseía un trabajo estable para y decidió comenzar en su propia vivienda. Los propósitos de Juana son de seguir adelante con su negocio ya que la situación en el país esta muy difícil. El financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima ya que se aproxima el invierno y necesita realizar la compra de leña y gaseosa. El sueño de Juana es de poseer una pulpería para incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Juana María O. is 41 years old and single. Doña Juana has 2 children who study. She sells firewood and pops for a living. She has been doing this for more than 8 years, and she began in order to meet the needs of her children, she did not have a stable job and decided to start her business at home. Juana's goal is to move ahead with her business as the situation in her country is very difficult. The loan will be used as work capital to buy raw material as winter is close and she needs to buy firewood and pops. It is Juana´s dream to own a general store in order to increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es: Mariela tiene 40 años, es madre de un hijo pequeño y vive con su esposo. Desde hace un año brinda el servicio de costura para niños y adultos, esta actividad la realiza en un espacio que implementó dentro de su casa. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es quedar bien con sus clientes y que éstos se sientan satisfechos de su buena labor. Además es un negocio rentable porque desde que comenzó cuenta con una gama de clientes que aprecian su trabajo porque es una persona que satisface sus gustos. Lo más difícil para Mariela es no contar con un taller adecuado. Con MFP ya tiene 11 préstamos, y le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque sus integrantes son puntuales, responsables y no tienen problemas dentro del grupo. Con el dinero que solicita comprará una máquina remalladora, la cual le costará 1200 soles, y  con lo sobrante adquirirá materiales textiles (telas, hilos, etc.).
texts.en:
Mariela is 40 years old, she has a young son, and lives with her husband. For a year she has been a tailor for children and adults, and she is working at a space she has set up within her house. She likes to do a good job for her clients to make them feel satisfied with her good work. It is a profitable business as her clients appreciate her work because she is a person who satisfies their taste. It is very difficult for Mariela not to have an suitable work space. With MFP she has had 11 loans and she likes to work with her communal bank as the partners are punctual, responsible, and have no problems with the group. With the requested money she will buy a special sewing machine ("remalladora") which costs 1200 soles and with the rest textile materiel (cloth, yarn, etc.)

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a sewing machine and material

loans.name: Mayte

texts.es: Mayte tiene 39 años, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos que están en edad escolar y la incentivan a seguir a delante. Desde hace 11 años vende comida en un lugar afuera de casa que implementó para su negocio, también prepara y vende panes, y adicionalmente a estas actividades cría pollos. Mayte es una mujer muy activa, y tiene planificado su tiempo para sus diversas actividades, además cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos y de su esposo. Es importante para ella dar una buena atención a sus clientes, que su comida quede bien sabrosa y criar adecuadamente a sus pollos. Lo bueno de su negocio es que tanto con la comida como con los panes obtiene ganancias diarias, con las que sostiene los gastos básicos de su familia; por otro lado, la venta de sus animales es cada 35 días que es lo que demora en estar en peso y tamaño cada pollo. Con MFP tiene 4 préstamos, y le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque existe bastante solidaridad, respeto y responsabilidad entre sus integrantes. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en forma equitativa en sus tres actividades; la preparación de comida, insumos para sus panes e incremento de la cantidad de pollos que cría y vende.
texts.en:
Mayte is 39 years old. She lives with her husband and her three school-aged children who inspire her to move forward. For the last 11 years she has sold prepared meals at a location away from her home which she established for this purpose. She also bakes and sells bread and raises poultry. Mayte is a very active woman and plans out her time for her various commercial activities though she also can count on her husband's and her children's support. It is very important to her that her meals are well prepared and tasty and that her customers are well-served as well as that her poultry is adequately cared for. What is best about her business is that both with the meals and the bread production she makes daily profits with which she is able to pay for the family's basic needs; on the other hand, the sale of her poultry happens every 35 days which is the time it takes for the chicks to mature enough to be ready for sale. She has four loans with MFP and likes working with her communal bank because of the support, respect and responsibility that exists among its members. The money she asks for now will be divided equally among her three activities: food preparation, raw materials for her baked goods, and an increase in the number of chicks she raises and sells.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in her three businesses.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es: Miriam de 49 años, vive junto a su esposo y su única hija en casa propia. Se dedica a la venta de artículos de ferretería (pintura, clavos, lijas, etc) en forma ambulatoria, llevando a vender sus productos por los diferentes lugares de su zona. En esta labor lleva un periodo de 2 años y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien se encarga de movilizarla en su motocarro. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que conoce muchos lugares y se relaciona con varias personas, quienes se ganaron su confianza y ahora son sus clientes regulares, además le es rentable porque sus productos tienen mucha demanda y se venden muy fácilmente, porque bien son comprados al contado o cambiados por alimentos o animales que valoricen el monto. Para el futuro, Miriam desea tener un local para instalar una ferretería con todo lo necesario. Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP, y le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque sus compañeros de grupo son unidos y respetuosos. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de más materiales de ferretería para aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Miriam is 49 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and only daughter. She sells hardware (paint, nails, files, etc) from door to door in the various places in her zone. She has been doing this for the past 2 years with the help of her husband who drives her from place to place. What she likes about her job is that she gets to know many places and meet a lot of people who trust her and become her regular clientele. Additionally, her business is profitable because her products are in high demand and they sell easily at good prices either for cash or in exchange for food or animals with the same value. For the future, Miriam would like to have a well-stocked store from which to sell her hardware. This is her third loan with MFP and she likes to work with her comunal bank because the members of her group are united and respectful. The money she is asking for on this occasion is to buy more inventory to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora María del Carmen Velazquez tiene la edad de 56 años, su estado civil es soltera. Doña María tiene 6 hijos y todos trabajan de manera independiente. La actividad económica de María es un cafetín. Hace mas de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio por lo que, ya que cuando dio inicio fue con pocos productos como golosinas y refrescos naturales y con la ayuda de los financiamientos es que ha crecido. El propósito de María para su negocio es de crecer con su negocio para establecer otro cafetín. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo y así invertir en productos para su cafetín como gaseosas, golosinas, frutas naturales, postres, desayunos y almuerzos.  El deseo de Doña María es conseguir otro local para establecer otro cafetín y así sobresalir y ofrecer los mejores servicios.
texts.en:
Maria del Carmen Velazquez is 56 years old, single, and the mother of 6 children, all of whom work independently. Her economic activity consists of a small cafe. She has managed her cafe for the past 10 years. When she started, it was with just a few items such as snacks and fresh juices but, with the help of her loans, her business has grown. What Maria would like now is to expand her business by opening a second cafe. The financing she is requesting at this time is start-up funds to invest in such items as soft drinks, snacks, fruit, deserts, breakfast and lunch items for her second cafe. Her wish is to acquire another locale to establish her new cafe thereby excelling and offering better service to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Start-up capital.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Leydi Maria

texts.es: Leydi María Palacios C. tiene la edad de 30 años, su estado civil es casada. Doña Leydi tiene 2 hijos. La actividad económica de Leydi es una pulpería. Hace mas de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio, Leydi inicio este negocio con la idea de sustentar a su familia, la ubicación de su negocio es en su vivienda. Sus propósitos son de contribuir a la mejora de su negocio y además colocar más vitrinas para presentar los productos. Y es así que solicita apoyo por medio de Fundación León 2000 que será utilizado para la compra de cosméticos, granos básicos y golosinas. El sueño de Leydi es mantener su negocio ya que este el único medio de supervivencia que posee.
texts.en:
Leydi Maria Palacios C. is 30 years old, married, and has two children. Her economic activity consists of a small grocery store. She has operated the store from her home for the past 4 years in order to generate funds to help support her family. She wants to improve her business and install more display cabinets to showcase her products. This is why she is asking for funds from the Fundacion Leon 2000 which will be used to buy cosmetics, basic grains and snacks. Leydi's dream is to see her business grow since it is her only means of support.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase inventory and install display cabinets.

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es: El señor Jorge Luís B. López , tiene la edad de 28 años , habita en las pilas Oriental ubicado en la cuidad de Masaya , junto a su esposa la cual trabaja para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar , ellos tiene a su cargo dos hijos , un varón de 16 años que estudia y trabaja y una adolescente de 12 años que solo estudia ; los planes hacia su familia es apoyarle a sus hijos para que puedan realizar una carrera profesional , don Jorge desde hace ocho años trabaja como agricultor , la mayor dificultad que se le presentan son las plagas , el inicio su actividad con sus propios esfuerzos y la oportunidad que le brindo nuestra institución para que logre una mejor producción . Con este segundo financiamiento lo va a invertir en la compra de fertilizantes e insumos para poder obtener una buena cosecha y vender a buen precio en el mercado.
texts.en:
Mr. Jorge Luis B. L. is 28 years old and lives in Pilas Oriental in the city of Masaya. Together with his wife, who works to help pay household expenses, they have two children, a 16-year-old boy who studies and works and a 12-year-old girl who is a full-time student. His goals for his children is to support them so that they may complete their studies leading to professional careers. Mr. B. has worked as a farmer for the past 8 years. The greatest obstacle for him are pests. He began his work with his own efforts and the help which our organization was able to offer led to better production. With this second loan he will invest in the purchase of fertilizers and raw materials to get a better harvest which he will be able to sell at a better market price.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase raw materials and fertilizers.

loans.name: Francisco Jose

texts.es: El señor Francisco V., tiene la edad de 67 años, habita en la comunidad el Edén, es soltero, tiene tres hijos dos de ellos son casados, el tiene a su cargo un varón de 15 años, el cual le apoya con los trabajos agrícolas, los planes hacia su familia darle a cada uno de sus hijos donde puedan hacer su casa, don Francisco desde hace cincuenta años trabaja como agricultor la mayor dificulta es la falta de agua , ya que la zona donde habita llega muy poco , el inicio la actividad agrícola , con el apoyo de sus padres , el financiamiento lo va a invertir en la compra de fertilizantes e insumos para mejorar el cultivo y obtener una buena producción.
texts.en:
Mr. Francisco V. is 67-years-old and lives in Edén. He is single and has three children, two of whom are married. He supports his fifteen-year-old son with agricultural jobs. He plans to give each of his children a place where they can build a home. Mr. Francisco has worked as a farmer for fifty years. The most difficult part is the lack of water since the area he lives in doesn’t get much water. He began his career in agriculture with support from his parents. He plans to invest the loan money in buying fertilizers and agricultural supplies to improve his crops and yield a better output.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar insumos agricolas para mejorar el cultivo

loans.name: Danelia Argentina

texts.es:
La señora Danelia G. con mucha dedicación trabaja en su actividad de costurera en su propia casa de habitación en el departamento de Masaya atendiendo todos los días muy amablemente a todos sus clientes.

Con gran esfuerzo busca la manera de salir adelante en su servicio de costurera y es por eso que ha logrado acudir a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de tela para continuar en su actividad y de esta forma mejorar las condiciones de su negocio que tanto le ha costado desarrollar en su localidad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Danelia G. works diligently as a seamstress in her own house, in the department of Masaya, happily attending to her customers every day.

With great effort, she is looking for a way to get ahead in her tailoring business, and this is the reason she has come to Ceprodel, to ask for a loan to buy thread so she can continue her work, and in this way improve her business, which she has invested so much time in developing in her neighborhood.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of thread

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
En el departamento de Masaya el caballero Juan G. se dedica a su actividad de elaboración y venta de artesanías elaborados por él mismo en su propia casa de habitación donde luego las comercializa a los clientes siendo este negocio el sustento de su hogar.

La razón por la cual hoy en día el señor Juan acude a Ceprodel es para ser beneficiado con un crédito para la compra de barro y leña para continuar elaborando las bellas artesanías típicas de Nicaragua y así continuar manteniendo a su familia.
texts.en:
In the Department of Masaya, this young gentleman, Juan G., carries out his work making and selling handicrafts. They are decorated by him in his own house where he later sells them to his customers. This is how he supports his household. The reason why Juan has approached CEPRODEL is in order to benefit from a loan for the purchase of clay and firewood. Then he can continue producing these beautiful handmade goods which are typical of Nicaragua, and in this way continue supporting his family.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clay & firewood

loans.name: Juana Epifania

texts.es:
Juana Epifania Solórzano se dedica a su negocio de venta de bebidas en su casa de habitación en la ciudad de Masaya donde tiene 6 años de dedicarse a este negocio. Es de importancia destacar que a raíz de muchos esfuerzos ha logrado establecer su negocio y mejorar las condiciones ya que ahora no solamente vende bebidas sino también alimentos.

Ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener un crédito para la compra de las bebidas y por este motivo espera con mucha certeza sabiendo que su crédito será otorgado y saldrá adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
For the past six years, Juana Epifania Solórzano has had this business selling beverages out of her home in the city of Masaya. She sells not just drinks but also food. It is important to emphasize that as a result of her great efforts she has succeeded in establishing her business and improving her circumstances. She is looking to CEPRODEL for support through a loan for the purchase of beverages, and accordingly, she most certainly hopes to hear that her loan has been approved and that she will be able to move forward with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beverages

loans.name: Karla Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Karla A. es una persona digna de imitar porque ha logrado salir adelante en su negocio de pulpería que ha logrado suplir en el departamento de Masaya. Ella es una dama muy trabajadora que a pesar de las circunstancias difíciles que ha atravesado siempre ha salido adelante.

Hoy en día ella espera en Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de la mercadería y por este motivo confía en que su crédito será otorgado y así adquirirá los productos a lo inmediato para comercializarlos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Karla Aragon is a decent and good person because she has managed to succeed in her grocery store business in the department of Masaya (Nicaragua). She is a hard-working lady who, despite the difficult circumstances she has experienced, has always succeeded in pushing ahead. These days she hopes to get credit from Ceprodel for the purchase of goods. Mrs. Aragon is confident that your credit will be awarded to her, so that she can immediately acquire the products and bring them to market.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Luis L. se dedica a su actividad de venta de elaboración y venta de calzados de todo tipo teniendo su taller de calzados en su casa de habitación en Masaya.

Actualmente el señor Luis posee cinco máquinas de trabajar y esto lo ha adquirido gracias a sus múltiples esfuerzos que lo han llevado a ser una persona destacada ya que elabora calzados muy finos. La razón por la cual él espera en Ceprodel es para que se le apruebe un crédito para la compra de materiales de trabajo como el cuero para continuar en su negocio que tanto requiere de inversión para continuar.
texts.en:
Mr. Luis L. makes and sells all types of footwear. His footwear shop is in his house in Masaya. Luis has five machines for work. He acquired these through his great effort, which has led him to be an outstanding maker of fine footwear. He is hoping for approval for a loan from Ceprodel. He will buy work materials like leather to continue with his business, which really needs the investment in order to continue.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy work material

loans.name: Manuel Salvador

texts.es:
En el departamento de Masaya el señor Manuel D. dedica su tiempo a su negocio de venta de ropa de todo tipo y todo tamaño tanto para niños, damas y caballeros realizando esta labor todos los días donde es visitado por sus clientes para adquirir la ropa. 

Actualmente la situación que él atraviesa es que se le está agotando la ropa para comercializarla y para ello requiere comprarla a sus proveedores para así continuar en su negocio que tanto requiere de inversión para salir adelante. Con este crédito se beneficia tanto él como su amada familia a la que tiene que mantener.
texts.en:
In the province of Masaya, Manuel D. devotes his time to his business selling clothes of all types and sizes, for children, women and men. He works every day, and is visited by customers who are buying clothing. Currently, he is running out of clothing to sell and needs to buy more from his suppliers to be able to continue his business, which requires a lot of investment to move forward. This loan will benefit him and his beloved family, who he supports with his work.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing to sell

loans.name: Reyna Luz

texts.es:
La señora Reyna R. se dedica a su negocio de venta de ropa en la ciudad de Masaya donde oferta todo tipo de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños y además vende cobertores y sabanas para camas.

Hoy en día ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de la ropa ya que hoy en día se le ha agotado y requiere prontamente adquirirla para comercializarla. Actualmente ella se ha destacado como fiel cliente de Ceprodel siendo su record crediticio de 3 créditos habiendo sido cancelados en tiempo y forma en la institución.
texts.en:
Mrs. Reyna R.'s business sells clothing in the city of Masaya, where she supplies all types of clothing for women, men and children, also selling blankets and bed sheets.

Today she has gone to Ceprodel to request a loan so she can buy clothing no longer in stock, which she must purchase soon in order to market it. Currently she stands out as a faithful customer of Ceprodel, following her credit record of 3 loans having been repaid on time and within the institution.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing

loans.name: Yadira Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Yadira B. es una dama muy trabajadora que ha logrado establecer su propia tiendita de ropa y productos de pulpería atendida por ella misma en el departamento de Masaya donde se dedica a dicha actividad.

Hoy en día el motive por el cual la señora Yadira ha acudido a Ceprodel es porque se le ha agotado su mercadería y requiere adquirir de sus proveedores los productos de la tiendita y es por esto que ha solicitado un crédito para la compra de dichos productos y así continuar en su negocio en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Ms. Yadira B. is very hard-working lady who has managed to set up her own little clothing boutique and general store, which she herself minds, in the department of Masaya.

The reason for which Yadira is now turning to Ceprodel for help is that she is running out of merchandise, so she needs to purchase some products from her suppliers. She is requesting this loan so that she can buy more goods and stay in business in her community.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Juana Jeyling

texts.es: Juana Jeyling vive en la colonia San Pablo a 40 km de Nueva Guinea, trabaja como docente en la Escuela Divino Redentor desde hace 7 años, es madre soltera, tiene una niña de 2 añitos de edad, y no cuenta con la ayuda del papá de su hija,  vive con su mamá quien le ayuda a cuidar a su bebita cuando ella va a trabajar, está solicitando  su 3er financiamiento para invertirlo en el repello de una habitación y ponerle el piso, esta cliente se ha destacado por ser responsable, honesta, trabajadora y muy querida por sus alumnos, ella comparte los gastos familiares del hogar con su mamá, aunque son una familia pobre son muy unidos, el mayor sueño de Juana es poco a poco ir mejorando su vivienda,  tener estabilidad laboral, salud y finalizar la licenciatura que actualmente esta estudiando para brindarle mejores condiciones de vida a su hija que es su razon de vivir.
texts.en:
Juana Jeyling lives in the San Pablo neighborhood 40 km away from Nueva Guinea. She has worked as a teacher at the Divine Redeemer School for the past 7 years. She is a single mother, has a girl who is 2 years old and does not have the help of her daughter's father. She lives with her mother who helps her to care for her baby when she goes to work. She is applying for her 3rd loan to invest it the titles for the flooring of a room. This client stands out for being very responsible, honest, hard working and loved by her students. She shares the household expenses with her mother. Although they are a poor family they are very united. Juana’s greatest dream is to improve her house little by little, have job stability, health and finish the degree for which she is currently studying to provide better living conditions for her daughter who is her reason for living.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To tile the floor of a room

loans.name: Magda Isabel

texts.es: Magda Isabel es  casada, tiene 2 hijos: el mayor tiene 18 años estudia su 2do año en la universidad y la niña  de 11 años estudia su 6to grado de educacion primaria, su esposo trabaja en un negocio propio como es una vidrieria, ambos comparten los gastos familiares pues son una familia muy unida, viven en la zona # 4 de Nueva Guinea, trabaja como administradora de la univerisdad URACCAN desde hace 11 años, esta solicitando su 4to crédito a la institución de AFODENIC, para invertirlo en la construccion de una habitacion y de esta forma mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.  Magda se caracteriza por ser muy responsable, honesta y ha demostrado buena conducta en la sociedad, ella es muy querida por sus compañeros de trabajo, su sueño es tener salud, estabilidad laboral y que sus dos hijos estudien para que lleguen hacer  personas de bien.
texts.en:
Magda Isabel is a married mother of two. Her eldest is an 18-year-old who is in his second year of college, and her daughter is an 11-year-old sixth grader. Her husband has his own glass business. Both she and her husband share the household expenses because they are a very close-knit family. They live in Zone #4 in Nueva Guinea. She has been working as an administrator at URACCAN University for 11 years. She is requesting her 4th loan from AFODENIC so that she can invest the money in building a room in her house, thus improving her family’s living conditions. Magda is known to be very responsible and honest. She has demonstrated good behavior in society, and is very well-loved by her co-workers. Her dream is to have health and job stability. She also wants her two children to study so that they can grow up to be decent people.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construct a room

loans.name: Magdali

texts.es: Magdali trabaja como docente en la Escuela Diriangen  desde hace 3 años, es madre soltera, tiene una hija de 2 años de edad, el papá de su hija le pasa una pensión alimenticia, está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 3er crédito para invertirlo en la construccion de una habitacion.
