Magdali se caracteriza por ser una joven honesta y muy trabajadora, actualmente está estudiando  su 3er año en la Universidad URACCAN, vive en la colonia San Antonio a unos 25 km de Nueva Guinea, todos los dias ella tiene que madrugar a las cuatro de la mañana para dejar hechos los quehaceres del hogar y viajar a caballo a una hora de camino a la comarca San Ramon a impartir el pan de la enseñanza a niños campesinos, su sueño es terminar de construir su vivienda y así gozar de mejores condiciones, que a su hijita no le falte nada  y tener estabilidad laboral.
texts.en:
Magdali has worked as a teacher at the Diriangen School for the last 3 years. She is a single mother, has a daughter who is 2 years of age and her daughter's father provides child support. She is applying for refinancing of her third loan to invest in the construction of a room. Magdali is a young and hard working women and she is currently in her third year of studies at the URACCAN University. She lives in the San Antonio neighborhood 25 km away from Nueva Guinea. Everyday she has to get up early at 4:00 a.m. to leave the household chores done and travel an hour on horseback to the San Ramon region to teach rural children. She dreams are to finish building her home and enjoy better conditions, that her daughter has everything she needs and to have job stability.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a room

loans.name: Mireya Del Socorro

texts.es: Mireya esta solicitando  su 4to refinanciamiento para invertirlo en  mejora de su vivienda como es Compra de zinc y perlines para cambiarle el techo a la casa antes que llegue el invierno, trabaja comos delegada del INSS en nueva Guinea desde hace 2 años, esta clienta tiene dos hijos el Mayor de 20 años estudia su segundo año en la universidad URACCAN y el  menor de 17 años estudia su 5to año de educacion secundaria, su esposo tambien trabaja como tecnico en la planta procesadora de frutas, tambien trabaja en los dias libres en finca que ellos tienen, ambos comparten con los gastos familiares y con los compromisos adquiridos. Mireya es una mujer que  inició a laborar desde temprana edad ya que su familia era de escasos recursos económicos,  desempeña su labor con mucha responsabilidad, expresa  se siente feliz  con su trabajo pues ayuda a su familia con lo que ella puede,  posee un alto espiritud de superación personal, su sueño es poco a poco ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida y que a sus familia no le falte nada.
texts.en:
Mireya is requesting her fourth loan to invest in making improvements to her home, including replacing the roof with new zinc paneling and beams before the winter rains arrive. For two years, Mireya has worked as a delegate at the Nicaraguan Social Security Institute, and she is the mother of two children. Her eldest child is 20 years old and a sophomore at URACCAN (the University of the Regions of the Caribbean Coast of Nicaragua), and her 17-year-old is in the fifth year of secondary school. Her husband works as a technician in a fruit processing plant and spends his free time working at their family farm. They both share responsibility for household expenses and financial obligations.

Mireya is a woman who began working when she was very young, since her family had few financial resources. She carries out her work in a very responsible manner, and feels happy to be able to help her family however she can. She is highly motivated to get ahead, and her dream is to little by little improve her standard of living so that her family wants for nothing.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of zinc and beams to replace roof

loans.name: Pedro Jacinto

texts.es: Pedro Jacinto es casado,  tiene dos hijos  el mayor de  12 años estudia su 5to grado y la niña de 10 añitos estudia 4to grado, su esposa se encarga de los quehaceres del hogar, trabaja como tecnico del Ministerio de Educacion desde hace 15 años, con los créditos anteriores ha ido poco a poco mejorando su vivienda, ahora está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 8vo crédito para seguir mejorando su vivienda, pues quiere hecharle el piso a su casa. Pedro Jacinto el año pasado termino su licenciatura en ciencias de la Educacion en la universidad Uraccan Recinto Nueva Guinea,  pero no solo se dedica a enseñar sino que tambien es un hombre que trabaja en su tiempo libre cultivando la tierra en la parcela de la familia Sembrando diversos cultivos para asi mejorar las condiciones de vida  de su familia;  cabe mencionar que Pedro inicio trabajando para un proyecto de la iglesia catolica de manera voluntaria en una comarca a 3 horas de camino montado a caballo y así fue como adquirio una plaza pagada por el estado, este docente ayudo a su comunidad llevando el pan de la enseñanza a los niños campesinos de esa comarca,su sueño es tener una vivienda digna para su hijos y salud.
texts.en:
Pedro Jacinto is married and has two children. His son is 12 years old and in fifth grade, while is 10-year-old daughter is in fourth. His wife is a homemaker. Pedro has worked for fifteen years as a technician at the Ministry of Education. Last year, he completed a graduate degree in Education Sciences at the Nueva Guinea campus of URACCAN (the University of the Regions of the Caribbean Coast of Nicaragua). Pedro not only teaches, but is also a man who spends his free time working his family's plot of land. He plants a variety of crops to help improve his family's living conditions. It is worth mentioning that Pedro began working as a volunteer in a program organized by the Catholic Church in a region three hours away by horse, and that is how he got a position paid by the government. He helped his community by bringing the fruit of knowledge to the children of this remote village.

This is Pedro's eighth loan. He invested previous loans in making improvements to his home, and he will use this loan to install flooring.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install flooring in his home

loans.name: Yamilex Del Socorro

texts.es: La Joven Yamilex es soltera,  trabaja como responsable de recursos humanos en la universidad URACCAN desde hace 3 años, tiene 1 hijo de 8 añitos de edad que estudia 3er grado de educacion  primaria, y a pesar que no cuenta con la ayuda del papa de su hijo a luchado para que no le falte nada, está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 7mo crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda como es cambiarle las puertas a la casa y heharle el piso a una habitacion, Yamilex es una joven  con alto espiritu de superación personal, muy responsable, vive con sus padres y asume los gastos familiares, ya que son una familia de escasos recursos economicos, su sueño  es  terminar de estudiar una maestria, tener estabilidad laboral, salud  y una vivienda con mejores condiciones para su hijo y sus padres.
texts.en:
Young Yamilex is single and for three years has worked in human resources at URACCAN (the University of the Regions of the Caribbean Coast of Nicaragua). She has an 8-year-old son who is in third grade, and despite not being able to count on the boy's father for support, she has struggled so that her son does not want for anything.

Yamilex is requesting her seventh loan to invest in making improvements to her home, including replacing the house's doors and installing flooring in a bedroom.

Yamilex is a young woman with a great desire to get ahead. She is very responsible, lives with her parents, and, as her family has very few financial resources, has assumed responsibility for all of the family's expenses. Her dream is to finish her Master's degree. She also wants to have stable employment, good health, and better living conditions for her son and her parents.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Replace doors and install flooring in her home

loans.name: Mardamkul

texts.ru: Мардамкул - мужчина 47 лет. Разведенный. Живет с одной дочкой. Мардамкул занимается откормом и продажей крупнорогатого и мелко рогатого скота.  Он закупает скот на рынке и откармливая 2-3 месяца продает на том же рынке. Дочка занимается переработкой шерсти скота и продает ее на рынке, и еще помогает по хозяйству дома. Этим она помогает отцу, чтобы их семейный бюджет улучшился. Мардамкул в свою очередь хочет увеличить количество своего скота.
texts.en:
Mardamkul is a 47-year-old man. He is divorced, and lives with his daughter. Mardamkul raises and sells large- and small-horned cattle. He purchases cattle at the market, fattens them for two to three months, and sells them again at the same market. His daughter processes the wool, sells it at the market, and additionally helps out on the farm. She assists her father in order to help the family financially. Mardamkul, in turn, would like to increase the size of his herd.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Откорм и продажа скота

loans.name: Duong

texts.en:
Duong P. is a 36-year-old female living in the town of Nam Dịnh. She is married and has three school-aged children. To making a living, Duong runs a local shop where she sells several products to local businesses and community members, who are also the main source of revenue for her business. Duong has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3500,000 VND a month.

In 1999, Duong joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Duong has successfully repaid her previous loans from TYM Fund. Duong is now requesting a new loan of 10000,000 VND to renovate her business. This loan will be her 10th loan from TYM Fund. Duong plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About TYM Fund:
The mission of TYM Fund is to improve the quality and life of poor Vietnamese women in rural areas by providing credit and savings to groups of fund members to enhance their participation and role in society.

loans.use: To improve her business

loans.name: Mirzoali

texts.ru: Мирзоали Нурбеков 1978 года рождения. Имеет высшее неоконченное образование. Учиться на экономиста, параллельно занимается разведением скота. Для покупки скота потребовалась необходимая сумма. Для этого обратился в Микроинвест. Узнал об условии кредитовании и получил кредит. Сейчас купил несколько голов скота, расширил свой коровник.Вскоре, в мае он будет стричь коз, половину продаст и несколько килограмм оставит для продажи через пол года.
texts.en:
Mirzoali N. was born in 1946, he is married and has 7 children. He does not have a college education. He does not have a job, but he raises livestock. In order to purchase livestock he needed a sum of money. He turned to MicroInvest for this. Mirzoali found out about the loan terms and received credit. Now he purchased several heads of livestock and expanded his shed. Soon, in May, he will shave his goats, selling half of the wool and keeping half to sell in half a year.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase livestock

loans.name: Aminjon

texts.ru: Аминджон Мирюсупов – молодой мужчина 33 лет. Женат и отец 3-х детей. Жена домохозяйка, нянчит своих маленьких детишек. Аминджон как глава семьи работает и зарабатывает деньги. Он водит маршрутное такси по маршруту Худжанд – Гафуров. Он работает по графику: 2 дня работает, 1 день отдыхает. В рабочие дни он старается максимально заработать деньги, и работает с раннего утра до поздней ночи. В выходной день он ремонтирует свою машину. Займ он хотел бы использовать на ремонт своего такси.
texts.en:
Aminjon M. is a young man, 33 years of age. He is married and the father of 3 children. His wife stays at home to care for their young children. Aminjon, as the head of the household, works and makes a living as a minibus driver between Khudzhand and Gafurov. The work schedule is two days of work, one day off. On work days he tries to earn as much as possible; he works from early in the morning to late at night. On days off he repairs and remodels his vehicle. He would like to use a loan for repairing the minibus.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Minibus repairs

loans.name: Menikul

texts.ru: Меникул Нурбеков 1955 года рождения, женат имеет 5 детей. Высшего образования  не имеет. Работает лесником в лесном хозяйстве. Ухаживает за деревьями вовремя поливает и занимается другими делами. Сам он содержит дома скот. Сейчас его скот находиться  на пастбище в горах. Они возвращаются к вечеру, потому что пока есть трава во круг, года кончиться трава, пастух их будет уводить все дальше и дальше. Кредит получил для расширение поголовье скота.
texts.en:
Menikul N., born in 1955, is married and has five children. He has no higher education. He works as a forester in forest management. He cares for the trees, irrigating at the right times and doing other tasks. He also raises his own livestock at home. The animals are currently on pasture in the mountains. They return in the evening since there is still grass nearby. When that grass is gone the herder will lead them farther and farther away. The loan is for expanding his herd.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expanding livestock herd

loans.name: Muhayo

texts.ru: Мухайё женщина , которая кредитуется уже третий год. Она занимается продажей детской одежды.Товар завозит с Истаравшана.Её оборотный капитал с каждым займом увеличивается , а также и уровень жизни семьи улучшается.Она в сезон привозит нужный товар.Поэтому следующий займ она хочет потратить для завоза весенне-летнего ассортимента детской одежды.
texts.en:
Muhayo has been a borrower for three years. She sells children's clothing. The goods are transported from Istaravshan. Her turnover capital increases with each loan, and her family's quality of life improves. She buys the goods needed for each season, so she wants to use this next loan on the spring and summer inventory of children's clothing.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Children's clothing sales

loans.name: Thảo

texts.en:
Thảo B. is a 39 year-old female living in the town of Nam Định.  She is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To making a living, Thảo and her husband are running a successful family business which is specialized in producing window gratings.  The  main source of income for the business comes primarily from manufacturing & selling these grilles to local businesses and community members.  Thảo has been engaged in this business for over 8 years and earns approximately 4200000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2002, Thảo joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Thảo has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to invest in renovating the business.  Thảo is now requesting a new loan of 10000000 VND which will be used to invest in renovating the business.  The loan will be the 8th loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund.  Thảo plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business.


About TYM Fund:

The mission of TYM Fund is to improve the quality of life of poor Vietnamese women in rural areas by providing credit and savings to groups of fund members to enhance their participation & role in society.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Rehema J.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 30 year old Rehema S. from Mbeya. She is single with no children.
Rehema has been running a clothes shop since 2008. She owns a shop in the city where she sells various types of new clothes. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week. Rehema currently earns about 80USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 375USD in order to purchase more clothes in bulk. In the future, she plans to open a new business. Rehema thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes in bulk

loans.name: Munavvar

texts.ru: Мунавара Турабаева 1964 года рождения, замужем, имеет 3 детей. Высшего образования не имеет. Она во дворе содержит коров и овец. Ей нравиться ухаживать за скотом.  Мунаввар  рано утром встает кормит своих коров , гладит  и доит одну потом другую. Отправляет дочку по селу продавать молоко и другие молочные изделия. Если молока много, она сама идет в город продавать мороженным цехам. Кредит получила на прикупку еще одной коровы.
texts.en:
Munavvar T. was born in 1964; she is married and has 3 children. She does not have a college education. She keeps cows and sheep in her yard. Munavvar likes to take care of livestock. Munavvar feeds her cows early in the morning, pets them and milks them one at a time. She then sends her daughter around the village to sell milk and other dairy products. If there is a lot of milk she travels herself to the city to sell it to freezing plants. She received a loan to purchase another cow.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a cow

loans.name: Rose J.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 28 year old Rose M. from Mbeya. She is single with no  children, but she is responsible for supporting two dependants because they are orphans. 

Rose has been running a vitenge and clothing sale business since 2008. She sells traditional clothing worn by Tanzanian women, called kanga and vitenge. The kanga is a piece of printed cotton fabric often with a border along all four sides. It is printed using the silkscreen method with its pattern in frames. Kitenge (the Swahili plural is vitenge) is a cotton fabric with wax print, printed by using rotary printing machines. Kitenge is a communicating textile - the various colors, patterns, writings and symbols represent moods, feelings, cultures, and traditions of native African people.

She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week. Rose currently earns about 90USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 250 USD in order to purchase more vitenge in bulk. In the future, she plans to open a new business. Rose thanks you for your support!


ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more vitenge in bulk

loans.name: Rusia M.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 22-year-old Rusia J. from Kyela. She is married with one child, age 8. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependents because their parents died of HIV.  Rusia has been running a cocoa business since 2008. She buys cocoa from farmers and sells them in town for a higher price. She works at the business for 9 - 12 hours per day, 6 days per week. Rusia currently earns about 120 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400 USD in order to purchase more cocoa in bulk. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity and the range of her business. Rusia thanks you for your support!
ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more cocoa in bulk

loans.name: Makerita

texts.en:
Makerita P., 36, is married with 5 children.  She has 5 years of experience in the sewing business. She sells to the general public 5 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD.  
She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~125 USD).  SPBD loans are Makerita’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Buy  second-hand sewing machine, rolls of materials, and sewing equipment and tools such as needles, threads etc

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria Y., 62, is married with 1 child. She has many years of experience in running a general store. She sells to the general public 7 days per week. She has no previous loan with SPBD.

She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD). SPBD loans are Maria’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Buy frozen foods, tinned foods, sugar, flour, salt, rice, onions, diapers, toilet papers, soap and other stock for her shop

loans.name: Faapepele

texts.en:
Faapepele L., 25, is married with 2 children. She has 1 year of experience in the BBQ business. She sells to the general public three days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD.

She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~125 USD). SPBD loans are Faapepele’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Buy chicken thighs, sausages, sauce, onions, foam plates, forks and spoons, tissues

loans.name: Temukisa

texts.en:
Temukisa P., 17, is married with one child. She has one year of experience in the BBQ business. She sells to the general public three days per week. She has one previous loan with SPBD.

She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~125 USD). SPBD loans are Temukisa’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Buy chicken thighs, sausages, sauce, onions, foam plates, forks and spoons, tissues.

loans.name: Sekela S.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 35-year-old Sekela M. from Kyela. She is single with one child, age 12. Sekela has been running a crops-selling business since 2001. A typical maize business is a stand on the side of the road where maize is often piled high in baskets.  Customers can scrutinize the quality of the product before purchase and specify the exact amount they would like to purchase. Maize is very important to the Tanzanian culture as maize is used to make one of their staple dishes, ugali. Ugali is made solely of maize flour and water.
She works at the business for 9 - 12 hours per day, 6 days per week. Sekela currently earns about 130USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400 USD in order to purchase more beans in bulk. In the future, she plans to establish another business. Sekela thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more beans in bulk

loans.name: Saumama

texts.en: Saumama P., 46 and married with four children, has one year of experience in the elei printing business, selling to the villagers and the general public two days per week. She has had one previous loan with SPBD, and she expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala ($187).  SPBD loans are Saumama’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase fabric materials, paints, brushes, elei boards, etc.

loans.name: Salote

texts.en: Salote E., 31, is married with two children. She has one year of experience in the elei printing business (a style of cloth printing which is unique to Samoa and is used in much of Samoan clothing). She sells to the villagers and the general public two days per week. She has one previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (approximately 155 USD). SPBD loans are Salote’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase cotton materials, paints, brushes, elei board, etc.

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en:
Visitacion is in the business of buying and selling fruits and vegetables in her village.  She wakes up early every morning to buy vegetables in the market and then sell in her village at retail price.  She wants to buy more goods to have an increase in income.  With this, she is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000.00 as her additional capital.  She is hoping that her request will be granted to help her business grow.

She is married to Roberto and they were gifted with five children: Joji, 30 years old; Pampi, 27 years old; Kenneth Ian, 25 years old; Roberto Jr., 22 years old and Nińo, 20 years old. Her children are all high school graduates.  She is very thankful to God for having good health and strength to go on with their livelihood.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes P. has a sari-sari store beside her house. She is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 because she needs additional capital. She plans to use the capital to purchase groceries and improve her business. She has been operating her store for more than four years and she aims for business progress. She dreams of becoming successful someday so that she can continue to send her daughter to school. She is doing her very best to be more productive. All her sacrifices are for her children and family.

Mercedes is 52 years old and married to Juanito and they live peacefully in the village of Rizal Quirino, Isabela. They have six children: Virgie is a 34 year old high school graduate who works as a domestic helper in Lebanon; Auria is 32 years old and a high school undergraduate; Rizaldy is 29 years old and a elementary undergraduate; Rubentor is 26 years old and is also an elementary undergraduate; Rolando is 25 years old and a high school undergraduate; and Roseben is an 18 year old college student. Mercedes is thankful because her children are helping financially to send their youngest daughter to school.

loans.use: To purchase groceries for her store.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita manages a small store in her village in which she offers vegetables, fish, and pork. She wans to expand her business so she can provide for the daily needs of her family. For this purpose, she is requesting a loan of PHP 9,000 that she will use as additional business capital. Because all her children already have their own families and earn their own money, she hopes that she can now save something that she and her husband can use when they get old. She believes that she must do her part to succeed, and God will do the rest.

Angelita is 56 years old and married to Danilo. They live in Barangay San Juan, Quirino, Isabela. The couple was blessed with five children: Perlita is a 37 year old high school graduate; Johndan is a 36 year old high school undergraduate and operates his own passenger tricycle in their village; Teddy is a 34 year old high school undergraduate and works in Kuwait as a factory worker; Daniel is a 32 year old graduate of B.S. Theology and preaches the words of God; and the youngest is Gelda, who is 27 years old and teaches in Camaal, Quirino, Isabela. Angelita is thankful to have a peaceful family. She hopes that her family will always be healthy and prays that they may live long. She is trying to strive harder in her business in order to experience a better way of life.

loans.use: To invest in her small grocery store.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita P. has a business raising hogs. Through her simple business, she is able to help her husband provide for the needs of her family and send their youngest child to school. She doesn't depend too much on the remittances her husband, who is working abroad, sends home. To further expand her business, Merlita is requesting a loan of PHP 12,000 that she will use as additional business capital. She hopes that someday she can generate a bigger income and become successful to better provide for her family.

Merlita is 50 years old and her husband Victoriano is working as a domestic helper abroad. They live a simple life in Barangay Rizal, Quirino, Isabela. They have six children: Mary Jane is 31, Marivic is 29, Marites is 27, Noverly is 25, Erwin is 23, and the youngest is Maria Teresa, a 13 year old high school student. Merlita prays that her youngest daughter will finish her high school and college education.

loans.use: To invest in her business raising pigs.

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.en:
Lucrecia S. has already been a widow for eight years. She served as the mother and father to her three children. Her oldest Marlon is a 24 year old a high school graduate, Francisco is a 22 year old college graduate who works in a food chain, and the youngest is Wilma. Wilma is 18 years old and was not able to pursue her studies due to life difficulties. At present, the family stands firm and helps one another to surpass the hardships of life.

Lucrecia is a vegetable vendor in their village. Most of the time, she earns a daily income of PHP 200 that they budget for the immediate needs of her family. She wants to improve her business and for this she is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000. She will use the additional capital to improve her small enterprise. She is hoping that with the financial assistance she is requesting, and through the help of God, she will be able to expand her business and earn a higher income to better provide for the needs of her family. She is thankful that her three children are very responsible and helpful in their poor level of living conditions.

loans.use: To invest in her business selling vegetables.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites raises hogs and then sells them after four months. She would like to start an electronic loading business as another source of income. She is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000 that she can use as business capital to pursue her plan. This simple business will surely be of great help to her family. Her family wants to experience a better way of life. She and her husband work together to earn a living. She hopes that her loan will be granted and she can start her plans. Hopefully their income will increase so that they can provide for the education of their children.

Marites is married to Edgardo and they were blessed with three children. Chrismary is 15 years old and attends third year high school; Charmaine is 14 years old and attends second year high school; and Mark John is 12 years old and attends first year high school. Marites hopes that they may be able to continue to support the education of their children until college. She is looking forward to seeing them finish their studies.

loans.use: To start a new electronic loading business.

loans.name: Camilo

texts.en:
Camilo is a widower who lives in the simple village of San Juan Quirino, Isabela, with his four children: Leo (32), George (23) and Camilo Jr. (28) are high school graduates, and Arnold (30) is a Computer Science graduate and is presently employed as a checker in the National Irrigation Association (NIA). Camilo Jr. helps Camilo in their farm.

Camilo operates a passenger tricycle in his village. Aside from this, he is also engaged in farming, which is the major source of income for his family. His income from the tricycle is utilized to provide for his farming needs. He requests a loan of PHP 4,000 for the maintenance of his motorcycle and also for meeting his farming needs. He is also planning to start a hog-raising business to generate additional income. He says life should go on inspite of his wife’s death and believes that God is with him always.

loans.use: Tricycle maintenance

loans.name: Umeda

texts.ru: Умеда - женщина 36 лет. Вдова и мать 2-х детей. Её муж умер несколько лет назад и она осталась одна со своими детьми. Она занимается откормом скота дома. Её брат помогает ей продавать скот на скотном рынке. Так как в сельской местности нет другой работы, ей приходится заниматься мужской работой. Ведь ей нужно прокормить и вырастить своих детей. Умеда очень надеется, что наш кредит поможет ей в достижении её цели.
texts.en:
Umeda is a woman of 36 years of age. She is a widow and a mother of two children. Her husband has passed away several years ago and she was left alone with her children. She raises cattle at home. Her brother helps her sells the cattle on the market. There's no other work in the villages and she has to do a man's job. She needs to feed and raise her children. Umeda is very hopeful that this loan will help her achieve her goals.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Feeding and selling of cattle

loans.name: Federico

texts.en:
Federico is 54 years old and married to his supportive and responsible wife, Aurelia. They are blessed with three children: Cheryl, 34; Heraldy, 30; and Ma. Grace, 27. They live peacefully in the village of San Juan, Quirino, Isabela. Federico works as a tricycle driver in the village. He is glad that he can earn a daily income of PHP 300-500 pesos, which is mainly spent in supporting his family’s needs. He is proud that through his income he was able to send his children to school. However, he feels sad that his children couldn’t seek jobs due to limited opportunities. 

To further improve his business, he would like to borrow a loan of PHP 4,000 for the maintenance of his tricycle and hopefully to be able to start a hog-raising business. His wife is eager to help him with the new business that he is planning to start, while he will continue with his tricycle transport operation. Federico believes cooperation and hard work is the key to successful business.

loans.use: Tricycle maintenance

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma D. V. is a simple entrepreneur.  She sells fish balls in her village using her improvised nutria-cart.  She is 38 years old and married to Gilbert, a carpenter.  They resiD. peacefully in the village of Rizal Quirino, Isabela with their two children: Algietfae, 10 years old, is a graD. school student and Janefpypper, 8 years old, is also in graD. school. Alma is thankful that they have a healthy family.  

She wants to improve her business and hopefully put up a small store so she can have additional income.  She now wants a loan of at least PHP 7,000.00 as business capital.  According to Alma, through her good relationship with her customers, she is able to generate a good income.  Someday, she is also planning to engage in vegetable and rice vending.  She hopes that through her business, she can continue to proviD. the school allowance for her children and they can finish their studies.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Arturo

texts.en:
Arturo R. is 53 years old and lives in Rizal, Quirino, Isabela.  He has two children: Aldritz and Bernadette.  Aldritz is 24 years old, unable to finish his primary education because of difficulty in speaking and he now helps him in their farm; Benadette, 22 years old, finished a one-year course in criminology, but is still unemployed.  

Arturo works as a tricycle driver in their village.  He gives at least PHP 200.00 per day to the tricycle owner as his boundary and the rest of his income is for his family.  Aside from working as a lease tricycle driver, Arturo is also busy on his farm where he plants and sells vegetables for extra income.  With this, he wants to borrow a loan of PHP 8,000.00 that he will use in cultivating his vegetables.  He is hoping that through his business, he can provide a better life for his family and hopefully he can have his own motorcycle in the future.

loans.use: Business capital to cultivate his vegetables

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is already 22 years old. She is married to a farmer, Bert P., and is a mother of three children. They are currently residing in Barangay Rizal of Quirino, Isbaela. Her eldest child is Christine Joy; she is six years old and studying in a preparatory school. Her second child is Christlene, five years old and the youngest is Skylene who is just two years old. Erlinda, being a young mother is trying her best to become a good mother to her three children. She was proud having them. 

Erlinda wants to borrow a loan that will be used to expand her vending business. She hopes to buy a piglet to raise in her vacant pig housing where she could invest some of her income from vending. She also sometimes sells fruits when she has extra capital. Erlinda is now requesting a loan of PHP5,000. She is dreaming of having more income and savings for the future of her family, especially her three daughters. She wants to send all her children to school. That is why she is trying to exert more effort in selling and at the same time pursue her planned hog raising somehow.

loans.use: Business capital to expand vending business

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad is engaged in vegetable vending in her village of Barangay Rizal, Quirino, Isabela. She is 52 years old and married to Mario, her business partner. The couple was gifted with six children: Ena is 33 years old and a high school graduate; M. is 31 years old and an elementary undergraduate; Florence is 27 years old and a high school graduate; Rizaldy is 24 years old and in the first year of college; Trimar is 18 years old; and the youngest is Jenifer, who is 13 years old and who will be in the first year of high school this coming school year. The couple is working hard to send their children to school and hoping that they will earn college degrees.

Vending is their only source of income. Trinindad and her husband are doing their best to support the immediate needs of their family and the educational needs of their children. She hopes to borrow PHP 8,000.00, which will assist her in her vending business. She hoped that through this loan, her income will increase and her family will have a progressive way of living. In spite of the difficulties she experiences in selling her products, she continues to work hard for the future of her children.

loans.use: To expand her vegetable business

loans.name: Patricidra

texts.en:
Patricidra S. is married to Danilo Sr. Their marriage was blessed with four children: Danilo is 38 years old; the twins Rowena and Ronald are 31 years old and both are high school graduates; the youngest, Quincy, is 22 years old and a college student. They live in Rizal, Quirino, Isabela, a place that has rough road conditions and that is far from the public market.

Patricia is into direct selling business of Avon products. With her need of additional capital, she is now asking for a loan of PHP 8,000.00 that she will use for her direct selling business. She promised herself to exert more effort in selling to have additional income for the education of her youngest daughter.

loans.use: Improve her Avon selling business

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a vegetable vendor in her village. She buys vegetables in bulk and then sells them at retail price. She is planning to expand her business in order to increase her income. Therefore, she would like to request a loan of PHP 7,000.00. Teresita believes she must be diligent enough to work hard to achieve her goals and send her children to school so they can have a better future. She hopes that her business will continue to grow and that she will have a permanent business stall in the market.

Teresita is now 40 years old. Her husband Bernando is working as a farmer. They live in the village of Rizal, Quirino, Isabela with their two children: Mary Ann is 17 years old and in her first year of college, and Mary Jane is 15 years old and in her fourth year of high school. Teresita is thankful her family is still happy even in times of crisis. She hopes and prays to God that her family will remain healthy and away from any harm.

loans.use: To expand her vegetable business

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia is a vegetable and meat vendor in their village in Rizal, Quirino, Isabela. She is requesting a loan amount of PHP 4,000 that she will use to improve her vending business and hopefully help it become a sustainable one. She hopes that, through her business, she can provide for the needs of her family. She prays that her loan request will be approved by the lenders.

Olivia has been married for almost 30 years to her husband Gregorio. She is now 48 years old and their two children are: Jenerson, 26 years old, high school graduate and Alvin, 24 years old, a technician. They live simply in their village and love developing camaraderie among their fellow men in their community.

loans.use: To improve her vegetable and meat vending business
